hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Definitely the best place we have ever stayed in NYC. The location is perfect for staying near the Theater District. We found it very relaxing to return from a night at the theater and visit the lounge. We will return!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Returned to the Casablanca for the New Year's Eve package. Loved everything about it! All staff is attentive, professional, accommodating, and helpful in everyway. They have a rooftop view of the ball dropping in Times Square! The package included dinner and a show at Tony's next door. And New Year's day breakfast at Brooklyn Diner next door. Everything was perfect. We will do it again! Book early as they sell out.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: All staffs were so friendly and helpful The room was compact but clean.I could not understand the air conditioner.Breakfast was so good!All bread was good. I wanna eat those now!!When I come to NY anytime,I want to stay this hotel

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca really deserves its reputation. I guess it’s very small by NY standards, but the experience is superb. Location is spot on, staff attentive without being overbearing, rooms comfortable and homely. Highly recommended

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A hidden gem in a great location and a real bargain for NYC. Room was a tad on the smallish side but it's the city. Bathrobe, slippers and a safe in room a plus!Complimentary cocktail hour, tea and coffee service and a continental buffet breakfast. Cozy seating areas.Not modern or trendy but cute and comfortable.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel gets what it means to serve their customers; Chocolates on the pillow, wine hour and slippers! They know how to make their guests feel special. The location and staff are top notch. We will be back!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The location of this hotel is perfect. Right near Times Square but once in the Hotel you are in a quiet haven and get away from the hustle and bustle. Although our room was small it was very clean with excellent facilities and a comfortable bed. Just what we needed for a 5 night stay. The continental breakfast had a good selection of pastries, breads, bagels, fresh fruit etc. The cheese and wine in an evening was a welcome treat as was the provision of tea/coffee and pastries throughout the day.All the staff were amazing; they couldn't do enough for us. They also recommended some great restaurants.I would definitely book this hotel when returning to New York.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Extremely nice and perfectly located hotel with a very welcoming atmosphere. Spacious rooms (for Manhattan standards) that are very well kept. Friendly and most helpfull staff. Definitely to be recommended.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Coming into Penn Station, Take Subway 1,2 or 3 Uptown, only one stop going uptown, After staying for a couple of days to check it out in spring, we are back for a week long visit. Bags were held as we arrived before check in, as we caught a show on our first day. We stayed in a King premium bedroom, inside. Room is very good size- remember this is NYC,. Confirming reviews that this is a most excellent hotel. Perfect service form doormen, desk, maids and waitstaff at Rick's. This is one property that you actually receive great deal for the resort fee, wi-fi, day long cappucino, espresso, coffee, snacks. Very nice continental breakfast- with fresh fruit, pastries, cereals, bagels, juice, hard boiled eggs- you will eat here for breakfast every day. Evening vino, cheese, veggies, popcorn. At first our room was cold, but staff adjusted the radiator valve, then occasionally we opened bathroom window- this was no problem, Refrigerator can be ordered- Whole foods around the corner for beers, snack, hard water. Perfect location to major subway lines or buses, Times square around the corner for shows etc- Check out TKS for discount tickets same day.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Yes it lived upto ratings. Great location near Times Square and Theater District. Room pretty large with big bathroom. Looked newly renovated. A bit noisy, but they provde earplugs and sound machine! Staff was exceptional. Price was very reasonable. Can't wait to go back.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I have been staying here once or twice a tear for the past 10 years or so. Location, price and amenities are second to none. Ricks Cafe, the hospitality room, is something you rarely see i the city. It’s the best kept secret in New York.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Returning to the Casablanca after a couple of years was very much like coming home. All of the things from service to amenities that we loved are still going strong! The staff always greets you with a smile and are more than happy to help. Keep up the awesome work!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Right in the heart of the theater district, very convenient to everything we planned to do, with a parking garage right next door (which gives a discount to hotel guests). Excellent staff, clean, nicely appointed room/bathroom, comfortable bed, and Rick's Cafe, which had snacks and refreshments available at all times. We stayed in a Premium King and while not a huge room (but large by NYC standards), it was very comfortable for the two of us. We were on the fifth floor just down the hall and around the corner from the elevator and it was very quiet. There was ample closet space, a bistro table and chairs, large, comfortable bed, and the bathroom was bigger than I expected with a full tub/shower combo with pretty tiling. There was even a lighted makeup mirror in the room, which I greatly appreciated, since most hotel bathrooms have terrible lighting for applying makeup. The channel selection on the tv wasn't extensive, but we weren't in the city to watch tv, so that didn't matter much to us. Rick's Cafe was a treat--a very nice, comfortable space to hang out at any time of day, The staff, particularly Jeffrey, were all very friendly, kind and helpful. One minor inconvenience was that the room didn't have an adjustable thermostat. The room was overly warm when we arrived, and although a staff member adjusted the valve on the radiator, it didn't help much and we had to leave the bathroom window open to cool the room down. Otherwise, the accommodation was perfect in just about every way. I would definitely return.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Always a wonderful, comfortable stay at the Casablanca! The minute their "always with a smile" doorman opens the door for you, you are special! You are happily greeted by James, Stanley or another great staff member! And when it is time to leave, the best part is you know you will be coming "home" again soon to the Casablanca.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The location is perfect! You can see Times Square, Broadway shows, shopping, Central Park and access to almost any subway line. The breakfast buffet is a great way to start the day. The wine and cheese reception in the afternoon is a great way to unwind, and meet others staying at the hotel. We met so many people who return again and again to this hotel because of the amenities. Housekeeping kept our room very neat and tidy. And the evening chocolate treat was sweet indeed! The front desk staff is knowledgeable about everything in NY. Their polite acknowledgement of each guest coming or going really made it homey.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I would definitely recommend this gem located right in the heart of Midtown. Excellent customer service - they can't do enough for you. The location near Times Square can't be beat. And the room was clean and very nicely arranged.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed here for a girls trip and loved everything about the hotel. The 24/7 snacks/coffee/etc and the free breakfast was a nice added bonus. The front desk staff was phenomenal and very welcoming. Proximity to Times Square was convenient and we had NO road noise in our room!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We had an excellent stay at the Casablanca Hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and quiet. The cleanliness and decor of the hotel was outstanding. You want for nothing when staying here.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This was our 5th visit to the Casablanca . We were there to celebrate my 60th birthday with friends and family. From the moment we arrived the staff make you feel special and several thoughtful touches such as a chilled bottle of Prosecco in the room all add to the feeling of being a valued customer. The rooms are not large though are very comfortable and well furnished. The included breakfast and cheese and wine offered daily are superb and the staff that serve these are so friendly and welcoming. A recent addition to the rooms is a small refrigerator which we welcomed. The location of the hotel is brilliant as so close to Times Square just outside the door, however when you enter the hotel it just feels so calm and tranquil with fantastic soundproofing against the general noise in the area. This hotel knows what it wants to be ! If you are wanting an anonymous high tech trendy environment this is not for you. If you want charming, friendly comfortable and excellent quality, don't hesitate and book ! We found this hotel a few years ago after many years of bed hopping around the city, we have finally found where we want to be when we visit New York.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great small hotel, very comfortable and really quiet. You are in the middle of Time square and our room was completely quiet. Nice Breakfast. Great lounge and happy hour. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Wonderful staff. They were very accommodating and helpful. Rick’s was a great space for breakfast and evening reception. We also used this space to relax after a long day if sightseeing. Rooms were well kept and comfortable. Great location in Time Square. We loved this hotel!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for a long valentines weekend. We choose Casablanca based on its location and reviews. We were not disappointed. The room was very clean and nicely furnished. The staff was exceptional, very friendly and helpful. Breakfast and wine and cheese after five included in room rate. We will look for other hotels in this group for future travels.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Close enough to Times Square and subway but far enough away not to be bothered by the noise, etc. We stayed in the mini-suite with a king bed...perfect and plenty of room. Staff was outstanding as was the breakfast and social hour each day! Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Booked with a large group for a girlfriends 50th birthdayThe hotel went well above expectations.We were a bit loud at times but they accomodated us extremely well.I like that what they advertise they actually provide.Front desk would assist with anything, bookings, recommendations, directions etc nothing was too much trouble.We have srayed in NY before but I will now only stay here.To be able to get a free coffee at anytime throughout the day is great as most NY hotels gave no tea or coffee facilities in the room.Free cheese and wine was a great place for us to meet and gave a pre dinner drink before hitting the town.All the sraff were sooo helpful and friendly. One name that srands out was StanleyThe location is a 1 min or less to times square.You will hear the occasional police or ambulance sirens but you are in the heart of NY.Beds really comfortable.This place was so great I want to go back with another group and familyBest find on our 4 weeks stay Thankyou sooo muchYou made a great 50th birthday a fabulous experience

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Brilliant location, fantastic staff, warm and homely, drinks and nibbles a wonderful touch. Could not fault this place for how special they made me and my friends feel during a week long 50th birthday celebration.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This was a top-notch hotel! The staff was very attentive and friendly. The hotel was very clean, with many amenities such as a wine and cheese reception from 5:00 - 8:00 and 24/7 coffee! Rooms were comfortable and very clean. The decor was beautiful! I wish I could have stayed longer.
user_name:
DraCampos
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: From the moment you walk into the Casablanca Hotel, you are greeted with a warm generous smile. Stanley and James were always on hand to assist our large group of friends, nothing was a problem. Brian coordinated our bookings. John was always around to ensure we were being looked after. Rooms are big enough. They are so quiet given Time Square is on your doorstep. The living space on level 2 was a relaxing, made better by wine and cheese every afternoon, coffee and pastries all day and the fresh continental breakfast was perfect. Thank you all!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Fantastic in every way! Can not recommend highly enough. You are made to feel like one of the family from the moment you arrive. We were a large group & every need/request was met without hesitation. Staff went above & beyond. Special mention to Stanley, James, Brian & John. We can't wait to return.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We went to NYC to see "Frozen the Musical" to celebrate my birthday and also my granddaughter's. It was my daughter, 2 granddaughters and me. We loved the Casablanca. It was so clean and had great amenities! It is our new "Go TO" place to stay. All of the staff are so nice. Victor at the front desk was such a wonderful help and so sweet! (Hey Victor-I hope you get to take your child to see Frozen). Unfortunately, I can't remember his name but the doorman was adorable. Always there with a smile, any help and to take pictures. The night staff and the lounge staff were wonderful too. The wine and cheese, the cookies and the breakfast were all wonderful, plenty of everything. We did have an issue with our toilet but the night staff had someone there in 10 minutes to fix it and they were so apologetic. It was a wonderful experience and even my granddaughters felt special and had a blast! Thank you all to the staff for their warm welcome. We will be back. PS we highly recommend Tony's DiNapoli right next door-there is a connecting door but definitely make reservations. It was fabulous!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great location for going uptown or downtown. Quiet room. Love the all day coffee/tea and cookies, the breakfast has everything most people would want, and the happy hour. Room isin great shape as is the bathroom

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Very convenient for trips to go to the theater. Easy to get everywhere by walking or subway. Very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms comfortable. but not huge. If you want to stretch out, go down to the lounge on the second floor where they serve a continental breakfast, have snacks all day, 24 hour espresso/tea, TV, newspapers, daily Happy Hour. People actually socialize there. Beats the rat race at the big impersonal hotels. We stay there a couple times a year. Check out the New Year's Eve Special. We went for that a few years ago and now we keep coming back for long weekends.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Our suite was roomy and very comfortable. Big closet, adequate drawer space, more easily accessed electrical outlets than anywhere, good beds. And a nice communal space on the second floor with free breakfast and snacks.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We have been here several trips and the quality has been consistent. Great location in heart of Time Square, thu Hotel has a homey vibe where you can relax and unwind with coffee, latte, etc. Nice breakfast and wine and cheese every day. Comfortable and clean rooms. Overall, a good value.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We enjoyed this hotel so very much. The location was perfect, the staff friendly and accommodating, and the rooms comfortable. We enjoyed the breakfast . We will be visiting this hotel again! Thank you!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: 2nd Time here. Will stay again!,,Everyone was friendly and helpful. Great location in Times Square. Room was super clean and comfortable. Love 2 nd floor with coffee and newspapers. Felt very safe. And next to Tony’s.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We just returned from a wonderful weekend stay at Casablanca. It is our new favorite New York hotel. The staff was friendly and welcoming from the second we walked in until the moment we left. The breakfast and evening reception added to our enjoyment. The location was the so convenient. We will be back!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Stayed with a group of individuals for a tradeshow that we were attending. The room was a bit smaller than what I am accustomed to (but hey it's NYC... historical and space is at a premium!!) but the location and service could not be beaten. Located a very short walk to Times Square, we made the trip a few times. Great bar with food located next door.The wine and cheese reception was fantastic and the complimentary breakfast the following morning was so appreciated rather than having to go out and find a restaurant before heading to our conference and it was definitely a great value add.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is my new favorite place to stay in mid-town. Settle into your room, then walk to Bryant Park, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, attend the theatre, etc. Return for their lovely Happy Hour. Jefrey at the lobby door was especially considerate. James arranged for a special greeting and Stanley enabled us to get into our room early. Thank you to all staff.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Excellent hotel and group! The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. We recommend this property and any of the Library Hotel properties in NY or elsewhere as they all share the same excellent service attitude - that you are family.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Another magnificent, comfortable stay in this little slice of heaven in the big city! Warm, friendly, exemplary staff welcome you and cannot do enough to make your stay pleasurable! Rooms are cozy, immaculate and comfortable. The amenities cannot be topped. Breakfast and wine reception are superb - a true bonus of the stay! Fresh delicious food with wonderful servers! Perfectly located, it is a true first class location in every way. Would never stay anywhere else!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: OK, all hotels have pros and cons. But, the cons with this one are nits and the pros are exceptional. Great location, but minimal street noise. Well appointed rooms, bigger than most Manhattan hotels. Decent breakfast spread, even better evening wine and cheese reception. But, the real clincher here is the staff. The friendliest, most helpful hotel staff I have ever encountered. If you want to be near Times Square in a place that welcomes you and in which you feel at home, you can't beat the Casablanca Hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Amazing first time stay at the Casablanca. Staff were so friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel was spotless. The 3hr wine and cheese every evening was just what we wanted after a busy day of sight seeing. We will definitely be returning!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Nothing but great things to say about this hotel. The staff is amazing, pleasant and very helpful. The rooms are cozy and quaint and extremely clean. Ricks Cafe offers a nice breakfast and wine and cheese reception in evening. This is perfect before heading out to dinner. This was our second stay at The Casablanca and we can’t wait to go back!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This was a wonderful hotel to stay in for my first trip to NYC. Being so close to Times Square, it was a convenient location for going to Broadway shows. I loved that they had the three hour wine and snacks. I made sure to have a couple drinks before going out to a show. The espresso bar was also amazing! Was able to make a cappuccino and grab a bagel before heading out to explore the city for the day. I already have recommended this hotel since returning home two days ago.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We love this hotel. It is our home away from home. Perfectly located in the center of the city, it’s a quiet little sanctuary nestled in the middle of all the hustle and bustle. We have thought about staying other places but no place gives you that comfortable feeling of staying with family like the Casablanca.
user_name:
mmerewitz2020
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: What an amazing stay, while I love the hustle and bustle of the city I also enjoy somewhere to wind down. When you walk into this hotel it's like stepping into a new world, a quaint location where you can instantly relax from the city. The furnishes, decor, and amenities make it worth the stay but the staff puts this hotel over the top. They worked to no end to make sure you enjoyed the experience of staying there. This was truly an amazing hotel experience and where I will be staying anytime I come to the NYC.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I think this might be my favorite hotel in New York. Super cozy. Rooms are classic and comfy. And the lounge, called Rick's Cafe, feels like a home away from home. The continental breakfast and the wine and cheese happy hours are cheery and generous. It's hard to believe you're around the corner from one of the world's most exciting theater districts. Staff is super friendly. Go.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Super location. Quiet oasis, right near Times Square. Not super fancy, but super welcoming and comfortable. As others have said, staff were very friendly. Breakfast spread was good. Evening wine and cheese a nice touch. A great option for familys and folks who want quality but don't want to spend all their money on a hotel room.
user_name:
cdaven291004
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The hotel was now and the staff was very friendly. I gave this an average review because I felt that the hotel was just that. It was nice to have the second floor area to relax and hang out and the staff were outstanding.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great hotel in a great location. Superb staff who were professional, efficient and friendly. Breakfast, refreshments and wine and cheese reception exceeded our expectations. Room was spacious, as was the bathroom. We will only stay at the Casablanca on future trips to NYC!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is a homey, very friendly hotel just 100 feet from time square, and 43rd St. The second floor has a very large breakfast and wine area with fireplace multiple TVs and fabulous free breakfast New York Times And evening wine. It is decorated in the Casablanca O’Keefe.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Lovely, comfortable, clean room with a very nice bathroom. Continental breakfast in Rick's cafe is the perfect way to start the day and the nightly happy hour is very nice. The staff is so friendly and helpful. And the location is great!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel is a little gem in the middle of a very busy area. It is kind of old-fashioned, in a nice way. The staff goes above and beyond to make you feel at home. Every person who works there is so nice and helpful and pleasant.The room was nice. A little small, maybe. But the furnishings were lovely, especially the spacious tiled bathroom. The room was also surprisingly quiet, especially given the location of the hotel. The breakfast was great. The food was really good and there were a lot of choices. Away the room is set up, you end up talking to other guests (if you want to) and that is really fun. In the dining room, the staff was extremely helpful. For example, they went out back to find me a plain yogurt and then to heat up my oatmeal and bring it to me even though I think technically I was supposed to do it myself. They were just really nice.I had a little issue with the New York Sports Club —access to it is one of the amenities that you get for your $25 resort fee —and I thought I should let other guests know about it. And overly aggressive member, who was sharing the lane with me, kicked my foot so hard that he literally broke my toe. I had to go the clinic and an X -ray confirmed this. Although I told the manager, Michele, in a phone conversation and a letter and sent her pictures, she never returned my phone calls nor indicated that she had addressed the situation. So I’m writing this in order to warn other people to be careful if they go to the health club. I do not think it is well-managed. And how it is managed stands in such stark contrast to the graciousness of the hotel that it is shocking. I do recommend that people stay at this lovely hotel. They could not of been nicer to me, getting me ice and so on and making sure that I was OK when I told them i was injured.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The staff was just fabulous, young, vibrant, social with never-ending smiles. The location is perfect, steps from Time Square close to Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, City Library. Not a five star hotel, but next time I'm in NYC I will stay again, the rooms were small but clean and the 2nd floor lounge open 24-7 was perfect to meet up with fellow travelers, good breakfast and afternoon wine/cheese. Great value. Thank you to a world class staff.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Very nice hotel with a great location right off Times Square. the room was clean and comfortable. Coffee and snacks were available all of the time, with wine and snacks in the late afternoon and nice breakfast in the morning. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We love staying at the Casablanca! We have stayed here many times.You're close enough of the hustle and bustle of times square and all of the Broadway shows but when you need a quiet time to re- generate you just head to the Casablanca! They provide a great Continental breakfast and wine and cheese at 5-8 which is just enough before the show!Rooms are quiet and clean and the staff is very friendly!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My wife and I always stay at the Casablanca Hotel. Only one time in ten years for our birthdays we couldn’t stay because the hotel was booked. Never again! Quaint, comfortable, impeccable and delicious!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A beautiful hotel, aged beauty preserved perfectly. With its gorgeous lounge, cute little rooms with creaky floors it feels like going back in time, but with espresso and USB charging and wifi. From the moment you enter, the service is amazing in every respect, Welcoming, comforting and very attentive to your every need. A really lovely stay.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The new year package that the hotel offer is worth every single cent! From the moment you arrive you are taken care of by all the fantastic staff. John the hotel manager sets this standard with his super friendly and helpful manner! The hotel is situated in the perfect location for the NY celebrations and exploring NYC plus the view of the the ball dropping is fantastic. We highly highly recommend this hotel. Thank you, we will definitely be returning! Steve & Sarah

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Stayed at the Casablanca for their New Year's Eve celebration 2019 to 2020 - an AMAZING experience! John and his team are FANTASTIC! Venue is beautiful and right in the heart of the city! You will not be sorry!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is a lovely old-fashioned boutique hotel, just steps from Times Square. Literally - maybe 20 steps. Diner on one side, Italian restaurant on the other. Walgreens a 3-4 minute walk. Rooms charming and although the bathroom was not expansive, it WAS roomy enough for comfort and was beautifully tiled with beautiful fixtures. Service was terrific at the Casablanca and we’d definitely go back to stay there again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Thank you for your GREAT Hospitality‼️ We enjoyed every minute at your hotel. The staff and management made us feel like family. It is a close knit employee environment. Everyone there loved their jobs. Great Job. Keep up the great work.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Exceptional hotel. Location is steps from Times Square. First night radiator made news, it was fixed promptly. Wonderful staff. Boutique hotel that is big on service. Also very quiet rooms and very clean.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I cannot say enough amazing things about this hotel! The staff is wonderful and makes you feel right at home. We booked the New Years Eve package and it far exceeded my expectations. The view of the ball drop on the rooftop is spectacular and they even took us down past the barricades for a few minutes to be right in front of it. Definitely a once in a lifetime experience that I would love to do again. The food from the restaurant Tony's connected to the restaurant is wonderful as well. A special thank you to the GM of the hotel John, he is one of the kindest people I have ever met. You can tell he takes care of his staff and truly cares about them and the hotel guests.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A small boutique hotel where nothing is too much trouble. We wouldn’t stay anywhere else in NY. Perfect location, very comfortable, fantastic staff and a wonderful hands-on manager who makes it all work.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The hotel is a gem in the middle of Times Square. The staff, room, amenities, etc were over the top perfect. This was my first trip to NY and the hotel was great. We had help with near by restaurants, how to get around on the subway and a wonderful New Years Eve party. Being able to go down on the street to see all of the people and fun without having to stand out there all day was well worth everything. We had a very quiet room and you would never know you were in the middle of the city inside the hotel. Cheers! We will be back!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We absolutely loved this hotel, and specially booked it for the New Year Ball drop view. The hotel takes care of everything for its guests. The check in was easy and all the staff are friendly and so helpful. Special shout out to Julian and Johan who never failed to answer our questions with a smile. The room was really quiet and all amenities were provided. The New Year Eve party was well organized and all guests were treated to free wine, cocktails and food! The pass they give out are so good as we got to view the ball drop really close. Will definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This was our second stay at the Casablanca. We live the homey feeling of the lounge area and the snacks available all day long! The wine and cheese reception in the evening is great as is the location of the hotel. Just steps from Times Square but you don’t hear street traffic in the rooms. The staff is very friendly and helpful as well!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: If you are looking for a great place to stay while visiting Times Squares and in particular to view the Ball Drop directly with unhindered view, Casablanca on 43rd Street is an excellent place. ....Very friendly staff, very quiet rooms, (interior facing rooms are great), very clean, excellent continental breakfast, conveniently located. Just a super hotel and just as good as advertised. Their New Year’s Eve event was well organized and super fun. Attending it enables you to avoid the long wait in the big crowds and an up close view of the Ball drop. Thanks to all of the folks working at the Casablanca for a great experience!!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This was our third time in this lovely, friendly oasis of calm literally just off of Times Square. We were greeted upon check in with warmth you only get from the staff at the hotel. "Welcome back" as soon as we walked through the door. Also would like to mention James too gave us a great reception when we met later that day. You just don't get this service at the big hotels. Our room was warm and and always had everything you need from the bottles of water to the lovely toiletries and slippers. Our bathroom was nice size and we had fresh fluffy towels every day. Very comfortable bed. Great housekeeping.The hotel offers continental breakfast which was more than adequate and tea and coffee are served 24 hours in Ricks Cafe which also is a lovely touch but how can you beat the cheese and wine hours???? Lovely touch `as always and a great time to chat and meet people you probably wouldn't normally.Tony's adjoining the hotel is a fabulous place to eat and you don't have to take your coat! They have a connecting door. Be sure to make a reservation otherwise prepared to bee disappointed or have a few hours wait. The hotel can reserve for you too.If you want a flash "corporate"hotel then The Casablanca isnt for you but we love this hotel and to be honest while they are doing what they do best this is only our choice when visiting NYC - no question.Thank you to everyone at The Casablanca - hopefully see you very soon.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: It is relatively close to subways. The wine and snacks from 5:00 until 8:00 were nice. Whatever you need the staff is willing to help in any way they can. Location is great to get to the museums or theatres in town.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I love this hotel. I have stayed at 3 hotels in New York and this by far has been the best. It's right on Times Square. The staff is excellent. They have a delicious breakfast and happy hour daily. It's clean and quaint.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The staff is very genuine & attentive. Love the 2nd floor cafe & common area. Very nice extended continental breakfast & happy hour. We celebrated Christmas there & the staff was ever so kind. There were several guests who had been coming for Christmas year over year. Loyal client base.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Our party of four stayed here for 5 nights. The location is brilliant. The staff are super friendly. The rooms and beds are very comfortable. It was lovely to have access to Rick’s cafe. The breakfast is good with plenty of fresh fruit and coffee and drinks available all day. The evening cheese and wine was a lovely opportunity to meet others. As well as cheese there was crudités, olives and fruit on offer. Having breakfast and some fruit/veg snacks in the evening brought a great balance to the bad eating habits that can take over holidays. We will definitely return.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We are repeated guests at lovely Casablanca hotel, it has become over the years our favorite “home” in NYC .From the very moment you town car stops in front of the hotel entrance ...you know you are back home. From bellman,to reception and concierge everyone is happy to welcome you!! Such wonderful people!!Rick’s lounge is awaiting with cookies and hot/cold beverages all day long,the “Cheese and wine” hours is the gathering spot for the elegant guests of the house.Breakfast is my “important” meal and Casablanca never disappoints: one of the cheerful ladies, Hunda (?) from Casablanca (the real city), took such a wonderful care of my needs that ...I did not want to leave NY !!What a wonderful staff and service!!Only a small CAVEAT : for the first time ever, this year we stayed at Casablanca in December, COLD season, weather below 0C (32F) To our dismay,our deluxe room was cold :( Someone promptly came in and tried to fix the heating unit;several hours later ...room was still cold. We called Concierge and, again, very promptly, the same bellman arrived and VERY KINDLY offered/ installed in the bedroom a small EFFECTIVE electric heater. He explained that … :] weather wasn’t cold enough to turn the central heating system on!!! :] :] Hum,this to me sounds at least ...naif.Is this a wonderful hotel? Yes,for sure.Would I return in Winter time ? Probably not.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: If one could dream of a quaint hotel that is perfectly located with staff that treats you like friends and are willing to provide one with the attention that makes it feel like home. Casablanca has it all and there is no place better place to stay when visiting Manhattan.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The people are awesome. You are right on 43 and broadway but there is NO noise in your room at all. There is no room service. There is no room thermostat. You have to use a radiator control. When you open the door the door hits a chair. I would stay again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Perfect location, super friendly and accommodating staff, luxurious rooms and complimentary breakfast and happy hour! Casablanca Hotel is an outstanding hotel b in the heart of Times Square. This is the best deal ever.
user_name:
Adrienjohn
Bath, North Carolina, United States

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Once you are inside, this hotel is a great respite from the hustle bustle of Times Square. It is so convenient, the staff is great, the rooms beautiful and the lounge area is so lovely. It is so nice to stop by and have some coffee, a cookie (or two) in the middle of the day.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We love to stay at the Casablanca. It is in the heart of Times Square, but is a quiet respite away from the crowds. Rooms are small but cozy. Staff are always more than accommodating. Would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We love the Casablanca Hotel. It is our first choice when staying in Manhattan. The staff are incredibly friendly. The breakfast buffet, afternoon tea, and open service are not only delicious, but the lounge where they are served is a great place to meet other guests.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We recently travelled to New York in December and stayed in the Casablanca. Unlike large chain hotels, this hotel chain is friendly and personable with the staff wanting to share places to see, visit and some tricks of the city. The hotel room we had was spacious and contained all that you would need on a 3/4 day city break.The 5pm-7pm cheese and wine evening time was very welcome, after a day of walking the city, allowing you to relax and chill. The breakfast did not have a cooked option, but there was enough choice for many diets. The location was very good, just off Time Square. After reading a few reviews on Trip Advisor, we plugged for this hotel. But I would re-emphasise that you are staying in a city, with all the noises that a major city creates, police sirens, fire engines and honking of horns, even at 3am in the morning! The double glazed windows can only shut out so much noise! This is not a criticism, just something to be aware of when booking the hotel. The trade off is being able to walk pretty much everywhere in Mid-Town New York City! Being a special birthday for one of the party, the hotel provided a complimentary bottle of wine in the room, which was a lovely treat. I would thoroughly reccomend this hotel and go back again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: If the fact that it is practically in Times Square doesn’t sway you, then the coziest and the brilliant and caring staff should. We stay here 3 or 4 times a year when in NYC and John, the general manager and his staff always welcome us with open arms. It is truly home away from home.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I can only reiterate all the other reviews and say this is a fantastic little hotel.The staff will do anything for you. The beds are comfy. The rooms clean. The decor pleasant.An oasis of calm in the madness of Times Square.
user_name:
tonyarmes
Isle of Wight, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is our 5th stay here .Great location for theater and Times Square. Top notch service.Good continental breakfast and wine and cheese in the evenings. Small and quiet oasis steps away from Times Square.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We love NY during the holidays and always stay at the Casablanca. Friendly staff who we appreciate as they always make sure you feel at home. Lovely breakfast and cocktail hour; we enjoy Ric's for the casual atmosphere and have met wonderful people who gather together and share tips of what to see and do in NY. Rooms are always spotless and quiet even though Time Square is right around the corner.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Such a fabulous welcome and a beautiful clean and stylish hotel - the staff are amazing and so friendly - decor is full of character and having the Ricks Cafe on site for complimentary tea coffee cookies and cakes 24-7 is a great extra - 2 minutes from Times Square but the hotel offers a calm cosy feel away from the crowds and business of the centre - Tony’s restaurant is adjacent and offers a super vibe and amazing food. Our room was a suite on the 5th floor and was very spacious with a large wardrobe area sofa and iron and ironing board - a mini fridge and very comfy bed - I would go back to stay at Casablanca anytime I visited New York in the future and would recommend to anyone looking for something unique and special but want to be close to everything. We walked uptown and downtown with ease as the location is right in the middle of everything.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A Hidden Gem in the middle of Times Square! Great hotel and staff ! Loved the snacks and coffees! I would recommend this hotel the hotel was very clean and comfortable. The staff was extremely accommodating! This is a wonderful hotel. Do yourself a favor and stay at the Casablanca Hotel. Wonderful Breakfast!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The location of this hotel is great for those exploring midtown Manhattan by foot or wanting to take in the many theatres in the area. The second floor is a lounge where breakfast, an extended happy hour with wine and cheese, and coffee and treats throughout the day are available. The lounge feels like a living room and it encourages guests to mingle.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Recent stay in New York, did not know this hotel before we arrived but were very pleased. Room was comfortable and clean, Hotel is clean, has character, staff really friendly, all day tea and coffee and nibbles all included. Central location for Times Square if that is your thing, although walking distance to most of the main attractions. If using Taxi to arrive recommend Newark rather than JFK if you can, t that is a New York thing.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The service was impeccable, from when we first crossed the threshold, tired and weary from our flight and long ride from JFK, to the early morning farewell back home. Everyone was friendly, helpful, yet professional and efficient! The front desk staff was amazing with suggestions of where to eat, best transportation options, and things to not miss. Victor was especially stellar. I hope our travel plans take us back to NYC so we get to stay @ Casablance. Thank you for your wonderful boutique hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Friendly courteous staff, starting with the front desk and the manager. The girls in Rick's Café are courteous and work hard to please the guest. Great location in midtown for business or pleasure. Very convenient to the theaters if you plan on attending in plays, you are within walking distance of all the theaters. We will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great location & staff was very helpful!! Our family of 5 really enjoyed our stay. We would definitely stay here again & recommend to friends! Rick's cafe was a great place to relax. Let the hotel schedule your car service if you've got more than 4 people coming & going from the airport...worth the $$.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Exceptional Hotel with Awesome staff. From check in to check out this hotel is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in when it comes to customer service. You really feel like family when you are there. Highly recommend this hotel when visiting the City.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Just a great location to Broadway, sites and food. Great suggestions and tips from the hotel staff. Can't beat the breakfast to get the day started, and the happy hour before a show or evening event! Will be back!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: John and staff were very accommodating and made us feel special. Great Time Square location book this hotel you won’t regret it! We will definitely book this hotel next time we visit The Big Apple! Great place for NYE rooftop party to watch the ball drop!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: What a brilliant hotel this was. ALL the staff were so helpful & friendly and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable.There are only 42 rooms but they have all the amenities. Ours was a good size and had 2 queen sized beds in it. There was plenty of storage space and complimentary bottles of water provided daily. The bathroom was well stocked with shampoo, conditioner & shower gel.A comfortable & cosy lounge is available where a continental breakfast is served (this was included in our price) although should you fancy something a bit more substantial there is a diner within yards of the hotel. Between 5pm - 8pm complimentary wine & cheese is offered and if you prefer to 'eat in' you can order from the restaurant attached to the hotel - Tony's Di Napoli. There is a huge range of different choices on the menu and the food is excellent (you don't even need to enter outside to get to it), booking is strongly recommended.The hotel is in easy walking distance of Times Square and other eateries.Would definitely recommend this hotel and very much look forward to staying there again at some point.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I would have rated this hotel a 5 - except for the issue of room noise. The staff were wonderful, friendly and helpful. The room was a good size. Comfortable bed. Excellent location in the heart of the city. The casual lounge on the first floor is a real bonus - felt more like home than being in a hotel. Happy Hour wine and cheese is a nice touch. Really a great experience. Only issue was room noise - mainly from people walking in the hallway. We were next to the lift as well and that could be heard when everything else was quiet. For light sleepers like me the noise was an issue. I’m a bit torn though as everything else was so good that I’d consider going back here again - but try to get a room away from the lifts.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Location was our initial reason for staying at the Casablanca. However it is the staff and service that will bring us back. Thanks to all for making us feel so welcomed and special. We will be staying here on our next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Your welcome back to the hotel after you check out so don't hesitate to have them hold your luggage and then come back through out the day and visit their lounge if you want a break. Coffee, water and cookies are always there as are clean rest rooms. There's also a parking garage right next door that offers a discount if staying in the hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We were impressed with our previous stay at the Casablanca, so we decided to return. A few years later, and the Casablanca continues to deliver. Staff are still fantastic, and the accommodations are still comfortable and cozy. It’s amazing how quiet it can be just a few yards from the craziness that is a Times Square. Will return if the opportunity presents itself.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: CasaBlanc is very convenient to Time Square. Rooms are nice. 2nd Lounge with afternoon wine, cheese & breakfast bagels, juice, fruit & coffee was awesome. Staff is very friendly & helpful. We will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Just returned from the Casablanca - booked a 3-night stay mos ago at 5-star Hotel Rates (nearly $600 per night incl taxes & fees). Bed was comfortable & Room was clean - but, it was located right on the street side of the hotel (43rd St.) - first 2 nights had quite a bit of noise (trucks & traffic from the street) but, we shrugged our shoulders and chalked this up to staying in the "City that Never Sleeps" - the 3rd night, however, they were doing some type of street (or sidewalk) construction and there was a jack-hammer pounding & pounding & pounding until right around 2:00AM - theyre must not be any insulation in the walls because it sounded like the guy with the jack-hammer was standing right next to the bed. Getting ANY sleep at all was, quite honestly, an impossibility. I spoke to a Manager in the morning after getting approx 4 to 4-1/2 hrs of rest and expressed my disappointment. He told me that he "had no control" over what the city had going-on outside in the way of construction, etc. I told him that I certainly DID understand this. However, when I booked this stay and pre-paid at the rate of a 5-star Hotel, I expected that (at a minimum) I would be able to get a decent night's sleep. I suggested that they should either "Comp" the 3rd night or at least discount it by 50% because it is ridiculous to have a jack-hammer going until 2AM right outside the bedroom window. He told me that he checked with the GM and they (in so many words) were "sorry" but simply "unwilling" to do anything to alleviate the problem. This is NOT a large Hotel - the location is quite good - BUT at least 1/3 (maybe even 1/2) of the rooms are right on the 43rd Street side of the building and they do NOT appear to have taken any steps to try to Quiet the Noise - if you want to a Hotel where you can get a decent night's sleep. There are... MANY BETTER CHOICES

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great experience. Stayed here many times. Would not stay anywhere else when in New York. The staff make you feel special. So nice to stop in Rick’s place after a day of shopping or sightseeing for a cup of coffee or a cookie.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is the first time my daughter and I visited New York - and the Casablanca was icing on the cake! The Hotel has so much character and feels more like a private home. The amazing staff makes you feel right at home! Am definitely going back! Thank you for making this mother/daughter trip a memorable one.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Absolutely fabulous trip to New York and Casablanca hotel most certainly help with its hospitality comfort and location. The staff at the Casablanca where very helpful and very accommodating in fact I enjoyed my stay so much I book while I was there, for next year it is fantastic value for money. I would and will recommend this hotel to people.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Full house in NYC. We were stuck” at LeMeridien for one night and were fortunate in getting a room here for the weekend. Guests are embraced by an immediate ease and impeccable service!This is truly an experience exclusively offered at Casablanca. The calm space, Lovely concierge set-up, immaculate room and professional staff speak to every component ~ every delightful moment.Our NYC Holiday visit is perfectly complimented by our visit ~ stay at Casablanca.Will highly recommend again & again.A “Gem” ....

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Always a great experience at the Casablanca Hotel! The level of service is beyond amazing! We have stayed here many times and we are NEVER disappointed! The breakfast and cocktail hour (5 pm-8pm)is included with every stay which is a huge plus.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Outstanding service, with personell that is always very friendly. Perfect location close to Time Square. Everything is in walking distance. We enjoyed the cheese and wine service a lot. It is a perfect Arrangement to relax after some hours in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My friend and I travel to NYC the day after Thanksgiving for two nights with our granddaughters. We love staying at the mini suite at the Casablanca! We enjoy all the wonderful treats at Rick's Cafe as well as the delicious breakfast! So convenient to Times Square and all the amazing sights! Also convenient to the wonderful theatre district!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A Hidden Gem I Love Casablanca. Always a warm welcome Casablanca is just off Time Square - You’d never believe it as it’s so quiet. Rooms are cosy clean and the beds are so comfortable. Breakfast a good choice and the wine and cheese reception every evening is very good. Staff are excellent, so helpful - Highly Recommend

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We selected this hotel based on other reviewer’s recommendations and were not disappointed. The location couldn’t be better - just a few steps to Times Square, theaters and great restaurants. Our room was not large, but thankfully quiet as we did not have a street facing room. The bed was comfortable and had a surprisingly warm duvet. Fortunately, the bathroom had a window we could crack at night so we didn’t have to run the a/c to cool the room down and we could enjoy the duvet. Rick’s Cafe on the second floor is a pleasant location for breakfast and complimentary wine and cheese in the evening. There is a small outside seating area that would be enjoyable if the weather is nice. All the employees, from the reception desk to the attendants in Rick’s Cafe, were so friendly and helpful, something you don’t find in the bigger hotels too often. We highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again when in NYC.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We found this unique, boutique hotel right in the heart of Times Square and within walking distance to all the theaters!! From the moment we stepped out of the taxi we were greeted by a charming valet and discovered that we had been upgraded to a suite for only $50. Next discovery was Rick's Cafe on the 2nd floor and the decor was perfect! Finally, there was a bottle of wine and a Happy Anniversary note on the table in the living room. The restaurant next door is like being in a Woody Allen movie as it is "pitch perfect" New York City!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We went to New York for me to run the marathon, we chose the Casablanca for its central location, and stayed for 5 nights and I am so glad we chose this hotel, it was lovely from start to finish. It is situated right on Times Square, but once you are inside you could be in the middle of nowhere, it is so peaceful and relaxing, the quirky Moroccan decor adds to the ambiance and tranquility, the decor might not be to everyone’s taste but it really adds to the whole experience. The staff are friendly and attentive without being intrusive, they are extremely helpful nothing is too much trouble. The afternoon cheese and wine is definitely not to be missed, an excellent selection of good quality cheeses etc. and wines available at your leisure for 3 hours, we stayed in one evening, we were exhausted , and just enjoyed the relaxing lounge with cheese and wine. Our room was compact but very comfortable, and clean , plenty of room for clothes etc. with a good size bathroom and a great shower. Tony’s restaurant is adjacent to the hotel, accessible by a door from reception, a great authentic New York restaurant and bar, the food and atmosphere was just incredible, you really need to try it at least once, you do need to book well in advance. The Casablanca is not the cheapest hotel in New York, but it’s location makes up for this, we didn’t have to have a cab to see all the sights, we only had one to go to the world observatory. Breakfast is a self serve cold buffet, all freshly prepared and replenished regularly. A hotel well worth the money, great location and attentive staff.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Best boutique hotel in NYC. Best location if you desire midtown Times Square. We've stayed here 3 times in last 4 years. From moment a staff member opens front door for you, to free water bottles, and the amazing 2nd floor retreat that is an oasis removing you from the noise and hassle of Times Square. Rooms are tiny but spotless. Hey we ain't in NYC to hang out in our room. Bathrooms are spotless and have everything you need. And did I mention the staff? They always smile always help always friendly they'll do anything. Raining? They have free water bottles. Nothing in NYC is ever free, but here it is. Need an extra pillow? They deliver two to your room within 5 minutes. Free coffee lattes espresso snacks in 2nd floor lounge. And free wine and cheese every early evening. Piano player nights on weekends.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel offers value for money, a cosy and friendly atmosphere, conveniently located near Times Square and theatre district. The lounge where coffee and biscuits are served 24/7 and their cheese and wine offering in late afternoon/early evening is an additional and much appreciated "goodie". Highly recommended - which also applies to the adjacent restaurant, Tony's di Napoli

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Location, Location, Location and the best service and amenities! Walk to many of the key NYC spots yet the hotel feels quaint and private. The beds are comfortable; the service from door to desk to the room is served up with a smile and always helpful. Last but definitely not least the INCLUDED breakfast and happy hour. Always a nice retreat making this hotel an excellent value. I wouldn’t stay anywhere else!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Went to NYC for a few days early birthday present, the location of the Hotel makes everything easy plus there are so many opinions so close (it rained one night and we only had to stop out of the front door for food) The beds are so comfy I think I slept better than I do at home

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I’m in NYC for a conference and, as I brought my husband, I wanted to stay somewhere special. Paying just a little bit more than we normally pay, I am in hotel heaven. In addition to a very pretty and comfortable room—and a good-sized bathroom with comfy terry cloth robes!!!—there is a 5 pm “happy hour” in an absolutely lovely room with fireplace, with very good coffee, fruit, cheese, crudités, wine, and so forth. The guy at the front door greeted me so nicely—he knew who my husband was (he arrived a bit earlier) and told me what room to go to. Plus, Tony DiNipoli’s restaurant is right next door and you can get half dishes at the bar, instead of the huge family style servings advertised in its website, at the barn which aredelicious. I’m so happy!!!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Two couples stayed in a 2 queen bed room. Plenty of space. 2nd floor seemed to have beverages / snack all hours. Right at Time Square. Great location if coming for a show. Hotel has many amenities and comps. We've already booked the New Year's package. Stay tuned for the review.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: In the middle of Times Square, this gem of a property is delightful. You step into this hotel and feel at home immediately. There are some 40+ rooms so it is small but special. Rear rooms are quieter.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Nice room very clean but chose a back room ...front rooms are noisy even with white noise machine everyone very friendly hotel is in the middle of the action Times Square & theater district one block away

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Hotel Casablanca is a brilliant hotel. Centrally located and only about 30 yards from Times Square. It has a Moroccan and Casablanca film theme reflected in the decor and furnishings. Breakfast is served in Rick’s Cafe and there is coffee and Danish available 24/7. It provides a comfortable place to relax after a busy day exploring the city and before going out in the evening.I was surprised at how quiet the room was bearing in mind the location. I heard no sirens or city noise during my 4 night stay. The room was comfortable and provided all facilities for a city stay. The staff are friendly, welcoming and helpful. I’ve stayed in other larger hotels in New York but often found these to be impersonal. I will be returning to the Casablanca Hotel because it isn’t like that. I liked the atmosphere and the level of kind professional service that I received. Problems were resolved immediately and a car transfer service back to the airport was arranged quickly and proved to be very good indeed.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We arrived here having been staying in Las Vegas for a few nights in a hotel where the room was so large you could have held a party in it. So when we arrived at the Casablanca my first impression was “ this is a small room!”However any concerns were soon swiftly set aside.Our room was lovely and quiet, very comfortable bed with a more than adequate bathroom.Delicious breakfast in Ricks cafe which was open all day also for coffees, teas and cookies. Complimentary wine and cheese evenings every night again in Ricks Cafe where we met and chatted with several other travelers and found many had stayed in the hotel before.All the staff at the hotel are helpful, courteous and friendly.This may not be a brand spanking new hotel in NYC but if I have another chance of revisiting the city I’d happily book this hotel again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This place was ideal for our needs. The room was a standard size but very quiet and comfortable. The hotel is around the corner from crazy Times Square but if you want to visit broadway it is perfect. It was unusually cold when we were there so to only have a couple of blocks to the main theatre area was greatThe breakfast was the same every day. A small buffet with fresh fruit, cereals, pastries and boiled eggs. The snacks available during the day and the evening drinks were a real bonus. Not only you have a selection of drinks and snacks but it encourages mixing among the guestsThe staff were all helpful and friendly

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: From the moment we arrived we were looked after, our room was lovely and in a very quiet location even though we were situated right on time square.Evening cheese and wine etc was superb (never missed it) and breakfast was also spot on in fact the stay felt like we were on full board.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca Hotel is situated steps away from Times Square - convenient to the subway and all the area has to offer. Parking garage is right next door, and the Casablanca rate beats anything you can find in the area. Staff was very welcoming, and was responsive to any requests we had. Breakfast in the morning consisted of hot/cold cereals, bagels and pastries, boiled eggs, yogurt, and was enough to get you ready to explore NYC. The evening reception was also a nice added touch. Would definitely stay here again the next time we visit NYC.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I have just stayed at the Casablanca Hotel for the second time in two years. It is an older building with some of the lovable quirks that go with it, but it’s in a fabulous location just steps away from Times Square and many subway options. I found the breakfast and wine/cheese in Rick’s Cafe to be very handy and having Tony’s Di Napoli next door is great too. All the staff are friendly and helpful. If I return to NYC I wouldn’t consider any other hotel, but next time I will definitely request one of the rooms away from the street.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel is very near Times Square, but is quiet, calm, and comforting inside. The beds are very comfortable, all the rooms (private and public) are stylish, and the whole place feels very very safe. Complimentary extras like coffee available 24 hours a day (great for me because I wake up very early), the many breakfast offerings, and the very relaxing wine and cheese hours make it possible to experience the crazy city and then unwind afterwards

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Close to perfect! Very noisy due to construction, cleanliness needs to be improved (the pillows smelled like sweat), breakfast needs more variety (i.e. - gluten free, lactose free milk, etc.) But besides these minor issues, it was perfect!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel is in a great location with discounted parking right next door. Service attentive and accommodating. Room was fine if alittle tired. Bed not very comfortable but after first night they provided us with egg crate which was helpful.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My wife and I were in Manhattan for her Birthday to see a show. We had previously stayed at one of the other Library hotels in Manhattan and really liked it. We drove in from New Jersey during the afternoon on Friday. I like to be able to valet park my car so we don't have to look for a parking garage. I was informed that they did not offer valet parking but there was a lot right next door and they provide a voucher that allows you to park 24 hours $ 30.00. This was better than valet parking ! Since it was literally right next door. The hotel is what we usually look for when traveling to Europe, small, clean quiet and comfortable with friendly and accommodating people. My wife and I were very happy and enjoyed ourselves on the first leg of our weekend Birthday trip into Manhattan. The Casablanca made that possible. The only thing that I would suggest is that the air conditioning units get removed from the windows when the weather changes or find a way to seal them better. Although it was comfortable to sleep it was cold in the room. This did not in any way spoil our stay.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: There are so many reasons that my friends and I stay at the Casablanca on our yearly Fall trips to NYC ... from the wine and cheese reception each evening to the complimentary breakfast. The hotel staff are professional and friendly, always checking to make sure our stay is top-notch. Can't beat the location, just a quick walk to Times Square and the theaters. We are so happy we discovered this gem several years ago and wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in NYC. Thank you Casablanca ... until next year!
user_name:
Lynn C
Sunset Beach, North Carolina

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This small hotel built in the early 1890s is a half block from the corner of 43rd & Broadway, and within EASY walking distance of several theaters, including the New Amsterdam and The Lyric. Ditto for Madame Tussaud's Wax Museum, which is worth seeing. My room was small, but well appointed, with a very new, modern, clean bathroom. My only complaint with the latter was that the pedestal sink left little room for toiletries. My room bordered onto 43rd Street, and, "being in the city which never sleeps," it was noisy. I would recommend a traveler request an interior room. The hotel staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was served in a very comfy room on the second floor.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great location, professional and friendly staff, fun themed hotel. Easy walk to theaters, Bryant Park, Radio City Music Hall. Hotel is in excellent condition which is true for all Library brand hotels.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed over after seeing a show. The hotel is in a great location. The staff was very friendly. There is a cafe in the hotel that always has snacks, drinks and a happy hour, all free!. Our room was on the 5th floor. I didn't like the elevator, it was small and shaky. If I stay again I will ask for a lower floor and take the stairs. Our room was clean and the bed was pretty comfortable. I would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is such a great hotel. The location can’t be beat. The wine and cheese each night is fabulous. A great place to warm up, right by the fire, enjoying some wine, after a chilly day of sightseeing. Impeccable service, as always!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Our stay was amazing from start to finish, all the staff were so friendly, helpful and professional. No query or request was too small or too big for them. We had a family suite and it was large and spacious with the most comfortable mattress topper in the world. It was steps away from Times Square but you can’t hear any noise whatsoever. We used Rick’s cafe which is definitely a fantastic idea from the hotel' the unlimited drinks and snacks were so lush and well worth the fee.I can’t wait to come back.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A pretty perfect stay. The staff were great — excellent location— comfy rooms and beds. Even the other guests were nice! Breakfast and evening wine were just right — nice, small hotel. Everything was pretty perfect.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A really wonderful hotel, friendly welcoming staff, very clean, comfortable beds and room. Fantastic breakfast facilities, comfortable lounge area. Complimentary wine & snacks every evening, top class! Right beside Times Square so very central to all the attractions of this wonderful city. Really enjoyed our stay here and would love to return some time and would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great location, quiet but 1 minute from Times Square. Clean, everything we needed. Would happily recommend and return. Don’t expect a view but this did not matter as with most NY hotels you’re unlikely to get one.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We liked the hotel very much. Nice clean place, 1 minute from Times Square. Most of the sights can be reached by walk. Everybody is very kind, helpful . The breakfast is even thogh is continental very good, extra five stars for the ladies for the porridge they prepair every morning. You can have a coffee all day long, from coffee machine. They use Lavazza and the coffee is very good for the European taste, which is very rare in the city. All in all the hotel is extremly guest friendly, they really do their best or more for the guests. Definitely offer for everybody.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Spent 5 nights in the hotel while staying in New York. The hotel is small, can be found very closed to Times Square. The room we booked was large enough for two, with two queen size bed. Everything is spotlessly clean, they change the bedline every day, as well as the towels. The breakfast is pretty good, with flakes, oatflake, fruits. The best is the italian coffee maker, as the American coffee is not my taste. Every afternoon they offer wine and cheese reception with crakers, fruits, cheese, wine and prosecco. All the people working here are extremly friendly and helpful. So all in all I definitely offer the hotel for the stay in NY.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: just come back from a visit to this hotel, amazing!! everything about this hotel is superb, all the staff are excellent and very helpful . Breakfast was a great bonus along with cheese and wine in the evening. Still can't believe how quiet our room was even though the location is so close to times square.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We always stay at the Casablanca Hotel during our annual visit to NYC. We have never been disappointed. There can be street noise given the location and depending on the room but the service is consistently excellent and the location relative to Times Square and the theaters can not be beat.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Amazing staff, great Continental breakfast and evening reception with sparkling wine, fruit, cheese, veggies, etc. Charming design, our room was perfect. I was afraid with the location right by time square (very confident for the subway) there'd be a lot of noise, but had no noise problems at all and slept soundly. Order online through their website and they'll get you a $1 bottle of wine!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Just returned from a excellent stay at this hotel.We chose it based on Tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed.The location is excellent.The staff are warm, welcoming and helpful.My request for a quiet room was filled.We enjoyed the breakfasts, lots of fresh fruit/croissants/ bagels/ etc.We enjoyed the wine and cheese in the evening and being able to have coffee/tea at any time of day.Book this hotel,you won’t be disappointed.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is a great place to stay in New York! Just steps from Times Square yet really quiet. Generous continental breakfast served in a very comfortable room call Ricks. We have stayed here before and this visit was just as satisfying as the first time.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: this is now our third or fourth time at this hotel and we've already booked for next year. consistent service, great breakfast and happy hour. great location. and quiet. can't ask for too much more! security is great.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca was recommended to us by friends and we weren’t disappointed. The hotel employees are a credit from the staff on reception, serving staff, maids, cleaners and bellboy. Nothing too much trouble. It was a special birthday for me and cards and wine were waiting for us in our rooms. The buffet breakfast was well stocked and all day complimentary tea, coffee and pastries served in Ricks Cafe on the second floor. From 5 to 8;complimentary wine, Prosecco and cheeses, biscuits, fruits and olives were also available. Great starter before venturing out for dinner.The hotel is well placed just off Times Square although you don’t have to walk far for good food Tony’s restaurant is right next door to hotel and is super. If you ask the guys in reception they will even show you the secret door to it. Would definitely recommend the Casablanca you won’t be disappointed.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Friendly staff, lovely clean comfortable room plus large shower. Lovely residents lounge with buffet style breakfast, refreshments 24 hours and cheese and wine early evening which was a great touch after a sightseeing day. All in all lovely lovely hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The friendliest and most helpful hotel staff I have ever experienced! Really quite extraordinary. Totally welcoming and eager to assist. Seemed genuinely kind. And, of course, a very comfortable room also.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
