review_body: From the moment you are greeted at the door you will be transformed to an era gone by. Very kind, friendly and respectful staff are eagerly awaiting your arrival. Amazing sanctuary in the craziness that is Times Square. The decor is like nothing in the area. Modern is wonderful but classic, historic and transported is so calming and peaceful. And the lovely cocktail hours, the ever available snacks and coffee/tea and the delish continental breakfast are the "icing on the cake". We loved it so much it pains me to write this review as we want to keep this gem to ourselves - but realize it is not fair to the staff or the hotel - Thank you for a wonderful stay!
user_name:
Lavista7615
East Longmeadow, Massachusetts, United States

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The hotel has a great location for a city break. Just off of time square. The breakfast and cheese and wine happy 3 hours Is a nice touch. Gives you a chance to recharge your batteries. The bed was small and the hotel a bit ‘tired’. I thought it was expensive but maybe that is just New York prices. Staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Thanks

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A very cozy hotel in Time Square with great service. If that's what you want, that's what you got at Casablanca hotel. After a day of walking, arriving and having good wine and cheese is very pleasant.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We had a great stay at Casablanca Hotel. The staff were very welcoming, helpful and friendly. We especially appreciated their assistance when our departure shuttle was more than an hour late to collect us. The room was clean and a good size for New York. We enjoyed the included breakfast and evening wine and cheese. Location was excellent and we could easily walk to most places we wanted to go. Thanks!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Wonderful boutique hotel in the heart of Times Square.....Wouldn't hesitate to stay here whenever we are in NYC....rooms & bath a little small, but better than most in NY...worth the money because of Continental breakfast, wine & cheese hours & all day coffee & tea & cookies!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Casablanca for a week while we were in NYC. The location can't be beat. It's close to Times Square, Bryant Park, and many subway stops. The hotel has character and is very well maintained. The staff couldn't have been nicer. We stayed in room 310 which is on the inside of the hotel (away from the street) and it was so quiet! We were surprised since we'd read reviews that it could be loud. The room had a table and two chairs in the room that made for a nice sitting area. It also had a mini fridge. The nightly wine and snacks was a wonderful bonus. We would definitely recommend staying here!
user_name:
K F
Salt Lake City, Utah

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stay here Every time We visit our Daughter in NYC. She says it feels like Home and I agree. Staff is Wonderful, and the Rooms are Clean & Comfortable. I love that you can request a mini fridge, memory foam pillows and a fan if needed.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My husband and I stay here twice a year with our friends. We LOVE this hotel. Everyone is nice as could be. The afternoon wine and cheese is fantastic. Love Rick’s Place!! A great place to meet up after theatre for cookies and coffee. The rooms are comfortable and clean. Love the proximity to Times Square.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed here because of the immensely positive TA reviews. But it was a truly terrible experience and since then we've tried hard to solve the mystery of why there are so many great reviews of the place. The hotel is old, the lift rickety, the rooms tired, and the window attached air conditioning phenomenally loud. None of this is uncommon, I know, with the old generation of NY hotels - though not the new generation of NY hotels, many of which are near to this one. But what makes this experience unforgettable - in a bad way - is that they are still renting out rooms on the front of the hotel very close to construction work that carries on through the night. A good night's sleep just wasn't possible - at least for us. And the trouble with the rooms at the back is that they overlook a dark, dank and narrow inner courtyard. The only explanation we could come up with for the positive reviews is that the average age of the clientele while we were there must have been over 50, maybe over 60, and many in this age range clearly appreciate the friendliness of the staff and the convivial atmosphere of 'Rick's Bar' with the wine and cheese evenings. Unlike many NY hotels you don't feel anonymous here, and for many in this age group I guess that's important. But on it's own physical terms it's impossible to recommend this hotel. At least until it's refurbished and the construction stops. When we raised the problems with the hotel they did their best to deal with them and to try and make us happier, but ultimately they can't fix the fundamental issues - the construction noise and the tired nature of the hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: You cannot go wrong with this hotel.Our room was spotless and while not huge you have more than enough closet space. Staff were very friendly especially at the door and front desk but in general very good service all around. Seamless check in and check out. They also arranged for an airport transfer and on check out called us a cab. The location is also perfect. Good restuarants all around and the subway entrance just across the road. New Amsterdam theater also just around the corner. I would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Another wonderful visit at Casablanca! We feel right at home when our taxi turns on 43rd street. John and his staff makes everyone feel like family returning ‘home’. Breakfast is delicious and Ricks Cafe never closes! Times Square just steps away! What’s not to love! Thanks again!! We will return soon - we always do! If you want to be spoiled this is your hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We chose based on TA reviews and were generally satisfied. The location is great right by Times Square but this is also a bit of a drawback as the road outside is nearly always clogged with traffic making getting to and from a bit difficult. It is also a narrow road so the front facing rooms are a bit gloomy due to being dwarfed by the surrounding buildings. The room itself, we had a mini suite, was spacious and comfortable. I noted previous review concerns about the construction work but that only affected us for the first night. There is also a white noise machine which worked well to drown out the traffic noise. The included continentaly breakfast was good by US standards and the three hour wine and cheese + in the evening also good. The problem for both was that there was just not quite enough table room so it always felt a little crowded. The staff were excellent and went out of their way to anticipate and satisfy our needs. There is also coffee and snacks available all day. Would we stay again - probably not in this location, we would probably go for their other property near 5th Avenue.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: the petite queen is comfortable , quiet with a great shower and even bath robes supplied. It just needs a chest of drawers for clothing .Location is perfect and within walking distance of broadway shows and theatres. Helpful friendly staff.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca is in a very convenient location off Times Square right next door to many great restaurants and walking distance to many attractions. The suite was very spacious for New York standards and the complementary breakfast and wine and cheese every evening was very much appreciated, adding to the value of the accommodation. My only negative is that the beds are doubles, not queens, and tended to dip in the centre, making sleep a bit less comfortable than desirable.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel is a hidden gem. Great location and yet understated from the outside. Inside the vibe is chilled and friendly. A super lounge that is used for breakfast and a great and complimentary wine/cheese supper. Beds are very comfy and we would definitely use again if returning to NYC.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A quiet hotel right at Time Square, professional courteous staff who "welcomed us home" when returning at the end of our sightseeing day. Clean and comfortable rooms with 24 hour lounge access. I highly recommend this hotel. We had a fabulous five nights and would return again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Super location, steps from Times Square; friendly and attentive staff; great breakfast service; garage parking available next door. WHAT MORE do you need. Good elevator, patio room, great coffee. Right in the heart of Manhattan.
user_name:
Emilio D
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My husband and I arrived at the Casablanca Hotel six hours before check in. We were concerned about what we would do with our many pieces of luggage, but the hotel employees cheerfully held them for us and invited us to have coffee and breakfast upstairs while they checked on our room. Before we knew it, they said our room was ready for us! And what a beautiful room it was! The photos online do not disappoint plus we were surprised with a bottle of wine and two cards from the staff (it was my birthday and our anniversary). Later that day they assisted us by providing a subway map and directions for some places in the city that we wanted to see. The next day when we checked out, they flagged down a cab for us and helped with the bags. On top of this, the bed we had in our room was the most comfortable one we have ever slept in! (My husband keeps asking me to ask the hotel what kind it was since he has shoulder issues and this really helped him!). We had only planned one night in NYC and now we wish we had made it longer. We loved staying here and the staff made it so wonderful for us. We will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The hotel is just off Times Square. You can book at a Hilton down the street, but it would be a great mistake. This place offers you an incredible experience. All the staff are very knowledgeable and extremely eager to please. They have been trained with a single purpose to make your stay an experience you won’t forget. My husband runs a health center and travels for business, we have stayed at Hilton’s and never encountered this kind of service. From the bellhop who spent 15 minutes fixing my TV to the housekeeper that when asked where the ice machine was located, stopped what she was doing to offer to go get it for me. Being just off tidiness square the rooms are small and so are the elevators, but it’s clean and quiet. Today is our last day and I’m so sad to leave. I know I won’t encounter this kind of customer service elsewhere.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Perfect location. Loved the community room and the delicious breakfast, late afternoon wine and cheese, and late night cookies and tea. We looked forward to getting back after a day of touring the city and relaxing in that room while visiting and meeting fellow travelers.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We’ve been here two days so far and it is everything the other reviewers said it would be. We came in spoiled having stayed this week at the #2 trip advisor hotel in Boston, the #1 in Mystic and then to the Casablanca. Rooms are small because it’s Times Square and the elevators are tiny but that’s the end of the negatives and they are really more charming than negative. Now here’s where this hotel excels, the staff!!! I can’t even remember their names because every single staff member treats you like family. The ladies in the breakfast room in the AM those in the wine and cheese room in the evening go above and beyond. The guys at the front desk were fantastic as were the bellhops/doormen. Whoever hires and trains these employees is a magician. I have 150 employees and it’s virtually impossible to have all of them be all-stars like this place. We will be back!!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is a perfect sized boutique hotel in the heart of the theater district. Despite the hustle and bustle of Times Square, this hotel is a calm oasis. Staff is friendly, breakfast is yummy, and location is great for theater-goers.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We have stayed here several times and always feel welcomed by Jeffrey, Johan Asim John and the rest of the front desk and door staff. Many of these folks have been there for several years or more. They are committed to giving you a great experience. The location is convenient to Broadway shows and Times Square. While the area is bustling, the hotel provides a quiet oasis to relax and rest.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is a perfect place to stay in NYC - easy access to subways, theatre, nice restaurants, shopping and lovely Bryant Park. Staff are exceptional and LOVE RICK’S CAFE. Will return again and again to this charming boutique hotel

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Casablanca is a great little hotel just steps from Times Square. The price includes breakfast, afternoon tea/coffee and wine and cheese. A nice bonus is the staff are very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is the place for a quiet getaway in midtown. Convenient to all the theaters as well as MSG. Breakfast included at the second floor charming library; it’s also the spot for complementary wine and cheese nightly. Our king room on the 6th floor was quiet and comfy with a large bathroom. Helpful staff at the 24 hour front desk.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Loved everything about this hotel, location couldn't be better, room and bathroom was spotlessly clean, all staff we came in contact with were extremely helpful, friendly and professional. Great value

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I just completed my 4th trip to NYC and my second stay at the amazing Casablanca Hotel which is a short pitching wedge from all the action at Times Square. General Manager John T. and his efficient staff go above and beyond to ensure their guests get the royal treatment. Although this hotel is a quaint "boutique" property, what it lacks in size it more than makes up in style and class. The marvelous continental breakfast served every morning is super as is the daily late afternoon wine and cheese offering.A person can't possibly see all on NYC is a single visit or two or three. I plan on returning in the near future to Manhattan and it is a "No Brainer" that the Casablanca Hotel will be my first and only choice.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Our first time coming to New York, my family decided to stay at the Casablanca for the whole week of our stay in NYC. The hotel provided such brilliant service and were so accommodating and friendly the whole time. Every single member of staff were so lovely and helped us with any questions we had (including best local places to eat - which they were spot on!!) The housekeeping made sure our room was spotless every day and was so nice coming back to a perfect & clean room after a busy day of sightseeing. Rick’s Café was a relaxing spot to have a cup of tea and also a great way to start the morning with breakfast. Best bagels ever.All in all, an amazing experience which really made our first stay in NY such a hassle free and pleasant one. Will definitely come back if we ever visit again in the future.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The reviews describing this hotel as an oasis are spot on! The hotel is well decorated in a Moroccan theme and a great escape from the frantic Times Square.The staff are friendly and helpful and clearly worked well together as a team. The room was a decent size, well decorated and very clean. The toiletries were lovely. Our only complaint about the room was the noisy aircon.Rick's café was great. Breakfast, all day refreshments and wine & cheese every evening were very welcome. And, all included in the price.Not sure we will be returning to New York anytime soon but if we did we would definitely stay here.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great ...Location ..Staff..... Rooms..Beverages.. Location... very pleased with our stay. Helped us with the Fiasco of Thomas Cook going bust, even though we only had a flight booked with TC... and loved the Wine & Cheese Reception every evening.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Very nice and clean, very comfortable. Ricks cafe provided tea , coffee and snacks 24-7. It is located steps from times square and is quiet and peaceful inside. Like an oasis in the desert. The only negative is that the rooms are very small, they were not a problem for us. The rooms were clean. Will definitely come back. There were a lot of international tourists which is a plus if you like to chat with interesting people.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Best service! We have traveled in some of the most expensive hotels in NYC, but the staff at the Casablanca was superlative. The cocktail hour and breakfast was sublime. We would give this 5+ star reviews!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel has a lot going for it such as very friendly staff, good breakfast included, evening wine reception and 24 hr coffee, tea, snacks and water available. The rooms are clean and the bathroom had been updated.However, this is an old building and was just not my taste in decor and room size, and the AC unit was loud and blew directly at the bed. The room faced the courtyard and was basically dark all of the time.We appreciated the good amenities and excellent staff but would most likely stay somewhere else next time.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This was our first trip to NY and was a bit apprehensive. The Casablanca hotel really felt like home away from home. It was in a perfect location....around the corner from Times Square and across the street from the subway. However, in the hotel it was quiet and peaceful. Did not even feel.as though we were in NYC. They offered a very nice contential breakfast, snacks through out the day and wine with heavy snacks in the evening. Already planning our next trip back and mostly because of the Casablanca! Oh...excellent staff!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Stayed one night in a suite with my daughter. Upon entering, we were completely taken care of. Front desk staff very kind and professional. Breakfast offering was very good (one suggestion is to have a sign that offers gluten free bread). We asked for it hoping they did. Wine and snacks in late afternoon was a real treat. Our suite was near perfection. No city noise at all. Location to Times Square and theaters is literally steps away. Parking garage 2 doors down with a discount. Make sure they stamp your receipt. Can't wait to stay here again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel is a lovely haven of calm after you return from a day or evening of adventures, show or shopping. Rick’s lounge is great for a tea, coffee and snacks any time of the day to relax and recuperate. My sister celebrated her 60th birthday the lady’s at breakfast sang happy birthday to her and delivered a cupcake and fruit. A lovely gesture, the hotel excelled my expectations exceptionally good housekeeping, very clean rooms which are good sizes something to suit everyone couples or a family. Comfy bed and pillows a/c and fan in the rooms a/c a little noisy but offers of help ie ear plugs available , but I think we hit the jackpot. The breakfast was good although we purchased our own sourdough bread but they did toast it for us. We could not take advantage of all the cakes/pastries/biscuits on offer due to our diet restrictions. But we asked for extra fruit which we got. Unlimited tea/coffee. I cannot wait to return. A big thank you to all of the staff they are a credit to you. The hotel is in a prime position for all activities and attractions.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: QUIET! SO QUIET!CLEAN! INCREDIBLY CLEAN!Did I already mention quiet?! I'm sure that you saw "Times Square" and rolled your eyes, weary traveler, but take my word for it - book this hotel. Now.I have stayed in many NYC hotels, even lived there for a while, and it was as quiet as the suburbs in our room (509) every one of the four nights we stayed. Sure, it smelled a little bit like hot dogs, probably due to our a/c units picking up smells from the air shafts in back of the hotel, but that was an enormously tiny price to pay for the gorgeous accommodation, friendly staff, and can't-beat-it-with-a-stick location.The intent of our trip was to see The Cursed Child, which was across the Square a, maybe, two minute walk.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We found the entire staff from front desk to doorman to those serving coffee in the morning to those serving wine and cheese in the afternoon to be sincerely gracious, approachable and eager to make the visit memorable.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is a fantastic hotel just around the corner from Times Square. Beautifully decorated, amazing staff, tasty breakfast, free wine and cheese in the evenings.On arrival we were told we had been upgraded to a suite. It was fantastic and included a free bottle of wine. BUT it is at the front of the hotel just across the street from a large office building. That building is having major refurbishment work being carried out ALL NIGHT. I guess it is done ALL NIGHT so as not to disturb the office workers. I cannot begin to describe how loud it was. In a city hotel, you expect noise from traffic and sirens etc. but this was totally unacceptable.Due to the air conditioning unit being inserted into the window it sounded like the window had been left open. We were there for 3 nights and did manage some sleep the first night due to the long international journey but neither of us had any sleep on night 2. After complaining, we were moved to a room at the back of the hotel and it was perfectly quiet.After we had moved rooms, the manager called to apologise but they should have been honest about this when we arrived. They cannot help the noise across the street but this is a fairly expensive hotel and offering a free upgrade, knowing what we faced, was very disappointing.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Excellent stay and at a few meters from Time Square. I hardly met a better service in any hotel. Rooms are small but sufficient. Excellent wine and cheese in the afternoon at 2nd floor. Elevators scrambling little :) Overall - good value for money:)

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is a great little hotel in a central location. The people who work here are friendly, helpful and attentive. I loved the availability of all day snacks. There were tea, cookies and muffins offered in the late morning and wine, cheese and fruit in the afternoon. So nice to have snacks to get you through a full day in NY. The beds are quite comfortable. Our room was small but that was fine for a short stay. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed at the Casablanca 4 years ago when we came to NY for the first time on vacation. When we were planning our second trip, we knew there was no place better to stay, so we decided to book here again. This time we were meeting friends in the City, so we suggested they stay here too. The hotel is in a perfect location for getting to all the places you want to go when visiting Manhattan. There are multiple subway stations all within a block of the hotel which makes using public transportation a breeze. Times Square is a spectacle like nothing you’ve ever seen, but the minute you walk in the hotel you’d never know that chaos is a block away. Loved that the Police Station is right at the end of the block—for safety as well as a landmark when navigating back to the hotel from Times Square. Rick’s cafe on the second floor is a comfortable, relaxing atmosphere to recharge your battery after being out all day, or to kick off a day in the city. My only negative comment would be about the construction going on across the street. The construction goes on all night long and is VERY loud—jackhammer, trucks backing up, concrete being thrown into the back of a metal truck, etc.....The first night we were there our room had a window overlooking 43rd Ave, which is where the construction is. The hotel has no control over the construction, but we got no sleep the first night because of the all-night noise. I’ve never experienced anything like it. We went down first thing the next morning and asked to change rooms, which they graciously and apologetically did. The rest of our stay was perfect. While the hotel can’t control the construction, they do know it is going on, and I feel those rooms overlooking 43rd should be discounted. We paid over $400 to be kept up all night our first night in town. There is no comparison of those rooms to an interior room. We love the Casablanca and will stay here again when we come to NY for another visit!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Staff was very helpful and nice. Rooms lovely. Great location. Parking in garage next door very convenient. Complimentary breakfast and snacks were good. Pleasant common areas. Nice design of funky space. Convenient check in and out.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great staff and service. Nice amenities and very good continental breakfast and cocktail hour included. One of the 2 elevators was under repair. Surprisingly quiet inside. Outside is Times Square noisy and chaotic. Great if you’re seeing Broadway shows.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Somebody was working on 43rd all night for our three day stay. Jackhammers and Dump Trucks all night. Couldn’t muffle the noise with the ac fan and the white noise generator thoughtfully provided by the hotel. Love the hotel not the noise.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great hotel, great staff, very pleasant and eager to help. The location was also great just around the corner from Times Square but still very quiet. Close to theatres and restaurants. The hotel also has a 3 hour nightly appetiser and wine service so you can relax with a few glasses of wine or bubbles before heading out to the theatre. So nice!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The hotel is very nice and the people are extremely pleasant, however there is construction being done just outside the hotel. This construction occurs from 10:00 pm until 6:00 am. At times it is very loud.I realize the hotel is not responsible for this, but it is a disturbance of sleep.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great location, convenient to Times Square and Theatres. Excellent service by all hotel employees. Nice amenities. Parking available right next door. Would not reserve petite queen room again due to limited space.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca is just a Nice Hotel, run by a really friendly and helpful staff, it has someway spacious rooms, is centrally located and very clean. All this facts are really important but in order to have all the awards by trip advisor they have a long way to improve. Here are some points that I would like to share and you will decide.- The furniture and ornaments are dated, it feels like a Grandma’s Bed and Breakfast- The building is really old and located in a really noisy street- They offer breakfast, but nothing more than coffee, and cheap pastries and bread, forget about protein boiled eggs is the only thing available, this breakfast is like what you can get in La Quinta Inn - There is not enough sitting at the breakfast area- They have a social Afternoon , a really nice idea but they serve $4 bottles of wine, cheap sparkling wine, cheese and fruit trays from the Supermarket - There is not a lot of good places to eat nearby - The customers are mostly older couples 55 and above - The A/C is a wall unit , not centralWould I return or recommend this Hotel, probably not, which is sad because they have a great friendly staff , and finding good human resource in this business is key for success.To the administration I will ask them to make some simple improvements:- Offer better sitting at the breakfast area- invest in offering a better quality breakfast - Offer better quality wines , you can find decent wines for 10 - 15 dollars at Costco and a Prosecco for 10 - 15 also- KEEP YOUR GREAT AND FRIENDLY STAFFThese changes , without large investments will increase your clients satisfaction and the chance to bring a new type of guest .

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Not only does the hotel take you back to Rick's Cafe from the movie, Casablanca, but also the sense of timelessness. The Cafe is open 24/7 for "snacks", tea and coffee, juices, etc. Wine & cheese for three hours every day! A delicious casual breakfast is also served at Rick's. And it is just steps from Times Square!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the hustle an bustle of times square / Manhattan.Great all-round service with a smile from all hotel staff.The reception and door staff very helpful.The hotel web site is correct in every way, what is on the site is what you get, No disappointments. :-)Tony's restaurant connected to the hotel has a comprehensive menu, large portions. Order one main an share for two.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I would reserve the ride service thru the hotel it was a great way to start our vacation.The front desk staff can answer any questions you have and also recommend restaurants, etc.When you wake up in the morning take advantage of the breakfast room and also all day enjoy coffee, tea and cookies. A great way to end an evening as well and discuss all the fun things you did that day.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca Hotel is an excellent hotel in a a superb location - central to everything and easy access to everywhere. This is our second visit having been highly impressed during our stay last year. This year my husband upgraded to a suite - luxurious, spacious and peaceful - no noise from outside or within ( with the exception of the air conditioning). A lovely bottle of wine was left in the room on our arrival as my husband was celebrating his birthday - a nice touch. Special thanks to staff at reservations for responding so positively to specific requests. The staff at the Casablanca are absolutely amazing - so welcoming, courteous and helpful at every point of every day. Our stay was greatly enhanced by 1) 24/7 availability of coffee/ tea and snacks 2) 5-8pm cheese & wine and nibbles 3) the most wonderfully relaxed atmosphere at breakfast which offered a more than ample selection to choose from. The staff at breakfast and the evening cheese and wine must be commended for their attentiveness and thoughtfulness. A seven day stay in NYC is wonderful but exhausting. The Casablanca Hotel supports your efforts to maximise your involvement by offering an opportunity to rest, relax and recover - fresh to meet the challenges and enjoyment of the next new day. Thank you to everyone - staff and fellow guests - such a cordial and respectful atmosphere prevailed throughout our stay. Such a wonderful experience ;))

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I chose this hotel as it was my first stay in New York and (travelling alone) I wanted a hotel where I could ask for advice and feel looked after. On this front, the Casablanca delivers in spades.The staff are really great and make this hotel a hidden oasis: they are so helpful and are genuinely happy to chat with you about what you've done during the day. I got wet through, when I went to Ellis Island, and it felt like I 'popped home' to get changed before having a late lunch.  As many reviewers have said, the breakfast, the cheese and wine and the lounge are all great features and I really appeal/ give a lovely sense of inclusion. I think that NY can be a tough city, if you stay in the wrong place, and I really enjoyed it here.Whilst I have given 5 stars (because it's great and I loved it), I would echo some of the previous comments about some of the décor being a little tired (and bathroom, when I first arrived, did smell a bit of drains - it passed). This is all forgivable as it's an old building, with a certain style, and when you stay here you are not looking for a shiny chrome experience, you are looking (and will find) a very special boutique hotel. Overall it's quiet as a hotel and the beds etc are very comfortable. My air conditioning was also a bit too noisy (and that would be my one request next time), however, balance this with the homely welcoming feel and the excellent location. Would I stay here again? Of course - in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Casablanca and we were very impressed with the extremely friendly staff. Loved the complimentary cheese and wine from 5pm - 8pm. Location was fantastic just round the corner from Times Square. Rooms were very comfortable Thank you, when we’re next in town we will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel is in a great location to access public transportation and transportation to any of the airports. Central Manhattan location also meant you could walk many places. The staff is friendly and very helpful. There is a nice breakfast and happy hour every day although neither varied during our 4 days there so it got old by the last day.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Excellent service from very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms did not look out directly onto Times Square but rooms away from the street were less noisy. Beds very comfortable. Breakfast included had a good choice and the evening wine and cheese was very welcome. Enjoyed the piano playing on Friday evening at the wine and cheese.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Stayed here first time 6 years ago. We said the next time were in New York we would stay at the Casablanca as everything about was wonderful and our resent stay confirmed it still is a fantastic hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Excellent location, great customer service , free WiFi/breakfast/ daily wine tasting. Very unique property , comfortable beds , some what noisy since it’s time square. They had free breakfast but I passed since there was no hot item on menu but again , it was free and plenty of pasteries /cofee /cereals.Overall great property and excellent location.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great little hotel just off Times Square... love everything about it, from the moment you arrive the staff are warm and friendly, the rooms are comfortable and the breakfasts & social hours are great. This was our second visit and it won’t be our last

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We were last here in 2015 so when we chose New York to finish our ruby wedding anniversary celebrations this was an obvious choice.From the moment you walk in, with a friendly greeting every time you come in, the hustle and bustle of Times Square is forgotten and you are in such a tranquil setting. Beautifully decorated in Moroccan style and all day tea, coffee, crakes etc. Our room happened to overlook W43rd so as we were there during Labor Day celebrations ( being Brits we hadn’t realised) was rather noisy. We expected a certain level of noise being near Times Square and we travel with ear plugs so we were fine. If you aren’t expecting Times Square noise at night it may be worth asking for a room in a quieter spot in the hotel.The toiletries provided are beautiful and everything is so tastefully presented. All the staff were lovely from toasting bagels for us at breakfast to on our last day organising a car to take us to the airport for a set price including tolls and tips and we could pay by card. We believe it was excellent value as it took 90 minutes to JFK and we suspect a yellow cab would have been more expensive.The lounge is really comfortable. Wine is provided every afternoon from 5pm but if there was a bar available even one you pay for, it would take the place up a notch even more. I am certainly not complaining about the lack of a bar but we like the hotel so much that to be able to get a lunch time beer there rather than go to another bar would be the icing on the cake!As you can see there is nothing to dislike about this hotel in my view; and my comments are really only about personal preferences.If we get back to Manhattan ( which we love) this will always be our “ go to” hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Everything about our stay was fantastic! Our room was large (from a NYC hotel standpoint), comfortable, quiet and nicely temperature regulated. It was one floor above the cafe where we had breakfast (very good) each morning. We also enjoyed afternoon wine, cheese and apetizers each afternoon, and tea in the evening. It was comfortable and relaxing. The hotel is situated in the theater district in the Times square area, making it an easy walk to the many broadway theaters. It is a block away from a subway station as, so travelling by subway to various areas of the city was a cinch! I used the free pass to the nearby fitness club a number of times, which worked out great. Such a delightful stay... we will certainly be back! And by the way, the hotel is attached to our favorite italian restaurant, Tony's di Napoli!!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed here for three nights on the way to and from Africa. It was wonderful! The breakfast, snack lounge was a great place to unwind, or to rest after a long flight, waiting for our room to be ready. The service is superb, and the mattresses are like heaven. We highly recommend this boutique hotel. You will love it!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Very comfortable hotel. Loved Rick's bar where there are hot drinks and snacks available 24 hours a day including free breakfast and cheese and wine in the evenings. Rooms was a bit small but well furnished with space for hanging clothes plus drawers and loved the sandalwood and orange toiletries in the bathroom.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Only a few steps to Time Square. This Hotel is centrally located. Breakfast is included and after 5pm daily wine and nibbles are provided. Staff are excellent and well trained. They make you feel part of their family. Highest recommendation

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Every visit to this hotel is like coming home to a comfortable residence! I have never been to a better location for 100% customer service. A visit to NYC can be stressful under the best conditions. There is nothing like coming home to the Casablanca to relax with a glass of complimentary wine, 24 hour snacks and the friendliest employees in the city!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This beautiful, charming little hotel is located just off Times Square and was perfect for an NYC weekend. The staff is friendly and helpful, but stays out of your way. We found this a lovely retreat after long days out walking the city. The room was comfortable, clean, and stylish. Give the Casablanca a try - you won't be disappointed.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed at the Casablanca for 4 nights recently for a special birthday visit. What a fantastic location! Close to all amenities, Times Square, transport etc. The breakfast was very good, plenty of choice and good coffee(a must for us), there was a morning newspaper too. Tea, coffee, ice water and snacks available 24 hours was very helpful. The Cheese & Wine 5-8pm is a great idea as New York can be an expensive place to eat out. The rooms are very comfortable and quiet given the central location. The staff are extremely welcoming and helpful, nothing is too much trouble. This is a small hotel, which we like, it makes it more personal for us. Would not hesitate to recommend it, thank you for such a lovely stay.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Yes the location is superb but the hotels biggest asset is its staff who all were friendly, helpful and caring. We stayed last week and married on the Wednesday. The manager was so kind to let me use a room to get ready on the day for a few hours. The location couldn’t be any better - just off Times Square so perfect for most tourist attractions such as Broadway shows, Empire State Building and Central Park. The only downside of our room was that with the air con on it sucked in the constant smell of Chinese cooking from a nearby restaurant - this doesn’t affect all rooms. The breakfast and cheese / wine evenings make us a great touch - I would totally recommend the hotel to others - so much so my friends have booked for November A great stay and a big thank you to all the staff :-)

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel was awesome. Great service, friendly staff. They have great coffe available all day!Also the location is great if you want to be right in the middle of everything. The wifi connection is good, and the fact that you can borrow a computer , and print paper, in the study rooms is nice.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Just loved it made my birthday special would go back every opportunity Ricks cafe great fruit and pastries tea coffee. Wine and cheese of an evening.friendliest staff I’ve ever met. Practically in Times Square so great to get everywhere on foot. Fabulous atmosphere calm friendly welcoming

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Hotel is centrally located to Broadway plays and other tourist spots. Staff is so friendly and helpful. The morning breakfast and evening wine offer a chance to mingle with other guests. The restaurant next door is great.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Everything about the Casablanca is perfect — and the staff are so extraordinarily welcoming!!! Great location Erin theaters, lovely lounge with delicious food and live piano music on Friday nights. I’ll be back.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great location. Relatively big, quiet, comfortable room and bathroom. Enjoyed the breakfast and wine and cheese. Excellent service and value. Quality and unique decor. Fun experience in boutique hotel. Hope to be back soon and would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Location, complimentary breakfast, wine and cheese hours daily, great staff. The front desk will help with any questions you may have. Need an umbrella? No problem. Taxi, they will get it. Why would you look anywhere else, unless they are totally booked? Then head to The Library.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We spent four nights here while seeing the sights in NYC and taking in a couple of Broadway shows, and it was delightful. Just a few steps off Times Square, the Casablanca was a wonderful refuge from the lights and noise of Broadway. The staff were uniformly attentive and friendly, wanting to make sure all needs were met. The lounge, Rick's (of course), was very comfortable, although we had a real issue with the coffee machine, which seemed incapable of producing a hot cup of coffee! A small patio off the lounge was a nice find. The room was small but very clean and comfortable, although we found the bed to be a bit harder than we liked. Overall, a very pleasant stay- I'm sure we'll be back!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We completely enjoyed our stay at Casablanca. It was a perfect location, and the hotel was staffed by a superb group of people. We have already suggested this hotel to others visiting NYC in the future, as we liked everything about it -- especially Rick's Cafe for its convenience, ambiance, and tasty food/drinks.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Top notch hospitality and attention to detail! Wonderful Times Square location. And so clean and quiet. I plan on making this “home” when visiting NYC! The subway is close and it’s in the heart of Times Square. Rick’s Cafe is a wonderful commons area for breakfast, snacks, happy hour, and a late night cappuccino.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The lobby was so charming! But our room was very much in need of updating. Curtains were frayed and faded. Sofas were from 1980. Window air conditioning units were loud and barely kept room cold. Street noise extremely loud.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My wife and I were looking to stay in mid-town (not necessarily close to times square but it did not matter). The location is great, only one block from the Time Square metro station. The hotel is slightly older but the rooms are updated and less expensive than other hotels. The service was great, the front desk was super helpful in getting us through basics like bag checks and the lounge to freshen up after we arrived early for the day before the room was ready. The fact that snacks are available in the lounge any time, and breakfast included makes this a hotel I will use again for mid-town.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca never disappoints. It is a gem in the center of a Times Square. The staff, the breakfast,the wine and cheese reception are always top notch. The location puts you in the heart of the big apple.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Super location —1/2 block away from Time Square, Sondheim Theater across the street, parking garage next door. Small hotel hosting superior hospitality—friendly & helpful staff—super clean rooms & very nice breakfast. They did wine happy hour too.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Location. Location. Location. Just steps away from Times Square, this spot was perfect for us - near many subway lines and within walking distance to many attractions (Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's cathedral, Grand Central Station, Central Park, Hudson Yards, and, of course, Times Square).The complimentary continental breakfast and wine & cheese were great each day of our four-night stay.All staff - doormen, front desk, and Rick's Cafe - were consistently outstanding, always friendly and helpful.The hotel itself is old and it sometimes shows. The plumbing in our sixth floor room was a bit quirky. The elevators creak. The window-unit air conditioner was very noisy. However, the many good things about Casablanca outweigh the few drawbacks.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Casablanca hotel is one of the finest hotel I ever stay ,such a warm and cool place to be hang out with my buddy .great location with a view of skyline .buffet breakfast is fantastic and room was elegant

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Good value for money given the location, great room, great service, and really friendly staff. Couldn't fault it and (older) kids were really impressed. I would stay there again if I go back yo New York.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is a bit of a lazy review but essentially, read and believe all the good stuff in previous reviews.We went as a family with two grown up daughters. It was our first time to the US so first time to NYC as well. We were recommended this hotel and I also had followed reviews since we booked it. The key points that made it perfect for us:* We had two separate rooms that were ideal for us as a couple and our two daughters who shared a room - so glad we did this instead of one big suite and the hotel chose well for us.* The location was perfect - on the doorstep of so many places we wanted to visit.* The refreshments - not only a great "free" breakfast but also the wine and cheese is so much more than that.* The staff - they were so friendly and helpful.We would absolutely 100% return to this unique little oasis when we visit NYC again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We travelled to New York and Toronto and stayed at 4 of the Library Collection hotels (Casablanca, Library, Girraffe and X in Toronto). We enjoy smaller boutique hotels and overall the Library hotels are very nice but the Casablanca was the least enjoyable. It is fantastically located in Times Square. The theme is great but it's looking very old and needs an update. We also got a really bad room 806 I think? (the worst we were told by one of the staff). It had a window to the back with no view and directly next to the main airconditioning system so it was very noisy, particularly at night when trying to sleep. The plumbing is also susceptible to blocking up. We had to have the maintenance guy in to fix it the first day we arrived.On a positive, the staff were very nice and the other Library hotels were great. They just need to give this one a little TLC.At over $550/night AUD, $480 USD (certainly not budget or cheap) I'd consider that to be heading toward the 4.5 star level but sadly I'd have to say 3.5 star tops.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Would highly recommend Excellent central location Very clean very quiet never heard any noise Good facilities excellent staff Would definitely go back again in the futureNothing was to much troubleStaff gave us great advice

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Having visited friends here in the past and envied their hotel choice, we finally got to stay here and we were well looked after.It's amazing how one can escape the utter chaos and noise of Times Square by just entering the Casablanca, located in a side street, and our room was quiet too.But it's not just the location that is so useful about this hotel, it's the staff who look after you, move and safely store the bags, get taxis, serve the nice breakfasts and above all replenish the groaning table with free drinks and snacks during the 5-8pm Happy Hour.There was even a welcome bottle in our room on arrival. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom and toiletries were fine plus plenty of space and a good sized wardrobe. The air conditioning unit was a bit noisy but at least it worked during a sweltering July and we slept well.We were made to feel welcome and comfortable.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We have been lucky enough to stay in the hotel three times now and in our room was a card that said 'Welcome Home' and it really feels like our home in NYC. The staff our very helpful and welcoming, we were even given the same room we had last time. We love the bagels and the coffee in the morning, the close proximity of the hotel to major attractions, the calmness away from the hustle and bustle away from Times Square to the lovely wine and cheese reception. Thank you for another fantastic stay and we are already planning a Christmas visit next year,

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We have stayed here many times and it continues to be our #1 hotel in NYC. The staff is amazing and helpful. You always feel like an individual, not a number, as at all the big hotels. The amenities are outstanding-- breakfast, lounge open all day, wine & cheese in the evenings. Although the rooms are a little small, the bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom products are great. The price is great and the location is perfect. We won't stay anywhere else.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The location was excellent and hospitality was above and beyond. Rooms were a little small, but the hotel was charming and had great character. There were not many breakfast options, but we aren’t big breakfast eaters, so it was all we needed. In the heart of Times Square. Easy access to everything. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I reserved this hotel for a girls trip weekend in July. The room was spacious and well maintained. Continental breakfast was served daily and had a variety of items. Coffee and snacks were available 24/7. At the daily cocktail hour from 5pm - 8pm, we met travelers from all over the world and enjoyed wine and light refreshments. The hotel is walking distance to Bryant Park, Times Square and Broadway. I highly recommend it!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We came to the Casablanca to celebrate our 10 year anniversary in New York. We were delighted when we entered our room to find a complementary bottle of wine to celebrate. The rooms are very clean and have a very homey feel. We both loved this hotel, we can't say enough how friendly the staff are, always happy to help, this made the holiday for us! Rick's Cafe on the second floor of the hotel offers cheese and wine in the afternoon which gives a wonderful break to the day while trudging through the busy streets of New York. We're very sad to be going...but the holiday must end at some point! We will definitely be back, hopefully over the Christmas period. We would highly recommend this hotel not least for the wonderful staff at the Casablanca.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I should have reviewed this hotel sooner than I have. We went for our 5th wedding anniversary and when we arrived they was a complimentary bottle of champagne and a letter to congratulate us. This is a lovely boutique hotel decorated with a 1920’s theme. The room was petite but adequate for our stay and the facilities were good. The hotel is a stones throw away from Times Square. We didn’t get a view of Times Sq but it’s only a small hotel with taller buildings either side. A complimentary breakfast (continental style) each morning and Cheese and Wine every evening between 5-8pm.The staff couldn’t do enough for you and they made our stay very pleasurable. I would highly recommend to friends and family.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Friendly and helpful staff. Clean and quiet rooms. Breakfast and wine and cheese reception a nice amenity. Only one elevator was working so some people were complaining that it was too slow. I like to use the stairs and our room was on the 5th floor so not a problem!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great boutique hotel in center of Times Square. Staff service great. Nice included happy hour, WiFi and continental breakfast. Rooms a little small but often case in NYC. We were in back and AC systems in other buildings a little loud but otherwise great. Also room ACs a little loud but got used to after a couple nights.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Casablanca in 2016 when we got married and returned this year for our 3 year anniversary. The hotel is just the quietest, friendliest and most welcoming we have ever visited. The staff can't do enough for you, are willing to accommodate any needs you might have and really go out of their way to make the stay enjoyable and hassle-free. Rooms are more than comfortable, and the bonus of the communal dining room which serves breakfast, and snacks and pre-dinner drinks/cheese is unlike anywhere else we know. Would never stay anywhere else now we've found it!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This small and quaint hotel is surprisingly quiet considering where it is located. Helpful and friendly staff. The rooms are not the most spacious, but they are clean and comfortable. The second floor is dedicated to coffee/tea, breakfast, and a comfortable place to sit and chat with others or quietly work. Lovely.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My daughter and I stayed here for a quick getaway. We chose this hotel, due to its location and we wanted more of a boutique hotel. It was a scorching hot day when we checked in. The front desk was so helpful and immediately offered us bottled water. The staff was so attentive our entire trip. The doorman addressed us by name as we came and went during our stay. The throwback feel is this hotel was perfection. As soon as you step inside, the bustle of the city disappears. The rooms have window units, which concerned me. Absolutely cooled our room to the point we were chilled on a 100° day. The ceiling fan was a nice touch. We have already booked our next stay!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: It may not be the biggest or have all the modern conveniences but it makes up for all of that with the little things, like service and friendliness. Never had to wait more than ten seconds for an elevator. Staff always said, welcome home and opened the door and smiled. Rooms were small and but extra clean and quiet. Would never consider staying anywhere else. The wine and cheese in the evening and the breakfast in the morning was extra nice. The location of the hotel is also fantastic. Right by Times Square, although that can get intense but there are some good places to eat, in fact the hamburger/steak house right next door is very good. Try the tuna its wonderful. If you don't mind walking a few blocks there is dynamite Mexican place called Anejo.Shopping is good too, Swatch shop right around the corner.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The staff was superb, the location is great, the room was lovely, the ambience is warm and welcoming. We had a number of guests who also enjoyed the ambience and staff. Our meetings were served by staff quietly and discreetly since we had professional sports figures in and out.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We just finished another Mom/Daughter Broadway blow-out week in NYC and had another wonderful stay at our absolute favorite hotel in the city. The hotel is beautiful and comfortable but the staff and the breakfast/wine cheese afternoon make this the only place we will ever stay when we come to the city. Great location and an amazing staff and the beds are super comfy! I highly recommend the Casablanca to anyone I know that is going to the city. Outstanding!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We have just returned from a 10 day stay here and I cannot fault one thing about this hotel.The staffs attention to detail is wonderful and nothing is ever too much bother for them. For example, I informed them that my partner is disabled.Upon arrival we were discreetly shown where a wheelchair is kept if needed (it came in really handy) and the bathroom had had handrails (removable) strategically put up for safety. You always felt as though the staff were interested in you as people and not going through the motion of simply doing the customer service bit. They made you genuinely feel happy when returning to the hotel.The room, although small, was really comfortable and well appointed. I'd requested an inner room rather than be at the front of the hotel. Therefore, there wasn't loads of natural light, but this really didn't bother us. The beds and the pillows were really comfortable too. I've actually taken the details of the company that the pillows come from as I want some for home!! Maid service was superb and a little weather report card and chocolates placed on your bed each evening was lovely.Ricks cafe was a haven of a wonderful breakfast each morning and retreat throughout the day and evening. As it's a small hotel guests were chatty and it was nice to compare things that we'd done throughout the day and be given tips/advice on other tings to do. It was great getting in late evening and having the opportunity to sit and have a tea/coffee with sweet treat before retiring for the evening. The wine and cheese time each day was wonderful. It was nice to sit and chat in a lovely relaxing environment before heading out for the night.I really could continue to sing the virtues of the oasis in the heart of the mad, bustling, packed and noisy Times Square, but I would simply say to you now, just book and find out for yourself. It might not be the cheapest but it's certainly the best and you'll get full value for money during your stay.
user_name:
Michelle M
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: １人旅行、到着日から２泊利用しました。みなさんが書いているおとり、ラウンジも使い勝手が良く、立地もびっくりするくらい便利でした！！時差ボケで、なかなかねれなくて小腹が空いても、24時間ラウンジ空いているので、お茶やコーヒーやちょっとしたクロワッサンなどを取りに行けたので、良かったです。少し、高いかな？とも思いますが、観光地で、外に出ている時間も長いので、帰ってきてホッとできるホテルで良いと思いました！Thank you for everything. I had a very nice stay there. Ill be back soon.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: First off, I admit I’m a princess, so take that into account. We’ve been to the Library Hotel — part of the Library Collection — which we very much liked, so decided to try another of the collection, the Casablanca, in part because it received even better reviews. For the life of me, I don’t understand how this could be so.Let me start with the positives: 1. The staff was very nice and responded quickly to my requests for another towel and, in general very responsive to my needs. 2. The bed was comfortable. 3. The bathroom seemed to have been recently renovated and, although small, was very adequate.The negatives, however, left a far greater impression. The “theme” as the name of the hotel suggests was only vaguely apparent — some tiles in the bathroom, in the elevator and in the lobby along with some poor art work of Casa Blanca constituted the full extent of Morocco. The elevator — only one was working — was extremely slow to arrive and was jerky in stopping, leaving me grateful I arrived. The best way for me to describe the room Is “sorry”! It was dark with one small window in the corner that was mostly filled with an air conditioning unit and looked out onto a “courtyard” but reminded my of a tenement building looking into another hotel room. The room, although clean, seemed dark and dingy. Everything was “decorated” in shades of brown. The air conditioner was extremely noisy and, although it cooled the room, it did not take the humidity out. On another note, the continental breakfasts, which were included in the price, were extremely minimal and uninspired.I was extremely disappointed in this hotel. As I previously stated, it received better views than the Library Hotel and was slightly more expensive. I will never go there again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Imagine a quiet little hotel, 100 feet from Times Square. Continental breakfast with fresh fruits and pastries, wine and cheese every evening and a staff that will do whatever it takes to make your stay memorable. Too good to true? Nope, its Casablanca!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel has everything going for it, location, comfort and most important outstanding service.The staff are welcoming and friendly with out being "gushy" and most helpful. Our friends who met us in NYC were welcome for wine and nibbles. I have never had guests join us for wine and nibbles in the club lounge as a courtesy of the hotel. Our flight was delayed and we missed one night at the hotel. We were not charged for this night.Our bags were left behind in Frankfurt and the hotel staff helped us to get them.I can not recommend the Casablanca highly enough as a destination hotel in NYC.Our most sincere thanks to all staff.kindest regardsSue and Rick Todd

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: a little bit outdated hotel but on a great location. We had 2 rooms . One room at the streetside was very noisy because every night around 5 o clock some company makes a lot of noise during 1-2 hoursit was very nice to have free wine and cheese at the end of the day.Friendly personel also!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My wife and I just returned from a wonderful 4 night stay at the Casablanca Hotel near Time Square. As I mentioned in my Title, the Casablanca is a "Best Kept Secret". We discovered this wonderful hotel during our research of places to stay for our trip to NYC. Well, we were not even close to being disappointed! The staff starting with the General Manager, John and the wonderful people working alongside him to include Brian, Christian, Tarek, JC, Stanley, Margaret to name a few wrote the book on customer service. You feel like home while staying at this hotel. What's more, the stay includes some outstanding amenities like an expanded continental breakfast in the morning and a beautiful wine and cheese happy hour in the evening from 5-8pm. During the happy hour we had the pleasure of meeting some wonderful folks like Margaret who went above and beyond to make you feel like family. She and the other young gals hosting the happy hour and breakfast in the morning take pride in their jobs and it definitely shows in their positive and caring attitudes towards all the guests enjoying this wonderful hotel. Of course, one of the best parts of staying at the Casablanca was the fact that you are only a few steps from Time Square and all the wonderful activities it has to share. In closing, I just want to once again say how much we appreciated the great atmosphere provided by the Casablanca staff. You all treated us like family and went out of your way to ensure our stay was memorable. Thanks again for setting a high bar for the hospitality industry. We will see you again on our return trip to the "Big Apple." Lee and Shelley

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We’ve just spent 4 nights in early August at hotel Casablanca. As a family of 4 from the UK this has been an amazing hotel for us. The staff are incredibly kind and welcoming, the food in Rick’s cafe is great and the whole environment is a wonderful contrast to the business (and craziness!) of Times Square! The location is incredible too - so unbelievable that Times Square is only a few steps from the front door!Our room was lovely also - a family room with two double beds and a pull out, meaning we’ve all had plenty of space to spread out. This is a brilliant hotel for anyone looking to hit NYC for a few days.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Stayed here for two nights with my 18 year old for a whirlwind mom and daughter visit to NYC, where she had never been. Always felt secure at the hotel and going to and from there to the normal tourist attractions of the city. Times Square is just steps away, but far enough away to not be crazy loud. The staff is super friendly and helpful for recommendations and info about the area. Loved having “Rick’s Cafe” open 24/7 for drinks and snacks. The room was clean and cozy but not cramped. I would definitely stay here again on my next visit!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I stayed solo from July 24 to 29. If you want or need to be right in the thick of things in Times Square, yet have a peaceful place to relax and recharge, the boutique Casablanca Hotel is it! My deluxe Queen room was small but not cramped so I recommend the "deluxe" designation for any room you get. I had one of the interior rooms with a view facing a wall and windows of other rooms to the side across the way. That was okay since it's not like I spent a lot of time in the room staring out the window. The a/c is noisy but that didn't bother me since I didn't need it that much so I didn't have to blast the TV to hear over it. But if I had to, I could have slept with it on all night b/c I'm not a light sleeper. The bathroom was smallish but I expected that. However, there should be a bar to hold on to as you get in and out of the tub/shower and more "non-skid" protection in the bathtub. I wear shower shoes because of foot issues so I was okay and held onto the sink getting in and out. The elevators jerk a little when stopping at different floors but I got used to it since I arrived safely each time!The hotel is expensive for the size of and the quality of decor and amenities but New York (Manhattan in particular) is very expensive in general. If you want Ritz-Carlton style, you will surely pay $1000 or more a night in this town. Plus, at Times Square you're in tourist central of New York City. I'm sure all those businesses have to pay high rent to be there so they have to charge you what they do. I was happy with my room.The nightly wine and cheese in Rick's Cafe was delightful and you can get coffee, little pastries, cookies and fruit from there all day. Didn't get a chance to try the continental breakfast during my stay because my conference workshops at the Marquis Marriott 3 blocks away (too expensive for me!) started early and I would just eat fruit I'd taken from the Cafe the night before. All of the staff were very pleasant and helpful. Times Square was crazy crowded but as soon as you turn the corner onto 43rd Street and walk a few paces to Casablanca's entrance, it was like entering another world. I loved it! I would recommend this charming hotel to anyone who would enjoy the boutique experience over the big corporate hotel chains.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Our stay was wonderful right from the beginning. The concierge greeted us when we arrived and our bags were brought to our rooms after we checked in. The room was very clean and was cleaned thoroughly each day by the staff. The facility was surprisingly nice for a small hotel venue in the center of Times Square.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Casablanca is a beautiful boutique hotel. The staff are super friendly. The place is clean and the room we had was very comfortable and roomy for New York City. It offers a lovely sitting room and offers free breakfast with free wine, cheese and snacks every afternoon and early evening. Water, fruit and cookie treats are out the rest of the time. You can ask for a coffee maker, refrigerator and I believe a microwave to be placed in the room. The hotel is just off Broadway and it is easy to get to a lot of attractions. I booked our room in February and noticed prices dropping at the end of March. The management worked with me and upgraded our room when asked about adjusting the price. Worth every penny we paid to stay here.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca stay in NYC was again fabulous. The location, adjacent to Times square is central and places you in the middle of the Show districts with easy walking to the shopping, metro and Broadway. The staff are excellent and need to be commended, they are friendly nd helpful and made our two stays a pleasure.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My husband and I didn't want to drive the hour home from a night of theater and decided to stay someplace close to the theater. The Casablanca Hotel was perfect. It's a small boutique hotel just steps away from Times Square, yet upon entering you had no idea where you were. The staff was friendly, hotel was charming and the rooms were immaculate and quiet. Wine and cheese were served in the charming living area for happy hour and there was a lovely continental breakfast in the morning. We will definitely come back the next time we come into town for theater!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: It’s our second time at Casablanca Hotel. This time our 2 teens were with us. The room is not large, but comfortable. Breakfast included was good and the happy hour with wine and cheese is a must. Location is perfect. Despite its almost in the middle of TimeSq the rooms are very silent.And the staff is just one of the best in the world. Our special thanks to manager John, who was born for this job.We often go to NY and this is the best hotel choice

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Apart from noisy air conditioning we had a fantastic time. Continental breakfast included was a great way to start the day. As was the free wine and cheese late afternoon. Staff were extremely helpful with directions and provided extra bottles of cold water.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We had a great stay. We arrived early and they held our bags for us while we toured the city. Great friendly service and a nice smile every time we returned. Great to help with suggestions and directions. Very quiet for being in the heart of Times Square. Steps from everything. We enjoyed the breakfast in the morning and the big hit for the whole family was the coffee machine. The rooms are small but it is NYC.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights as we were getting married in Central Park during our stay. From the beginning the staff made this an even more special trip! They even ensured we had some prosecco in our room to celebrate our wedding! Breakfast was varied and tasty and the happy hour was a lovely touch to relax after a typical hectic NYC day. The rooms are bug enough, particularly grid sized bathrooms with effective A/C which was needed! It is quite dated in style but that just adds to the charm of the place! Having been to NYC nearly 10 times, we would only every stay here from now on. Thank you to ALL the staff who made our stay so memorable!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed at the Casablanca based on Trip Advisor reviews and were so glad we did. All the staff are amazing and all the little personal touches they put on your stay really make it special. All of the food included in the resort fee was excellent.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Hotel is situated only a few steps from Times Square but also so convenient for anywhere in the city. Wonderful selection for breakfast and the cheese and wine each night is a lovely way to rest before venturing out again. We have been 8 times from Australia and would also stay at the Casablanca when in NYC. The main thing that stands out is the staff! They always go out of their way to assist you and are genuinely friendly and caring. All rooms are clean and comfortable and the mini suite is fantastic if you are staying with children. The front rooms can be a little noisey early morning if there are building works happening across from the hotel but does not always happen. Overall, an absolutely fantastic hotel and we have always came away planning when we can next visit the wonderful staff of the Casablanca Hotel and NYC!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We booked this hotel for our honeymoon after reading the amazing reviews on trip advisor. The location of the hotel is amazing, right on Times Square and walking distance to lots of major attractions and subway. If you are going to New York and would prefer to be somewhere quieter then I would suggest choosing a different location.The room we had was cosy and clean and had excellent facilities that most hotels would not offer as standard. The bed was extremely comfortable. My only criticism about the room would be the air conditioning unit could only be used when the window was open. This did not affect us too much as there is also a ceiling fan which we used so we could not hear the street below by shutting the window. Our towels were replenished twice a day which was a really nice surprise and the lady who cleaned our room for us did an excellent job, the room was always spotless when we returned for the day. On arrival we were given a bottle of red wine and a bottle of prosecco from the hotel as a gift for being newlyweds which was not expected and really thoughtful. We also got two bottles of water in our room everyday. The hotel offer cheese and wine everyday between 5 and 8pm in the lounge area which is free. We only managed to do this one day during our trip due to other plans. The wine was of good quality and it was a really nice spread of different cheeses and biscuits and fresh fruit and olives etc. Everything is great about this hotel but its biggest asset is its staff. We were greeted with a very warm welcome on arrival by Chris who was staffing the front desk. During our visit we met several other members of staff who were also extremely friendly and always made the effort to greet us as we arrived at the hotel and chatted to us about our day. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York, we had a wonderful stay.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I am NOT a city girl and was traveling alone with my 13 year old (her first time in the city). We felt extremely comfortable in this hotel. Everyone was so friendly, and it was convenient to walk to Times Square, HAMILTON at the Richard Rogers theatre, and dinner at Bryant Park Grille. Even Central Park is a walkable destination IMO.
