This is a great little hotel for those who like a smaller more intimate setting in the big city! We were even upgraded to a suite and given a complimentary bottle of wine as I had mentioned we were celebrating a birthday! The birthday girl was only thirteen but her mom appreciated the gesture!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This was a total disaster for me and my family. The room could not even fit our luggage let alone us.Never again!The photos and many other reviews on tripadvisor look nothing like what this place is when you arrive.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Very nice hotel. Would recommend to anybody traveling to NYC. The location was great for site seeing. It was very clean, great personnel, good breakfasts and snacks. Just wish we had more time to spend there. There will definitely be a next time!!!!!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A massive thank you to Brian and all the staff ,we had a suite on 6 th floor ,well appointed and plenty of room for three ladies ,loved availability of coffeee in the early hours,breakfast and especially the cheese and wine including Prosecco at the early evening,before going out in the evening ,a safe haven in the midst of the blackout ,before we knew what was happening ,helpful ,happy ,engaging staff ,thank you to you all for adding to our New York experience xx

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: More service than we have had anywhere! Very friendly staff who advised and assisted us with transportation and reservations perfectly! Love the continental breakfast and happy hours hors d’oeuvres. Can’t beat the 24 hr Espresso and Lattes! Furniture and decor is a little worn but everything is clean and has a lot of character!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Stayed at Casablanca for a business trip. Hotel was very quiet, rooms were small but very comfortable. Coffee and snacks are available in the lounge 24/7. Lounge is a great setup for a meeting or to just sit on your own. Wireless throughout the hotel was very good. Staff everywhere were friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Second time staying here and never disappointed. When they say “you are family” deliver. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Great value when comparing the amenities offered to other large chain hotels. The staff is extremely attentive beginning with opening the door when you enter.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great hotel in hot New York. So good to get back to this small friendly and comfortable hotel after a hot day in New York. Continental breakfast and cheese and wine from 5-8 pm every night was ideal. All staff were very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca is an excellent choice if you are looking to stay in the theater district or near Times Square. It is a block and a half from the subway station (1 line). This is a small, boutique property that has excellent service and clean, comfortable rooms. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We love the Casablanca and are frequent visitors. It has everything we need. It is perfectly located and has a friendly and attentive staff. The beds are comfortable and roomy. Most of all, this hotel is spotless. The housekeeping staff is to be commended.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca Hotel is a great place to stay when visiting New York City. The staff is wonderful and everyone was kind, professional, and helpful. They found us great restaurants, the accommodations were perfect, and they made us feel welcomed every time we entered the hotel. We loved the wine and cheese happy hour and loved the continental breakfast. The three of us stayed in the two bed suite with a pullout couch; this was perfect. We will definitely stay at the Casablanca Hotel next we visit New York.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We had a great time with our family of 5, including three young kids. The staff was great and the service and rooms were great! The location can not be beat, and the attached restaurant, Tony’s, was excellent. Thanks to all the staff who made our trip memorable!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We have just returned home today after 4 nights at Casablanca Hotel. We had 3 double rooms as holidaying with our grown up children and their spouses. All staff at the hotel were warm and welcoming and it was a truly delightful stay. Housekeeping was excellent and breakfast and wine and cheese in the late afternoon was a perfect addition. The hotel although very handy for Times Square was situated on a quieter street. This will be our “go to” hotel from now on when in New York and would highly recommend it to family and friends. Do not hesitate to book this hotel if you are looking for a central stay. The only downside was one of our rooms suffered with some street noise and we were advised of this at check in. Ear plugs and sound machine were available.Thank you to the whole team at Casablanca for an enjoyable stay.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Wanted to stay here for 9 years running and finally did. It feels like you are in a very nice apartment close to everything. Inches away from the madness of time square but felt like miles away with how quiet and cozy it was.
user_name:
Donald G
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Our first experience as we walked in the lobby was "Welcome Home" from the wonderful staff at Casablanca Hotel. The hotel is so warm and friendly, that we just loved it. Little extras in the room were a bonus and the wine and cheese in the evenings was much appreciated! We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to New York City!!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Just traveled here with my family and was so pleased with this hotel. We traveled with our three young kids and this hotel was perfect. We had a suite and it was so spacious and clean. The bathroom was also very nice. The free breakfast and wine and cheese/snacks was clutch for traveling with kids. The staff was very kind and the location is great. Even though it’s off Times Square, it was not very noisy or crowded, other than normal street sounds. The proximity to transportation was also excellent. Would definitely recommend and visit again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great attentive staff who did everything they could to cater for my special diet (Gluten and Lactose free). Very friendly. It was great just to be able to pop back for a free coffee or snack at anytime. This also is about 20 metres from Times Square so great location. Rooms are very comfortable and clean.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We’ve stayed several times at Casablanca and it never disappoints. Great staff, location and breakfast and evening wine . Snacks and cookies all day on second floor lounge. Walking distance to everything you need in Times Square area.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A hidden gem in the heart of Times Square! They’ve mastered providing peace and serenity in the heart of the city that never sleeps. The accommodations, amenities and most of all, the staff, are second to none! All the luxuries and comforts of home make us return again and again and again! Thank you Casablanca- for another incredible stay!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Went to Casablanca based on other reviews. Not the newest, not the biggest, but a cozy place that makes everyone feel like they are at home, with great amenities (like continental breakfast and wine and cheese daily, and an open room with coffee and snacks all the time). Their attached restaurant is wonderful as well (Tony's di Napoli - think a cheaper and maybe better Carmine's).

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Fantastic property in the heart of NYC but without the noise! Discreetly tucked away in a side street off Times Square. Staff are excellent and go above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable. Definitely a hotel that's home from home wouldn't stay anywhere else.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Fifth time staying here. Lots of charm with the Moroccan decor , great location and friendly staff. Love Rick’s Cafe - great spot to hang out when I’m not out in the streets of NYC. Has a nice little outdoor space

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: . No complaints at all! Highly recommend! Would definitely return.Great location, large continental breakfast with attentive staff. Wonderful wine and cheese. Would definitely return. Price very reasonable.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Outstanding amenities services and staff.willdo it again. Recommend to my friends. Front desk people were unbelievable. Vincent was great. The hotel itself was what I expected and even more. Don’t change anything

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We have just stayed at this hotel for three nights. It is amazing. Centrally located near Time Square, superb staff, lovely room and brilliant breakfast. We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. It’s central location is a real asset.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I have grown up going to New York. Most of my family is from there. My family and I went on a road trip to Time Square and decided to stay at the Casablanca Hotel. I absolutely loved it. It wasn’t overly commercialized and I like that. It is only 5 stories so keep that in mind. You can still have a nice view of the city. I definitely stay here again when I come back.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My wife Marie and I had the recent pleasure to spend a week at the luxurious Casablanca Hotel Times Square.Firstly, I must mention the staff - or should I say family - they are all SO friendly, helpful, well-represented, cheerful, smiling (can people REALLY be so happy at their job?).From our arrival until our departure, we were made to feel part of the 'family' and on our return from our first exploratory venture out with the hotel, we were greeted with "Welcome home!" - a really nice touch.Situated just a few yards from Times Square on Broadway, the location is unbeatable.Room was spotless and well maintained.Free coffee, cookies and pastries are available 24/7 in Rick's Cafe on first level.Continental buffet breakfast catered for all tastes.Special highlight is the three hour "cheese and wine evening" each night when guests - many of whom are regulars - meet and socialise whilst being kept replenished with wine, cheese, savouries and dips.You are not restricted in any way to just one or two glasses either. Delightful staff will approach and offer you endless refills.Room is turned down each evening and a card with weather forecast for following day is placed in room with a few chocolates - a lovely touch.Upon our (reluctant) return home we received a message from Casablanca Hotel saying, "Welcome to the family - you are now part of it!" This brought a nostalgic tear to Marie's eye.Yes... we shall return (home) to the enchanting Casablanca Hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed three nights. We found the staff very friendly and helpful through out our stay. The location just off Time Square again fab.One of the best features was the lounge on the first floor where breakfast is served and is open 24hrs for a coffee and a biscuit. The evening cheese and wine is a very nice touch as well. I must say for a continental breakfast it was great, toasted bagel, cream cheese and boiled egg very scummy....but plenty of fruit, cereals and danish's also available.Our one downer, and its very much a US thing, the double glazing keeps no noise out!! And being in the middle of NYC.......its 24hrs noise!! Not helped by us having a front room on a lower floor. Large HGV's came and went all night to the building opposite and thought nothing of using air horns at any time of the night!! But it's NYC!!We picked us a car put it in the garage next door for the last night which was so handy and you get a deal with the hotel!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Let me first start out by saying I have stayed in several NYC hotels for business and the Casablanca Hotel was incredible. Centrally located, clean rooms, kind and accommodating staff. They also had extra touches that made the trip so special. I would recommend staying here and would come back and only stay here again. Thank you for the memorable 10 year anniversary visit. You made it memorable and it was amazing.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Love this place.I have traveled World Wide for over 30 years with my job.My wife and i love New York and stay at The Casablanca Hotel for around 3 weeks each June for many years. The staff are outstanding, Rooms are great, breakfast is full on awesome.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Perfect Times Square location. Coming in from Penn Station, take subway 1,2,3 uptown to next stop, look for 43 & Broadway exit, this will take you Times Square, across the street from Hotel. Bags held until our room was ready while we got drinks at Bryant Park outside bar- be sure to visit the Park- summer or winter, 2 blocks away. Wine & cheese buffet, breakfast buffet as advertised - very nice sit down at Ricks lounge area on second floor. Our Premium King room perfect size and large for NY. Bathroom was spacious. We were in front, early AM construction noises could be annoying, but we are used to getting up early. Noises do come thru window air conditioner- suggest rear rooms may be quieter. No views from window. Pull down room darkening shades a plus for Times Square lights. Super friendly service as all previous reviewers mentioned. We did order the room refrigerator. No ice machine but ice could be ordered. Also ice is always at the lounge area with cookies, espresso , ice water, newspapers. No shows for us this trip, be sure to go to TKTS for same day tickets. One subway ( #7) stop away from Hudson Yards where we went up the amazing Vessel. A few block walk to bus to Met Museum. For meals, same block we recommend Heartland brew pub- steaks, Brooklyn Diner. Tony's and Lobster & Burger also on same block. Casablanca reminded us of all the great things of a European river cruise, like a family B&B. Highly Recommended,

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great location if you want to be right in Times Square; wonderful breakfast and wine/cheese reception; clean/comfortable room, large bathroom; staff great - we walked from Penn Station on a very hot day, when we arrived to check in, the doorman got us cold, bottled water. All the staff is excellent; friendly, welcoming. Definitely a great place to stay in NYC!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: It was our first stay at Casablanca Hotel but definitly not the last. The staff was very kind and the room very clean -thanks for good housekeeping. The included breakfast was of a very good quality. We enjoyed it much and the staff there was also very helpful. In the afternoon there was a daily wine and cheese reception which was also great.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Second time at Casablanca hotel, best hotel at all aspects , the staff and the service were great, the location is great near time square, Next time in nyc we definitely take this hotel again Thank you

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I needed a hotel for the last night of my New York stay and wanted to be near the Lyric Theater since I was attending Cursed Child and thought it would be nice to relax in my room between parts. The Casablanca Hotel seemed to fit the bill and the reviews were fantastic so I booked it!From the minute I walked into the hotel, I was impressed. The staff couldn't have been more gracious and welcoming. In fact, not even 5 minutes after I checked in, there was a knock on my door from the Housekeeping Manager ensuring my room was to my liking and handing me some chocolates as well as a card with the next day's weather. It was a much appreciated little detail! The bellman brought my luggage up shortly after that and it was obvious that he didn't expect a tip (although I did try to give him one). The hotel is one block away from the hustle and bustle of Time Square and the Theater District while still quiet and quaint. The rooms seem to be very sound-proof which I appreciated and they were well appointed.I also loved the cocktail hour with complementary wine, cheese, and fruit which could be enjoyed in your room or in the dining area adjacent to their library. One thing to note - this is an older hotel so the elevators are slow and a little rickety. In addition, the room I stayed in had a window air conditioner which did not do much to take the humidity out of the room but did cool it down considerably. All-in-all, I couldn't have loved this hotel more and just wish my stay could have been longer!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I , along with a friend, stayed in this hotel for the weekend in June. I discovered and booked through Expedia. It was lovely!!! Room was adequate in space as well as bathroom and well appointed in decor. Hotel was decorated in Moroccan style befitting its name. Breakfast service daily in mezzanine level with excellent service and food was delicious. Not only this but daily afternoon wine, tea, and hor doevres with excellent waitress service. Was in NYC for a memorial service but this hotel was quite a find. Will definitely stay on future visits.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I believe this was my 5th visit to this hotel. It’s just a gem in the hub of Times Square - yet incredibly safe. I often travel alone and I never feel unsafe or uncomfortable. Every member of staff is competent, respectful and polite.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Casablanca is a great small hotel. This is my 2nd time there & will continue to use when in NY City. It is located in Time Square so convenient to everything.They have a free continental breakfast & afternoon cookies & coffee.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This small boutique hotel, located one-half block from Times Square, in the heart of the Theatre District, completely exceeded our expectations. This was our first time staying at the Casablanca and we both agreed, this is where we will stay for return visits. The entire staff, no matter their position or responsibility, went above and beyond to make sure our stay was enjoyable. When booking the room, we let them know we'd be in town for a birthday celebration and attending a Yankees game. They so graciously had a complimentary bottle of Prosecco and red wine in our room, accompanied by happy birthday wishes! We also requested a mini fridge for our room. It was installed and ready to go upon our arrival. You know how some hotels have bottled water in your room for $5 or more a bottle? Not here. Those were also complimentary and replenished each day, as well as chocolates left in our room each evening. We weren't certain of the best way to get to Yankee stadium - they gave explicit instructions on the use of the subway, which Metro card to purchase, directions to the closest stop and the most direct route to and from the game (it couldn't have been easier). The complimentary Continental breakfast each morning was delicious, including juices, cereal, yogurt, pastries and bagels, fresh fruit and eye-opening coffee (the "breakfast ladies" were so gracious and accommodating each morning). Sadly, we were only able to enjoy a quick glass of wine one evening, but all the accoutrements looked so yummy, we'll be sure to make time for this next visit. After reading other reviews, we were a bit leery of using the parking garage next door, but again, there were no issues and the hotel staff made sure we received the discount for hotel guests. A special shout out to Victor (best doorman ever) - he made sure we had everything we needed, no request was too big or too small and his quick bite recommendations were spot on.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed here for a long weekend and was very impressed with the hotel , the staff were excellent, very friendly and couldn’t do enough for us . Rooms were very nice, clean and comfortable. Location was a few steps from Times Square, would definitely recommend and would stay here again . 1st class!!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This was our 4th visit to the hotel. Once again really enjoyed our stay. Good facilities in the room. Breakfast and cheese and wine at night both good. Like that you can have tea/coffee all day. We checked out in the morning morning and left our bags but staff told us to use as our home until we needed to leave which was a nice touch. On the corner of times square but an oasis of calm compared to everything happening outside. Would definitely recommend hopefully will be able to visit again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: On arrival it felt like a oasis in the middle of Times Square. So quiet when you walked in the door! The staff are extremely friendly & attentive.Love the fact you are offered such an amazing array of breakfast, coffee, wine & cheese during the day at no additional cost. Such a lovely touch in the middle of the US!Tea & coffee making facilities in the room which consisted of a kettle, first one in 5 hotels I had stayed in, in the US this trip. Normally those awful Nespresso machines!Room clean & all toiletries included in the bathroom.The only issue I personally had at this hotel was the noise from the window air conditioning unit, issue of staying in the US I guess!All in all a great small hotel with lovely staff & extra’s which you would not find normally! Very much enjoyed my stay.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great location. Very friendly, professional staff that excelled at meeting our every need. Great recommendations for places to eat within easy walking distance of the hotel. We wish we could have stayed longer!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great location in Times Square, easy walk to all of the Broadway theaters. The included breakfasts, all day snacks and coffee, and the 5PM wine and chess etc is a great time saver and oh so convenient. We ordered dinner from Tony Di Napolis next door, and had dinner at the Casablanca sipping wine etc. Made it very easy to have a relaxed dinner and still get to our Broadway show. The staff is very friendly, helpful, and accommodating. We WILL be back!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca Hotel is a gem. Located in midtown Manhattan, it is literally steps from Times Square. Stanley & Victor greeted us and we felt so welcome from the moment we stepped through the foyer. Maria, who assisted at breakfast as wonderful. It is a lovely place to enjoy a NYC vacation.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I loved that the hotel is just off Times Square. You get all the convenience of the location but do not hear all the hustle of Times Square. Breakfast is good and the evening wine and cheese is delightful to make the transition from a day of sightseeing to going out to see a play.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Ideal location, very friendly and helpful staff. From the minute we arrived we received excellent service. Having the choice at breakfast was brilliant as was the afternoon cheese and wine. It was also excellent to be able to get tea and coffee 24 hours a day!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I just spent 5 nights at the Casablanca. I was traveling with my Aunt and wanted her to have a special first-time trip to NYC. The Casablanca did not disappoint. First, prior to even arriving at the hotel, Brian Castro provided a ton of information to help us plan for our trip. He also allowed us to select from a variety of services, such as arranged transportation, refrigerator in the room, foam toppers and foam pillows for the bed, makeup mirror and so much more! He knew that I wanted this to be a special trip....and when we opened the door to our suite, a bottle of wine and glasses treated us. After we had unloaded our luggage, we went back to the desk and throughout our entire trip, had excellent assistance from Johan at the desk. He helped us set up the Big Bus Tour, made recommendations on where to eat, showed us maps of how to get there and more. He was truly exceptional as well! It was a delight to see him at the front desk each of the five nights that we were there. We took advantage of the morning breakfast, which was light, but everything was neatly arranged and served with such kindness. We even used this second floor dining area to bring back food and sat at the tables available to have a nice lunch. And our room, we had booked a suite room, which was nice to have the extra size. We had one room with two double beds, another room like a living room and then the bathroom. Was perfect to meet our needs. If I ever get a chance to come back to NYC, I would not even consider staying anywhere else but the Casablanca!!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We booked this place because of the excellent reviews. How wrong them reviews were. This place is overrated.- rooms conditions like earliest 1930’s.- Dark tiny cold and very noisy room, thank goodness to my sleeping pill, or I wouldn’t have been able to sleep!!- No coffee maker neither a fridge in the room, this means if you want your morning coffee, you have to put your clothes on, and venture down to the overcrowded breakfast room (POS The ladies there were very nice especially Maria).- No heat in the bathroom - Weak internet The prices were very high, and the hotel didn’t live up to expectations. With all of the options in New York, there are much better places for less money.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great location & accommodations. It was Central to everything we needed in the Broadway Theater District. The decor was beautiful. The Complimentary amenities were perfect. All in all it was great for our stay in NYC.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Casablanca is the best hotel in NYC. I have stayed in many hotels in Manhattan, and we keep going back here. It is in a great location, right in the heart of Times Square, but very quiet and intimate. Breakfast is included, as is wine and cheese every evening, and a piano player on Friday nights. It is a hidden gem in Times Square.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Pros include breakfast, happy hour, knowledgeable front desk employees, and cleanliness. Cons include dated decor, small rooms, slow and BUMPY elevators, frosted windows, loud air conditioner, resort fee, and no notification for early check-in. It's a little too far south for most of the theaters. We also didn't like the fact that they demanded payment up front, months in advance, with Expedia.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is the most beautiful hotel filled with characters and charm. As the name suggests the decor is largely Moroccan. It’s quaint but full of character. The staff are exceptional and the customer service outstanding.
user_name:
Angela L
Auckland Central, New Zealand

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: ALL the staff were wonderful. Everyone went out of their way to help you. Fantastic location. I would not look for another hotel when you plan your trip to New York City. Even my husband said we need to come back here, he never has any input...just goes.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Love this hotel for convenience, amenities, and staff. This is our third trip to this hotel and look forward to our next visit. The breakfast and nightly wine and cheese our outstanding in a comfortable setting.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We have stayed at this hotel several times when traveling to NYC. It is our first choice if available. We have been very happy with all of the amenities as well as the excellent location, breakfast and happy hour!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Casablanca is perfectly located to Time Square and downtown New York. The hotel theme and boutique style makes you feel at hotel as soon as you walk in! The staff care fir each and every guest, they have return guests and it’s like a family!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel is a hidden gem right off Times Square. Customer service was EXCELLENT beginning at room booking and continued throughout our entire trip. Rooms were quiet and very clean. The beds were super comfortable! This is our new go to for our family New York Trips !

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is a great small hotel. Feels very upscale yet still has its own personality. Loved the afternoon happy hour and the continental breakfast. It feels more like a home in the common spaces than a hotel. Staff is super service oriented. We will be back.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: If you are looking for a quiet oasis in a storm of activity and noise which is New York then the Casablanca is perfect for you.I have traveled all over the world in many hotels and this as is close to a home from home experience.The location is perfect ( just off Times square)The staff are excellent and will often go that extra mile and they make you feel genuinely welcome and they actually look like they are enjoying their work.From a great Continental breakfast to mid day snacks, coffee & tea to the lovely wine and cheese early evening treat ( All free) you feel looked after.The rooms are a good size and are spotless and are cleaned daily with good air con to help you sleep.i cannot recommend this hotel enough as it ticks all the boxes and it helped make my wife's 50th birthday trip even more special.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel makes one feel "at home". The staff were very friendly and helpful the decor inspires a warm athosphere and small tokens of good will such as happy hour free wine made us feel really welcome.When in New York we will be happy to come back and stay at the Casablanca Hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We just stayed a few nights at the Casablanca again. We were supposed to go on a trip with my parents but they unfortunately had to cancel due to my dad's surgery so it just ended up being my wife and me. This is our 3rd or 4th time staying there and it's still as great as it was the first time. Staff is SUPER friendly and if you are seeing shows on Broadway, the location is superb. Love the breakfast every morning and the snacks throughout the day. Our room was very quiet and everything worked great. Once my dad heals up, we'd love to get them back to the Casablanca

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I cannot praise this hotel enough. It is a little oasis in the middle of busy Times Square. The rooms are small but extremely clean and comfortable. The staff are amongst the best staff I have ever encountered. We loved the 'wine and cheese' hour along with the all day coffee and pastries.The atmosphere in this hotel is truly special and the staff make you feel truly special. Thank you.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Having just returned from a three night stay at this hotel after almost 20 trips to New York, I am speechless! There are no words to describe how wonderful this place is! From the first phone call to James who made me feel like I was family and welcome beyond words, to arriving to a smiling and “happy to meet me” check in staff person at the front desk, this has been one of the most enjoyable stays ever! I will never stay anywhere else! Period.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel was wonderful and very cozy. It is located in Times Square. The library room has continuous snacks and drinks. It is a great place to sit, talk, and unwind. The hotel is very clean. The room had a nostalgic look to it, but was not old. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We have just returned from a 5 Night stay at the Casablanca hotel. It was a special trip as we were celebrating our 40th anniversary, we picked the Casablanca as it had such good reviews. Check in was quick and friendly but we were so disappointed when we saw the room, it was tiny (even by New York standard's) and so dark as light from the small window was blocked by the fire escape, the bathroom door when opened hit the bed. We rang down to reception and asked if we could change rooms as we didn't fancy staying in this room for 5 nights, I had emailed the hotel before we came and told them it was our 40th anniversary but reception said the e-mail wasn't passed on to them. The reception said that they would see what they could do and ring us back shortly. A few minutes later we got a call from Asim the front desk manager who apologised and said he would move us to a superior room for 4nights and we would move to another room the last night even though the hotel was fully booked. This room was much bigger and brighter, he also sent up a bottle of wine and champagne to celebrate our anniversary which was a lovely touch. On our second day Asim met us as we came into the reception area and introduced us to John the hotel manager who asked us if everything was okay and said he would send up an ice cream cake which was beautiful On our last day we changed rooms which was a few doors away and they only difference was it didn't have a street view We had a great time in New York in the Casablanca hotel and would definitely go back, the hotel is close to Times square and all the attractions Our trip was made special by all the staff from Victor at the door to Ashley and the girls at breakfast to John the manager and especially Asim who made our stay so memorable

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We chose this hotel for our honeymoon even though 3 seperate travel agents tried to tall us out of it and stay in one of their boring reccomended hotels! And it didnt disappoint i would never stay anywhere else in new york. Fab staff. Fab location. Best coffee in newyork!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The staff is beyond the best!!!! Helpful, funny and a delight to interact with.After 5 night stay, the bkfst gets repetitive; but is tasty.Wine and cheese delicious and a great way to meet others.Room and bed were comfortable and there was always hot water for the shower.We WILL stay again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We enjoyed the location being right at Times Square and close to the theaters and local restaurants.. We did not have to use the subway very often, because everything was within walking distance. This was one of the cleanest rooms I've ever stayed in...and I've traveled all over the world. The staff always had a smile on their faces, and eager to assist! Very quiet room. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and the afternoon wine and cheese service. This will definitely be my choice of NYC hotel in the future.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Spent 4 nights at the excellent Casablanca hotel at the end of May, our first time in New York. What a treat! A quality and welcoming hotel with personal touches and a real sense of charm. Attentive and helpful staff, always in hand to assist and advise with a dedication to customer care that was greatly appreciated. Full marks all round, thank you.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Best hotel in New York, a real hidden gem. They will treat you like family.......no, they treat you BETTER THAN FAMILY. We had some glitches in our travel arrangements and the Casablanca staff bent over backwards to ensure that our New York trip was fantastic. If you want the best, stay with the best!! Casablanca is a wonder home away from home.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is our fifth stay at the Casablanca Hotel. Why? Location, safety, service and overall staff excellence. This hotel is In the middle of everything that is exciting in New York City… You may walk to Broadway shows, Times Square, multiple restaurants, Chelsea, Bryant Park, Murray Hill, to New York public library or to Grand Central Station or take the multiple subways outlets to the uptown museums or downtown area. Yet when you get inside this hotel you feel that you are in a safe, friendly, charming place. It’s a relatively small hotel. There is no reason for you to visit this hotel unless you’re staying there. That brings an element of safety to your New York visit. Casablanca offers to its guests complimentary 24 hours tea, coffee and water. Also offer a complimentary basic breakfast and an evening wine and cheese. Rooms and bathrooms are very clean. But over everything they offer help, service and attention to details. The staff makes the hotel the best.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel far exceeds anybody's expectations of a fine NYC hotel - the staff, the service, the cleanliness of the rooms, the decor throughout this hotel, the food, entertainment and first class service well epitomizes the New York City experience!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Friendly boutique style hotel right in the middle of Times Square. Couldn’t have had a better place to stay with my elderly parents and teenaged sons. Great food, personable staff, lots of room to stretch out in when we were tired of the city noise.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: So close to Times Square, theaters and NYC sights, this marvelous hotel provides excellent service and attentive staff at a reasonable price. The amenities are nice. Especially welcome is the wine and cheese reception offered each night. The staff is friendly, attentive, and made us feel welcome and valued. The rooms are not large but are well appointed and comfortable. The Casablanca has a classic feel and look.
user_name:
David F
Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great hotel, bit of calmness away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. No sit down restaurant meals here but they do do breakfast, not cooked, more continental. They lay on pastries and tea in the afternoon and cheese and wine snacks in the evening.Staff are great, really helpful, not in your face but just the right balance. Rooms were fine for us, nicely decorated, clean and tidy. Had everything we could need, for our stay, useful information on the local area as well. The room was slightly warm but there is ceiling fan and air conditioning.I would definitely go back here.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We LOVE this hotel. Quiet with lots of charm and character in the heart of Time Square. Amazing location if you want to be close to the action on this side of town. The staff was friendly and attentive to all of our needs. Victor was awesome and directed us to where we needed to go every time we walked out the door.We especially enjoyed the morning breakfast and evening snacks. Complimentary water and wifi in the room. We had a late evening flight and left our bags for the day, which was very convenient. Will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Friendly helpful staff,great for meeting fellow guests at breakfast and cheese and wine evenings love the groups concept but probably select hotel away from Times Square in future trips but that is an individual opinon not a reflection of the standard of the CasablancaComfy rooms and beds but try not to get room at front as early morning traffic can be noisy

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel is in a great location, with a secure entrance and a very professional team.The hotel lounge furniture was more suited for a conservatory but comfortable enough. Breakfast was fruit, yogurt, pastries, hard boiled eggs and toast would be supplied if requested. Plenty of hot drinks and juices, all self service. There was only one morning where we had to share a table with other guests, as breakfast time was so busy.The wine with cheese and biscuits between 5-8pm is a great idea, not that we really had time to participate.We would be more than happy to stay at this hotel again and would be more than happy to recommend to other visitors.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A half block from Time Square, and yet an oasis of calm and tranquility. As tourists to the city we found the staff friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. We enjoyed the complimentary cheese and wine in the evening and the continental style breakfast in the morning. Albeit they do charge a daily “resort fee”.Our room was small, but spotlessly clean and as we were out most of the day the soft comfortable beds were all we really used it for. The bathroom was good size, and again very clean.We ad expected it to be noisy, given location, but we weren’t disturbed at night.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: One of the best and most unique hotels in the city. Outstanding service, good size rooms, and comfortable lounge area. There may be less expensive hotels in the area, but it's worth the extra to stay here.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Perfect location< very nice and very polite staff, Breakfast included and from 17.00 to 20.00 hrs free wine and lots of snacks.The staff at the reception very knowledgeable for directions, book a restaurant, arranged private pickup from and returned to the airport.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: this will be my hotel in New York from now on. the best ever. great location, lovely staff allways willing to help, biutifull and cleen room, very styleish with butifull decoration. the coffee and cake in the lobby are great.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Staff were very welcoming! Hotel was clean but old. Noisy through wall air conditioner was functional. Lounge was a wonderful perk. with complimentary coffee, tea, snacks available throughout day. Great location.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great stay and very friendly staff. Especially enjoyed the wine and cheese reception each evening. Rooms were very comfortable and well designed. We had a mini suite which gave us some additional room.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The location is ideal and the decor lovely. As an 84 yo woman traveling alone, I appreciated the attentive service and friendliness of all staff, as well as the time saved in my days by the hotel's very ample breakfast and the evening reception. An emergency meant I had to check out early, and very hurriedly. The manager, front and other staff saw to making itinerary changes for me, and to all other needs during that hectic morning. Throughout my life I've traveled widely and in my experience, the Casablanca is a hotel nonpareil.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I spent a few days in this hotel in May and absolutely LOVED it! The staff is incredibly nice. They saw that my daughter was graduating and left us a bottle of champagne in the room! You can hear a pin drop in the rooms it's so quiet but when you walk out you are in the middle of NY City--right next to Times Square. They have a lovely breakfast sitting area where there is always tea, coffee, fruit and snacks all day long (as well as a complimentary Happy Hour). Just a brilliant place to stay (and I'm super picky!)

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Really convenient, half block from Times Square. Walkable to all theaters and anything in midtown. Once Inside you’d never know. Like taking a step back to slower, quieter times in old NYC. Clean and comfy plus convenient if simple breakfast and happy hour. Only weird thing is opaque windows. Could see if it was light out, but no idea if it was raining or sunny until we headed outSide

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I will definitely be back to stay at this small, intimate, beautiful hotel. It's quiet (no children), relaxing, and very convenient. Friendly staff welcomes you every time you come through the door! The lounge with breakfast, snacks, and wine in the evenings is a wonderful, relaxing place to take a break from walking and sightseeing and the noise of the city.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel is a pleasure overall. The staff are all fantastically knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. The room was comfy with a very spacious bathroom. The breakfast was great. My husband enjoyed the free tea and cookies at all hours. They could improve the coffee though.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Had an issue with threshold between bedroom and bathroom- uneven and a possible trip/fall hazard and not marked - almost did a face plant when I first checked in ... that’s why I did a “not so great” on safety BUT otherwise this place is fun, charming, great staff and in the heart of an exciting part of town, and, of course ...Everybody goes to Rick’s!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A fantastic find in the middle of the NYC theatre district. Amazing staff who catered to my every need. The day room, Ricks Place is a nice easy going area to meet fellow travelers while enjoying breakfast, afternoon wine and cheese or round the clock pastries and tea.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Fantastic hotel. Offered a quiet retrieve from the hustle and bustle of NY. Room clean and comfortable, staff couldn’t be more helpful. Complimentary drinks and snacks were ideal. Would stay again if ever back visiting!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Perfect location, perfect ambience, perfect hosts. Every single member of staff was incredibly helpful and all had great personalities. Morning coffee and pastries, and evening cheese and wine, was a godsend in this otherwise expensive city. The rooms were very clean and comfortable too. First time here but not the last - I wouldn't stay anywhere else now when in New York.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My husband and I stayed in this quirky, beautiful hotel a few weeks ago and we loved it. The staff are incredibly helpful, the rooms are comfortable and the breakfast in Ricks Cafe was perfect. The location is right next to Times Square and, although busy, this hotel is the perfect little oasis in the city. We thoroughly enjoyed our time here and I’m already recommending this hotel to friends. Many thanks to the staff for making us feel so welcome in your beautiful hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca hotel is a few feet away from Times Square which makes it great for attending a show. What sets this place apart is the server, everyone is so incredibly helpful and pleasant, I've never seen anything like it. With free breakfast and a wine/cheese reception nightly you are well taken care of. The only thing is I wouldn't get a street view room again, the lights and noise from Times Square were bothersome but they offer complimentary white noise makers, light blockers, etc. to help with this.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Very central location, in heart of Times Square. Very noisy outside but inside of the hotel is very calm. Breakfast was good. We only missed omlete with bacon. We liked so much "happy hour" with wine and cheese. During all day you drink coffe and water, eat some cookies.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Snack bar - awesome idea. Comfortable hotel with good service. I like the gym (NYSC) access which is 2 blocks away - fully equipped. Excellent location for access to shops. Very pleased with my stay and would recommend this to others.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Just returned from our third stay at the Casablanca. Always will be our first choice. Great location, close to theatre and times square but quiet and serene once you are in this boutique property. Rooms are the usual small NYC size, but clean, quiet and comfortable. Rick's Cafe is a great amenity to enjoy breakfast, wine and cheese or just kick back.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My friend and I visit NYC every May. We always stay at the Casablanca. We are always treated like family. Each employee is very friendly and would do anything to help you. The hotels location is perfect for what we need. We feel right at home.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Its the only place where you would stay in New York just the best, close to everything great breakfast and the most wonderful staff and a great room. We have stayed there twice and hope there are more stays to come

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A lovely quaint stylish hotel conveniently located just off Times Square. The Casablanca is a beautifully stylish hotel with all the charms of the past. The hotel was spotlessly clean from the small reception area up to the comfortable and relaxing rooms.The guys on the front desk were exceptionally friendly and helpful as was the doorman. Ricks Cafe on the second floor was conveniently positioned with a continental style breakfast available every morning, coffee tea and snacks throughout the day and wine cheese and snacks available in the evening, all complimentary.The room on the 5th floor overlooking 93rd Street was spacious and clean with a good sized bathroom. Ironing facilities and a decent hair dryer which my wife tells me is essential on any trip, are available along with daily complimentary bottles of water and a safe deposit box.The thing I like about this hotel was its proximity to the busy Times Square being only 50 yards away but turn into 93rd street and the hustle and bustle just disappears.To eat - Tony’s right next door is a busy reasonable priced Italian and HB Burgers just up the street is also reasonably priced by New York standards.It was a bit noisy at night hence a 4 and not a 5 star review. This was due not to the hoards of people on Times Square but to the NYPD vehicles parked outside the hotel on 93rd. It did give a feeling of security but why do they have to switch on there siren for a short blast every time they move away! A bit annoying in the middle of the night but on day three we used a ‘noise cancelling device’ in the room which made an ocean wave sound! Surprisingly I slept like a log for the rest of the stay!!Overall the hotel was excellent and would recommend to anyone who is looking for a hotel with a comfortable, convenient and above all personal touch then this is the place for you.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel offers excellent customer service. Has a great location, just off Times SquareThe staff are all very friendly and made us feel part of their family, they could not do enough for usThe buffet breakfast was very good, not just croissants and pastries but also fresh fruit salad and a variety of breads and bagels for toastingAlso the cheese and wine sessions went down a treatThe room was very clean and the bed was so comfortable

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We visit the city several times a year and enjoy trying different hotels. Totally loved the unique, specialexperience at the Casablanca. Even though it is a few steps from Times Square, when you walk into the charming lobby it’s like a hidden jewel. James welcomed us with warm, enthusiastic information about the space. The rooms are small, very clean. we had the suite which was perfect for 3. Rick’s on the second floor is like a 24 club level for everyone. There is a lovely breakfast with pastries, coffee, juices, bagels, etc and the staff is so nice. Maria was so sweet to toast bagels and serve us with such care. They really wait on you hand and foot making sure you have everything you need and so sweet with special requests (trays for taking things to room, etc). There is a 3 hour wine and cheese time that is perfect between NY activities. The front desk is always ready to help with dinner reservations, anything you need. The location is perfect, great value. We will be back.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Just back from a 5 night stay at this amazing hotel we were a group of 12 the staff are amazing couldn’t do enough for us always smiling and helpful on the main reception, rooms were beautiful and clean ,plenty of choices for breakfast and free coffee and tea and cakes plus free cheese and wine from 5till 8 after a very busy day sightseeing this was really lovely ,cannot recommended this hotel enough we hope to come back soon xx❤️❤️

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Excellent hotel , served all our needs, would definitely stay there again , it’s like an oasis in a busy part of New York, the room was lovely, staff friendly and informative, wine and cheese was a nice touch.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Staff was helpful and ensured a happy experience. Proximity to Broadway and midtown sites was important to us. Ricks Cafe with breakfast, snacks and Wine and Cheese Bar guaranteed a great times. Can’t wait until we go back to New York City!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great hotel in the heart of Times Square. An oasis from city chaos. Old world flavor in a thriving city. Steps away from Broadway and city transportation. Staff are personable and accommodating. Free wine and cheese from 5 to 8. Outstanding hotel. Well worth a stay.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This place is so close to everything, and if you need anything, the hotel staff will take care of it for you. John (the General Manager) treats us like family every time we stay at the Casablanca Hotel. That's why we have stayed there every year since 2007 when we discovered this gem!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca hotel is lovely.. It is steps away from Times Square, yet once you step inside you feel like you are in a small inn. The rooms were nicely decorated with modern bathrooms. We were upgraded from our original choice overlooking the courtyard to a room next to the elevator which was a bit noisy; however when I expressed my concerns we were moved to another room towards the back of the hotel which was very quiet. The breakfast, snacks throughout the day and cocktail hour were well worth the add-on fee. The staircase leading to the lounge/dining area is surrounded by a beautiful mural. We were only in town for an overnight stay to celebrate our anniversary but felt whisked away to another time and place.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: It is the second time that we used the Casablanca Hotel with my family by visiting New York. The location is perfect, the staff great and possibly we will use the same Hotel in our next visit. I would agree with all the extra positive remarks I read in the different reviews apart from one, the breakfast! Very simple!! I travel a lot and have stayed in different Hotels all over the world so I have some experience. I could accept that there is no omelette, I actually don't eat eggs, but no cheese, no ham, no choice of breads. Many pastries full of butter, two different types of butter, nothing lighter and healthier. The marmalades with a flat texture, could be better, The coffee was good, from machine but now this is becoming standard.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Location is perfect, a stones throw from Times Square. Hotel is extremely dated, everything is old and for the price it just didn’t feel up to speck. Our double room was tiny which is normal for new york. The decor and excessive amount of furniture made it even smaller. Bathroom was tiny and we had to move the bed to close the door. There was a tiny TV in the room and we were extremely disappointed as the website states premium channels yet they didn’t have HBO (we’re all big GOT fans and had to book a room at another hotel for the night to watch it). The staff are extremely friendly and welcoming. The breakfast was perfect for what it was, I don’t understand how such an expensive hotel do not offer a hot menu. However, the selection of cold items was great. Overall, It was not worth the price we paid and I feel anyone with high expectations will be disappointed.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: It is the staff and service that makes this hotel so wonderful . Breakfast and wine and cheese reception is another reason. Both were spectacular !! Would definitely stay here again while in manhattan .
user_name:
KCfromKCNY
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We love this hotel! It is clean, conveniently located, comfortable, and the staff is outstanding. They are friendly and helpful -- they even recognize us on return visits. We love the breakfast in the second-floor lounge and always encounter interesting people there. The food is fresh, with good choices.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Upon late arrival we had a problem with our driver. The hotel staff immediately got involved to help us in what was a rather awkward situation and the problem was resolved. The room was very clean and well appointed and amazingly quiet considering it is so close to Times Square. The staff are exceptional, friendly, helpful, knowledgeable - absolutely second to none!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Enjoyed the Casablance Hotel very much. Nice and quiet. Close to Times Square and theaters. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Breakfast nice, basic fare. Evening wine social enjoyable. Tony di Napoli next door and very good. Will return.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This was a wonderful place to stay in NYC! Great location, clean and pristine room, helpful and accommodating staff. This was a birthday weekend. The staff left cupcakes and a bottle of wine in the room. The cafe has refreshments available all day long. I do not have one complaint about the Casablanca. Only praises! Thank you for a n enjoyable stay!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: location great - just off times square - 30m.cleanliness - fantastic.staff - superb. especially all the reception guys.lounge - no bar but free coffee and snacks 24hs and free wine and snacks 5pm till 8pm every evening.breakfast - continental but totally ample and very fresh.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We’ve just returned from a four night stay at this hotel. We had high expectations due to the reviews and it didn’t disappoint. For us, it had the ideal location - right next to the madness of Times Square and within minutes of a subway station. Maybe the hotel was quite low on numbers when we were there as we only ever came across a handful of other guests throughout our stay. We are early risers and the 7am start to breakfast suited us very well and we had no trouble with finding a table. We popped back to the hotel a few times on our days out and it was quite handy to pop into Rick’s to get a tea/coffee. The ladies serving in there were always friendly and we found the Continental breakfast varied enough for us, with the staff offering to toast bagels or bread, if required.The hotel is a bit dark and dingy in places and our room on the 6th floor was particularly so - with no natural light as such. However, the hotel was amazingly quiet, particularly considering it’s proximity to Times Square and as a light sleeper, I was grateful for this. Also, there was very little noise from doors closing and guests walking up and down the corridors.We took advantage of the DVD library and although the majority of the films were fairly old, we chose three classics (in our opinion) set in New York. The doormen were always courteous and were very helpful when it came to storing our bags on our final day. The hotel even allows you to use Rick’s after you have checked out.To us, this hotel has a family-run feel to it and we would have no problem in recommending this as a place to stay.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This was our first stay in any Library Hotel and for the most part very enjoyable. We arrived at 6 am from a red eye flight. Ground level entry is a small room with front desk, and the attendant said he would expedite turnover of our room for check-in. We were directed to the 2nd floor to hang out in the lounge (Rick's Cafe) which is open 24/7. The lounge is moderately comfortable with water, coffee, cookies available at all times. Continental breakfast (pastries, bagels, cereal, fruit) started at 7 am. We continued to wait for our room hopefully; the staff was very attentive, and twice during the morning went down to the front desk to check on our room. At 2 pm our room still wasn't ready, and we gave up and headed out so as not to waste the whole day; this was the only disappointment of our stay, hard to believe housekeeping could not have our room ready sooner (to be fair, check-in is at 3, but given checkout is noon...). The hotel is literally steps from Times Square, perfect Midtown location. And Tony's di Napoli, which we always enjoy, is adjacent. After finally checking in late afternoon, our luggage was brought up promptly. We had a premium king room, which was fairly large (even by NY standards). The room faced a small interior space, so there was no view, but also no noise; due to the proximity of other rooms across, we kept the shade closed; as there is only one window, and with the interior room location, there was not much sunlight, so some may not like the dark atmosphere of the room. A dorm-style fridge was very convenient; complimentary bottled water was replenished every day. The small bathroom did not feel cramped. The shower head was nice, and there was instant hot water. We stayed 3 nights, mainly to see Broadway shows, and the staff was very pleasant throughout.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is an older, relatively small, well refurbished hotel with an attractive Bogey/Bergman/Morocco decor and a charming second floor lounge for relaxing and snacks. We had a small suite that was pleasant and comfortable, and surprisingly quiet. The staff is incredibly welcoming and caring. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights April 2019 , the room was clean , towels changed daily and quiet.I appreciate that getting a room in New York without traffic / street noise is a bonus but it’s nice to have daylight in the room . We had a room on 5 th floor , upgraded apparently as we were celebrating my retirement . One small window looking into a void housing the fire escape . No further on that . The dining room here doubles as communal sitting area etc.Breakfast may take many visits before finding seating , even if it’s only at a coffee table, it’s way too small for the capacity .Staff are excellent from reception to room service staff , superb.Location is good , 1 minute from times sq and Bryant Park . Please don’t take this as negative review but very honest finding .
user_name:
lucydog2808
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great find! Although a half block from Times Square, once inside you would never know you were so close to all the action,. Quiet, comfortable, and great service. We loved the easy access to everything, especially a couple subway stops. But it was a great respite from the action. The breakfast was perfect, and the happy hour even better. Both served in a spacious comfortable setting.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This was our third time staying at this hotel. Staff is amazing, rooms are nice, and the location is perfect. We will definitely stay here on our next visit. It's the perfect location for anything you want to do, see, or eat!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The location is right in the heart of Times Square and close to all Manhattan attractions. The staff is superb and their customer service is the same. Nightly wine reception in the library and a morning continental breakfast is icing on the cake. Highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This property is perfect...especially, if it is your first trip to New York. Easy walk to Central Park or to Rockafeller Center. Bryant Park is beautiful and close to the New York Public Library (definitely worth seeing). There is just so much to see and do. The subway access is easy or start walking in either direction to begin exploring. The hotel is very quiet and relaxing after a day (or night) of your special adventure. You won't be disappointed!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A great place to stay in the heart of Manhattan. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was quiet with a super King size bed. And loved having a true bathtub to soak in. Rick’s lounge is a treasure.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The room was spacious and clean, the staff could not do enough for us. The lounge was great and the best was when a patron started playing the piano during happy hour and about 20 people started singing alone--it was so much fun.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed in a room with one queen bed. It had a small table directly in the room and we were able to get a mini fridge. The bathroom had a stand up shower (no tub). The room was much bigger than what I expected in NYC and it was very clean. Definitely worth the cost.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I enjoyed my second stay here immensely. Perfect location, great staff, quiet room, and the bed was super comfy. All of this and the price was very reasonable. Any time I come back to the city, I definitely will be staying here.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We returned for our fourth visit. The hotel ticks all the boxes and we would not think of staying anywhere else in New York.We can fault anything. The breakfast and drinks reception are a great touch.We will return for our 4th visit soon.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: reasonable NY price and you get security, great service, love ambience of personal and public rooms, great breakfast, and although we rarely get the opportunity to participate in happy hour, a great happy hour

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I always stay at Casablanca. I very selfishly hate for it be discovered. My sisters stay there also. My husband likes the fact that I am safe. I like being able to walk to the theater and great restaurants.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed here four years ago, and liked it so much that we came back. Unfortunately, my wonderful review did not go unnoticed, and others like it so much that they have raised their prices. Still worth it though. My wife asked during our stay, why is this a four star hotel? It's not been recently renovated, and the rooms aren't that special? My answer was that although it's not all new and shiny, everything worked, the beds were good, nothing is "worn out" but it's really the service. From the door men to the concierge to the housekeeping and the young ladies that serve continental breakfast and pour the wine in the afternoon, everyone is nice, professional and extremely helpful. A five star hotel would be all that and maybe a bit more up-to-date, but you'll also pay twice the price.On top of that, you are literally steps away from Times Square and a block or two from Hell's Kitchen. The rooms are quiet - I never heard any neighbors, and they have improved the A/C since last time so that they don't make a racket. If I had to pick something to complain about, I'd mention the very small, very slow and probably very old elevators. Our first trip there was in a standard room, which is typically NYC small and cramped. This time I splurged on a suite, and it (for me) was worth the extra money. The bathroom was either extremely well maintained or recently redone. The furniture, although not new, is all in excellent condition. The beds were neither extremely firm nor soft, but we both slept very well. Far too often hotel beds are lumpy and worn out; this was not the case at the Casablanca.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We arrived about 0830 on Sunday morning and check-in isn’t until 1500. We weren’t worried because we have stayed here before. We knew they would be kind and thoughtful and they didn’t disappoint us. We received a warm welcome from a couple of dapper chaps at reception and they assured us that even though the hotel was fully booked, they would endeavour to get us into the room as soon as possible. In the meantime, they invited us to have breakfast upstairs in Rick’s Cafe. We gave Victor our luggage for safe-keeping and up the stairs we went, happy to read a complimentary New York Times and choose from a wonderful array of cereals, pastries, fruit, coffees and teas and juices. Yum. Oh, and hard-boiled eggs. Top quality, everything fresh, and a lovely young woman toasting breads and bagels, keeping the counter and room refreshed and tidy. We were in a blissful state and it couldn’t get better when it was announced to us that our room was available at 1015.Room 410 is a good size, heavenly king mattress and lots of gorgeous bedding including several types of pillows from which to choose. They make it clear that your wish is their command and they really mean it. We met several members of housekeeping and maintenance who were lovely as well and keep the rooms so clean and organized.This hotel just makes us happy. You know those little niggling things that occur in hotels such as a lack of organisation or cleanliness or thoughtfulness? Well, relax when you enter this haven of hospitality. The team are one step ahead of you. They have anticipated your needs and are there to serve. With sincerity and smiles.Whoever owns this hotel must have a policy of hiring only kind people and wanting the guests to be happy, I don’t think I have ever felt this way with any other hotel. I love it here and am so grateful for their business acumen. It doesn’t feel like money is the most important thing; guests are. We know there are three other hotels owned by the same company and we are curious to try them. Undoubtedly they are excellent as well but the Casablanca instils such loyalty in us that it is hard to book even at another Library Hotel. (But next time we might try. Maybe).

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed at the Casablanca Hotel for 3 nights before a cruise.The location was perfect for taking the subway for our visit to the Statue of Liberty and 9/11 Memorial.We were able to walk to nice restaurants nearby and also to our Broadway play. The only time we used Lyft was to the Met Museum and to the Manhattan Cruise Port.The staff at the hotel were just as good as others had said in their reviews. They made us feel comfortable and valued.Our only one small quibble was that the bagels at Rick's Cafe were a bit stale. I made the mistake of not having mine toasted the first morning. Otherwise, there were good choices and the items were tasty. I especially appreciated the fresh fruit.One of the mornings we went next door to the Brooklyn Diner. It was just OK for the money. The other 2 mornings we happily enjoyed breakfast in Rick's Cafe.Our room with king bed overlooked the courtyard and was very quiet.We will gladly stay at Casablanca again if we make another trip to New York.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Couldn’t be closer to the heart of Times Square. Rooms are cosy but spotlessly clean and comfortable. Rick’s Lounge is absolutely awesome!!! Great to have a few drinks and snacks at the end of the day before you start your night out!The staff at this hotel are unbelievable!!I can’t speak more highly of the them!!! Boys you are legends!! The guys went above and beyond to make my birthday special and went to a lot of trouble organising Yankees tickets for us. We will be back soon and will be staying again at the Casablanca 100%

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I was in New York for only 2 nights / 3 days and decided to stay at the Casablanca Hotel due to its No 1 Position on Trip Advisor. The hotel is very well situated within close proximity to Times Square and in Midtown. The check-in was very efficient and my room was fairly decent and comfortable. Enjoyed the evening wine and cheese experience.Only concern was the noise from the street in the early hours in the morning but overall an excellent experience and worthy of praise

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The location of the hotel could not be better - it is just steps away fromTimes Square and Broadway. However, when you step inside everything is so tranquil and peaceful. All the staff are very welcoming and go out of their way to make you feel welcome and ensure your stay goes well. We had booked a petite queen and knew it would be small but it was actually plenty big enough- especially bearing in mind the size of hotel rooms generally in NYC. Also, we had come to do things rather than spend a lot of time in our room. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and the 24/7 snacks and drinks were much appreciated. On a Friday night there is live piano music in the bar.I would suggest booking directly with the hotel rather than through a third party.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Hotel is close to all the fun, but quiet and cozy. Clean and every staff member was well trained and pleasant. Can't imagine staying anywhere else in the city. The amenities are a very nice addition to the hotel service.
user_name:
Kathleen P
Cherry Hill, New Jersey

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great location near Time Square. Lots of subtle adds, but the best feature is Rick's lounge on the second floor which brings guests together, providing breakfasts, all day treats and a wine and cheese happy hour. Service is friendly and our room was well appointed. Great value in downtown Manhattan. Will return.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The rooms are wonderful, clean, ornate, and spacious. The hotel as a whole has a spectacular atmosphere and the old world charm and just walking into the casablanca, you feel relaxed and a wonderful escape from the busy New York City. An amazing stay, wonderful staff, in my opinion, the best reasonably priced rooms in all of Midtown. Love love loved it!!
user_name:
lindsaypv12
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Small & very friendly hotel located just off Time Square. A peaceful haven from the hustle & bustle yet close to theatres etc. Excellent service from all staff. Good buffet breakfast & the cheese & wine reception each evening is excellent. Room was cosy. Definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We LOVE LOVE this place. Perfectly located and amazing amenities. Highly recommended for a couples getaway. The library for breakfast and the wine and cheese reception at night are the perfect complement to wonderful weekend in NYC.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We did a girl’s trip to NYC and booked the suite. The hotel is small and older, but so clean and the staff were excellent (Moses, John, Dimitri, Stanley, etc.). There were four of us in a room and it was just fine. The hotel is clean and soooooooo close to Times Square and Broadway. There is breakfast served in the morning and complimentary wine and cheese in the evenings. The staff are exceptionally friendly. Would definitely book again and recommend.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The wife and I brought our grand daughter to NYC for a HS graduation gift. Broadway, The Met, 7 line, her dream vacation.Of course we stayed at Casablanca! Perfect location, great rooms and -in my opinion, what makes this Hotel stand out from others - the people that work there.Everyone was friendly, helpful and seemed to genuinely enjoy working there. The ladies at Rick's Café deserve a mention - always helpful, always smiling.Bottom line - at Casablanca you really do feel like family.Pros - everything, the people are icing on the cakeCons - noneWould I stay there again. Yes, already trying to figure out when we can go back!
