hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My daughter, granddaughter and myself spent 5 days exploring New York. We felt completely safe and found everyone so helpful. We visited all the main attractions and booked in advance from England to save time. Well worth doing. I wouldn’t bother with the hop on hop off bus again as we could walk faster. Traffic awfully busy!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Perfect location if you want to quickly be in the mix of Times Square. Easy walk (3-4 blocks) from Hell’s Kitchen area, Bryant Park, NYPL. Staff at Casablanca very nice & attentive. Rooms are fine, need some updates. Great amenity choices such as sleep phone system. Location & attentive staff clearly are the reason for the high ratings.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We liked how close this is to theatres and the subway. Loved breakfast and wine/snacks happy hour. The rooms were very clean. Ours had no view, but most importantly, it was very quiet. The staff was friendly and very responsive.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Furnishings are very old. Location is excellent and the staff was outstanding. A special shout out for Victor, bell captain and Maria who prepares the breakfast. We enjoyed being able to mingle with the other guests which were from all over the world.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I have been many times to NYC amd have never noticed this hotel before. It will be my go to hotel in the future. It was comfortable, clean, quiet and the service was perfect. The breakfast and happy hour made the weekend complete.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The location is near Time Square, so it was very convenient ... yet is was quiet and peaceful inside the hotel. I like small boutique hotels with lots of character and this hotel has it all. The lobby and eating area were nicely decorated in a classic style. The place was very clean. All (and I mean all) the staff were very nice and helpful. They treated you like a friend that. The continental breakfast was good, I would definitely stay here again,

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Good boutique hotel near Broadway and all the various tourist things in Times Square. Was there with family on spring break - staff was courteous and helpful. Small rooms, no gym, but pretty good value for money in area, especially considering complementary continental breakfast / cocktail hour. Wouldn't necessarily stay there for business given lack of business amenities nor gym, but perfect for our needs.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel provides the best location , service and comfort. From the moment you walk through the front door and are greeted with ‘welcome home’ to having breakfast and enjoying the wine and cheese this hotel is a pleasure to stay in.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Excellent location. Comfortable and friendly hotel. The second floor lounge is very convenient and pleasant. James was especially helpful and sweet! The adjacent restaurant Tony's was also excellent. We wouldn't hesitate to return.
user_name:
robertbF321IQ
St. John's, Newfoundland and Labrador

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I had tried to get a reservation here for other trips but they were always booked. Delighted to get a room for a recent trip with my daughter. The hotel is cozy with themed decor. Steps away from Times Square and the Metro. Front desk staff went out of their way to help us with directions. Lounge staff were very pleasant and active in making sure we had everything we wanted whether having breakfast, afternoon tea or evening wine.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Close to Broadway and Times Square, this hotel is very conveniently located. Offers a different atmosphere than big hotel chains in the area albeit for a price. Staff very nice and courteous. Rooms are small and are generally quiet because they have windows to a small backyard or the house next door. Air conditioning is basic, consists of window unit, we were advised to open the window if we were too hot. May be an issue in hot summers. Breakfast bar could benefit from additional options (salmon, cheese?).

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed here in late January. The location is fantastic, just steps from Time Square and its sSubway Station. Given its location, I thought the hotel would be noisy, I was quite wrong. The rooms are not large by chain hotel standards on interstate but for NYC, adequate. Our bathroom somewhat paradoxical was close to the same size as the sleeping area. The room had a sound machine that helped blot out street noise that I found to be delightful. Two things make the hotel special. The staff is the most welcoming of any of the many much more "famous" NYC hotels in which I have stayed. Doorman are the face of hotels and this hotel's have some of the best. Ask for advice and they give you an enthusiastic response. The second thing is a continental breakfast is included of good quality. There are also snacks available in the evening at Rick's cafe which actually has a more library like atomosphere located on the second floor. By-by Waldorf. This is now our go to in NYC

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel absolutely could not be better! It is a hidden gem, easy to miss, but delightful. The location was very close to Times Square and walking distance to the Broadway theaters. On entering we were greeted like we were dear friends. When we got to our room there was a bottle of wine, two wine glasses and a personal note congratulating us on our anniversary. Every afternoon an elegant service of wine and appetizers are served in their large and lovely host room. Also, their rates are very reasonable. They also arranged for our ride to the airport. We will always have fond memories at Casablanca

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Worth every penny. People at the front desk were wicked friendly and helpful. We loved the 24 hour self serve common area on the second floor. Great place to meet up with family also staying at The Casablanca. It is also where they served breakfast in the morning and wine and cheese in the evening. Just one example of how great the staff was...when we checked out the NYC half marathon had many roads closed including the road the hotel is on. We were unsure how to get to the airport. One of the guys at the front desk grabbed our luggage and took us to the end of the road and put us in a cab to the airport. Our room was a 2 room suite on the street side. Great room but it was very loud with car horns and sirens. Our son had a smaller interior room which they said was very quiet. If city noise will bother you opt for the interior room. Either way the location was literally steps from Times Square. It was awesome to leave a Broadway show and walk back to the hotel. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I would stay here again in a heart beat. My daughter and I came to New York to see some broadway shows and see the sights of New York. The location of this hotel is perfect, just around a corner and you are right there in Times Square. We arrived late in the evening from JFK, we chose to take Lyft from the airport and it was perfect. The driver was so friendly and pointed out many landmarks on the way. We arrived at the hotel around 11 pm and were greeted by a very friendly staff. The Bellman brought us up to our room and gave us a nice introduction to what was available to us and all the amenities to the room. We had a bottle of wine and champagne waiting for us, also two bottles of water and chocolates. The room is small but it had everything that we needed, it was clean and the bathroom was beautiful. The shower had great pressure and they provide robes and slippers. I can’t say enough wonderful things about the staff, the breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese staff were always so accommodating. We ate dinner next door at Tony’s (so awesome as well), we could not eat the whole meal so we saved it and had it the next evening during wine and cheese hour. The gals heated up our dinner for us and served it to us at our table. They also prepare your oatmeal in the morning for you, served with Strawberries and blueberries, they make it so beautiful. You will not regret staying here. Thanks so much Casablanca for a wonderful vacation.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Fantastic location, nice small hotel, friendly staff. The service in Rick's Café in 2.Floor was great, the atmosphere cosy. The room was small, but cosy and comfortable. Would choose the hotel always again!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Rooms are spacious, very clean, and comfortable in an older, very well cared-for building (lots of character). Hotel staff is professional and helpful. Perfect location. Breakfast bar and wine and snack hour in afternoon are convenient, although seating is somewhat limited at prime hours. Very enjoyable stay!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Sorry for a lengthy review, but there is so much to praise here. We used the hotel's outsourced limo service for airport pickup and return. The total cost (including tolls and tips) for both rides was $216. We had used a shuttle service on our previous NYC trips, but a cost comparison showed the shuttle would have cost just under $200, so the difference of less than $20 was well worth the personal and private service. We were delivered to the hotel before 9 a.m. and the staff went out of its way to find us a vacant room so that we could rest after a 10-hour flight. Shortly after entering our room, a maid delivered a welcome back gift of wine -- totally unexpected and appreciated. We noticed the radiator was not working, so I called the front desk and within minutes someone came to adjust it. He told us that if we wanted more heat, they would provide a space heater, which we later requested. Each day, the maid left us two bottles of water, chocolates and a note about tomorrow's weather report. The mattress was very comfortable and we had a choice of pillows. The free breakfast was basic -- breads, cold and hot cereal, pastries, yogurt, juice, coffee, tea, hot chocolate. No waffles or omelets, but we were satisfied with the food and service. This is a small hotel, so the breakfast room was rarely crowded. If the tables were occupied, people were considerate and quickly left after finishing, and the staff quickly cleaned up. The hotel is centrally located within walking distance of Time Square, theaters, shops, eateries, attractions, and a major subway stop. A police station is nearby, and police cars were usually parked within feet of the hotel's entrance, which made the Casablanca one of the safest spots in the neighborhood. Our room was small, but we appreciated the closet had many hangers and a safe. Bathroom towels were clean and in good shape. Water was hot and pressure was excellent. The facility is a quiet oasis in a high energy city, but the best part of the Casablanca is the people. Always friendly, always thoughtful, always looking out for your comfort. We will stay there again on our next visit.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Charming hotel in an excellent location to theaters and Times Square. The staff is warm and very accommodating. They even reached out before my arrival and arranged transportation. The decor is inviting and while the rooms are not large they are well appointed and comfortable.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We love the Casablanca. The staff is always gracious and helpful--never unctuous or overbearing. The lounge is open and offers goodies 24 hours a day, and is a great place to unwind after the theater. The hotel is small and welcoming. For a theater goer, the location is perfect.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Always friendly and helpful staff, great location and a nice breakfast and happy hour in Rick's Cafe. And considering Manhattan prices, the rates are quite reasonable. My favorite hotel when I visit New York City.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We could not have asked for a more caring, attentive staff from the room attendants, desk staff, and cafe workers. The location was great for all the the attractions. We all enjoyed the breakfast and wine happy hours.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: we had a great quick stay at Casablanca. We were celebrating our son's birthday...had arranged upon reserving the room to have cupcakes delivered to our room which was such an awesome touch. The desk staff/bellman were so friendly and welcoming to our boys. Breakfast and happy hour were great. Couldn't believe how quiet the room was for being right in Times Sq. Beds very comfy. We will be returning without hesitation!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Wonderful, safe, quiet, charming hotel in the perfect city location - close to Broadway, Times Square, Bryant Park and everything in-between. Staff was amazingly friendly and accommodating, the continental breakfast and wine and cheese hour can not be beat and we were made to feel safe, cared for and important throughout our stay. I will recommend to all my family and friends!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We have visited Casablanca on several occasions and it is great that factors which drew us back after our first stay are still present: a warm and welcoming staff, great amenities, an impressive breakfast and a complementary wine and hors d’oeuvres session in the evening. Coupled with a terrific location just off Times Square and within easy walking distance to Broadway theaters, the Casablanca is easy choice when we visit New York City. I highly recommend it to anyone!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Being from Texas, I love having the ability to "host" family from Long Island to join me for happy hour before our Broadway shows and afterwards, being able to invite them in for hot tea and cookies before our goodbyes. Thank you Casablanca for making it all possible!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I initially thought the price was more than I expected but now I know why. This hotel is in one of the best locations. Just about 1/4 mile from Time Square. There are a number of great selections of restaurants within a block of hotel as well. Can not say enough about the staff. Someone was always there to greet and hold the door for you. Staff recommendations were always spot on. The rooms were very clean. Great wine and cheese selection each evening and coffee and pastries each morning. Honestly the staff makes this place an exceptional value.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Casablanca was wonderful, again. Warm greeting, easy bag handling, perfect room, steps from Broadway & Times Square and Rick's Café for relaxing and snacks all day. Pricey, but worth it! We hope to be back again and again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: What a lovely little hotel in the middle of Times Square. All the noise and hustle are left at the door when you walk thru the quaint lobby. It’s in a great location - walking distance to many restaurants and Bryant Park.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Very enjoyable place to stay. The outside rooms on the lower floors are a bit noisy as you hear the street noise but would still stay there again. The staff was extremely helpful and personable. The bedding was lovely.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The suite is sweet! 24-hour espresso, or other hot beverages. Friendly, helpful staff made us comfortable and welcome. Don’t miss the wine and cheese by the fireplace at Rick’s. We will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel is a great place to choose when visiting NY. Was our second time here and we were just as impressed as before. I particularly liked the breakfast and the evening cheese and wine. All staff that we encountered were friendly and helpful. Many thanks!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We’ve stayed here before and woukdn’t Hesitate to do it again! Staff is very friendly and the extra perks make it wonderful. The happy hour is great! They offer an awesome breakfast. And, the location can’t be beat.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Staff are outstanding. We traveled with our 10 year old grandson - his second stay at 5he Casablanca. He loves it and staff treats all of us with great respect . We love 5he hotel and it is our go to location

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Where do I begin. We were late arriving from San Antonio, and literally threw our bags at the front desk so we could make the 8:00 curtain. Wonderful reception and staff. Room was cozy and off the front so no street noise. The simple breakfast was satisfying as was the wine and cheese in the afternoon. The housekeeping staff was friendly and sweet. Just east of Broadway it was a 15 minute walk to Saint Patrick’s and Rockefeller Center. Great price, wonderful and attentive service, perfect location and nice rooms. We’ll be back here for sure.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed for one night when our flight home was cancelled. Resort fee covers continental breakfast, all day tea, coffee and pastries and an evening wine and cheese reception which was all really nice. The staff were all very friendly. The room was comfortable and had everything you'd need. Heaters, fans, ear plugs etc are offered if needed. The hotel is on Time Squares door step and a fantastic location for a nights stay right in the heart of everything in NY.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Stayed for two nights on my way to a work conference. Great spot. Perfectly located for theatre and shopping, comfortable room, helpful staff. The breakfast was spot on, the drinks and snacks all day were very welcome as was the welcoming fire in Rick’s Cafe. So lovely to come in late from the theatre and sit by the fire with a cup of tea and a snack. Only criticisms are that the hotel was a little cold (but it was a particularly cold day) and the bathroom a little small. But really these are minor things compared to the excellent overall experience of staying there. Would definitely stay here again, but if with family I would book a much bigger room.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We had an amazing 5 days staying at the Casablanca in New York. The staffs are wonderful, so helpful and friendly. Breakfast in Rick’s cafe is a very welcome addition and very usual for a NYC hotel plus it was delicious. Massive thanks to all the team there for making us feel so welcome and our stay more than comfortable. Thanks

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Having consulted tripadvisor we decided on the Casablanca. Being a 30 second walk from Times Square but having no street noise in the hotel was weird!The staff were outstanding, attentive but not overbearing. We had a slight issue with knocking heating pipes,and the management couldn’t have been more helpful, even getting the system bled.The hotel is full of charm, good sized rooms and really comfortable beds. The breakfast and cheese and wine are excellent, I only expected the bare minimum as it is free, but the choice and quality were fantastic.I always leave a negative so as not to look biased, and on this occasion it was occasional knocking pipes, that is all.Well done and thank you to everyone at the Casablanca,we’ll be back!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great location less than a block away from Times Square. Amazingly close to so many sites & wonderful options for dining. Very friendly staff. Room was very comfortable (except a bit warm -- very effective radiator). Would stay here again next time we're in town.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed here for my husband's 65th birthday. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the hotel was around the corner from Time Square and convenient to everything. The breakfast was just a continental breakfast but well done. Wine and cheese for guests at 5:00 pm!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Had a fab stay at this hotel. Great location close to everything. Staff were brilliant and the girls at the cheese n wine and breakfast were really good. Rooms were great not as small as expected. Hope to return again. Thanks all at Casablanca

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Myself, my husband and daughter have just had an amazing stay here to celebrate my 50th Birthday. The Casablanca is a friendly oasis of calm within busy Times Square. The staff are exceptional and very helpful. The room/suite was lovely and Rick’s bar is such a wonderful bonus with coffee freely available and wine and cheese served each evening was just so relaxing and what was needed after long days on foot visiting attractions. Hospitality at its best!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This was a great hotel experience. My husband and I only spent one night but the staff was very friendly and the rooms were spotlessly. We particularly enjoyed the complimentary snacks offered all day.
user_name:
Gerri V
Valley Stream, New York

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great hotel and perfect location for attending a play on Broadway. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We asked about a place fir dinner between our plays and they gave us two very good suggestions. They even supplied menus for us.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My wife and I stayed there for a 2 night getaway. We really enjoyed the complementary wine and cheese before dinner. Great value, fun atmosphere and friendly and helpful staff. We are looking forward to returning.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Small andcharming hotel only steps from Times Square. Extra friendly staff. Makes you feel at home. Great Bargain. Very Nice complimentary happy hour and breakfast. Only steps from a garage with reduced cost via the hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Very nice boutique hotel at Times Square. Very pleasant staff . Nice room on the small side, but not unexpected for New York. Nice continental breakfast and evening wine reception in a cozy area with fireplace. Convenient to Broadway shows and sites like Bryant Park, New York Public Library, and Rockefeller Center. Quiet atmosphere geared to adults rather than families with small children.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Convenient location, very well maintained with an excellent staff. The wine & cheese/coffee & cookies in the Library make for a relaxed and very sociable experience. We highly recommend it and look forward to our return as well.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We visited the Casablanca for my 40th & had a fantastic stay. The hotel had a pleasant atmosphere and the staff were attentive. The rooms were comfortable and inviting.The breakfast, included in the price, was lovely. The cheese and wine provided in the evening was a lovely touch. Great location too. Would definitely recommend. Thanks Casablanca!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Living in the metro area, we have visited NYC countless times yet we had never heard of this hotel. It is tucked into a beautifully refurbished building on West 47th Street. The entire staff was assuredly the most attentive and friendly we have encountered in the US and reminded us of a European hotel we had visited years ago. The free wine & cheese from 5-8pm in the library area was relaxed and social - we had several great conversations with visitors from Scotland. We highly recommend it or one of its affiliates in NYC!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I checked into the Casablanca quickly and efficiently. I did not see Humphrey Bogart anywhere. Didn't even see a piano. However, the decor was mildly North African. The door man offered to take my carry on which I declined. I stayed on the fourth floor. The room was clean, renovated, fully equipped. No coffee. One must go the the second floor for coffee and snacks...and breakfast. The staff was terrific too...with me as an infrequent guest very satisfied with my stay. I think if someone wants to visit and do the Times Square thing, do Central Park, Broadway...this is the place to check out!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Staff at the reception were very welcoming and gave us some really useful tips for sightseeing, dining, shopping etc. The hotel is in the very heart of New York, so we walked nearly everywhere! Despite the central location our room was very quiet, with none of the hustle and bustle of the city making it through (the room was facing an inner yard, where the fire escape stairs were). We had something like a small walk-in wardrobe, which allowed us to deposit all the suitcases out of sight, keeping the room looking neat and tidy all the time. Rick’s cafe is such a lovely space to relax, and is opened 24h, with complementary tea, coffee, pastries and fruit. Breakfast offered enough options: savoury (bagels of all sorts, cream cheese, boiled eggs), sweet options (pastry, cereals, fruit salad - super fresh and really yummy), yoghurt, coffee, loads of teas, espresso and freshly squeezed orange and grapefruit juice. I would have loved some continental cheese and maybe some ham or other meat options, but the boiled eggs were fresh and perfectly done (not runny, but not super hard either), so I was happy.Oh, and they leave really nice chocolates on your pillow every day :)

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We have stayed repeated times at the Casablanca and have never been disappointed! Excellent staff and service from beginning to end of stay! Hospitality is top notch! Totally enjoy the breakfast and wine in the afternoon! We will definitely be back!
user_name:
J M
Goose Creek, South Carolina

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Lovely boutique hotel just off Times Square. The best part of the hotel is the lounge are, with fireplace, and free coffee, tea, breakfast and wine and appetizers at 5. Perfect spot for a family gathering. We've been meeting for many years for our annual winter family reunion.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Casablanca Hotel was fantastic. We stayed in a "deluxe queen" which was slightly small, but since we weren't spending much time there anyway, it wasn't a big deal. Provided toiletries were great and smelled fabulous (which I had read in advance so it helped make packing my carry-on easier due to fewer liquids). Breakfast was great - loved having the fresh fruit every morning. The second floor area always had snacks. Every employee was kind and helpful. Location was terrific - close to lots of things but not noisy. Overall a fantastic stay!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: For the past 10 years this has been our home away from home whenever we stay in Manhattan. From the moment you arrive you are treated like family. Rick's Café has coffee and sweets waiting for you 24 hours a day. Or you might prefer the complimentary wine and cheese served nightly. Hope to see you there on our next visit.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Fantastic location next to Times Square. Friendly and efficient staff. Great rooms and comfy beds. Rick's Cafe is perfect for anytime drinks and snacks and the cheese and wine is incredible. We wouldn't stay anywhere else in New York!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca Hotel was the perfect hotel for our trip to NYC. The convenience to Times Square, Broadway, excellent restaurants, midtown Manhattan attractions, subway station to more distant attractions, etc., was unbeatable. The service by all of the staff was the best I have ever experienced at any hotel, ever. I would definitely go back.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Came up for the weekend to watch the Maryland game at MSG. The location was fantastic, right in the heart of Times Square. The the customer service provided by all employees was outstanding and the wine and cheese social was an added bonus. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The hotel staff was welcoming and helpful. The location was central to Times Square and the Broadway shows. The decor was very Bogart and Moroccan. It was clean and comfortable plus they had complimentary wine and cheese in the evening and a great breakfast outlay. I couldn't ask for a more pleasant stay.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The location is just off times square, although our room was at the front of the hotel we had no trouble with noise during our 4-night stay. The room is spacious, clean and lovely with a large walk-in closet and bath. A huge draw for us was the complimentary breakfast, everything you would need - oatmeal, fruit, eggs, toasted bagels, cereals. An even bigger braw was the complimentary cheese and wine from 5-8pm nightly, on a Friday evening this is accompanied by a live piano player. Fruit, cakes, tea and coffee is available all day. The staff are so friendly and helpful, we travel often and were truly blown away by this hotel, thank you so much for having us!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: What a gem this hotel is, with friendly staff, a location that can’t be beaten and wonderful amenities that allow you to customize your stay to make it perfect for you! I usually have trouble with hotel beds due to their excessive firmness - but the Hotel Casablanca cleverly resolved this issue for me by offering a deluxe mattress pad as part of their no cost amenities which you can reserve from a menu of options if you book direct. Perfection! They also have a great lounge with complementary snacks and drinks throughout the day and a wine and cheese reception in the evenings. I will definitely be back!
user_name:
Elizabeth C
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This was a nice little hotel, right in Times Square, staff was GREAT, always very helpful. Breakfast was great, nice cheese and wine in the afternoons, always hot coffee and tea! Highly recommend!!!!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Had a wonderful time at the Casablanca. Enjoyed our time seeing the sights then spending time together by the fireplace catching up. The breakfast and happy hour make the hotel a great value and the location can’t be beat!!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca is wonderful hotel with close proximity to the Theater District. Amenities include a continental breakfast and a Happy Hour every day from 5 - 7, of which we always take full advantage. Staff is courteous and helpful at all times.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The rates change daily so check their online calendar for the best time to travel if you have flexibility. The location is a half block off Time Square central. There's an attached restaurant if you don't want to go out. Their breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese happy hour is the best.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel provides you with everything you need to be comfortable when you're away from home. The complimentary wine and cheese, breakfast, snacks are much appreciated. I've stayed at 5 star hotels that don't even provide a complimentary cup of coffee in the morning. I was in one the other day and had to order from room service and it cost $10 with all the fees and tips. Finally, a hotel that is concerned with your comfort and every need and where you don't spend an additional penny while you're staying with them.
user_name:
Jackie T
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We have been staying at the hotel about once a year for the last few years. We enjoy the environment, clean and comfortable, helpful staff. Enjoy the breakfast and the wine and cheese every day. The break room is very comfortable and we often meet other guests and have some interesting conversation. Will definitely return.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is the 3rd year my entire family has booked a long weekend at the Casablanca hotel in Times Square. From the moment you walk through the door, you are treated like family. Our rooms have always been incredibly inviting and immaculate, with such attention to detail. A bottle of wine greets us in the room, and the beds/pillows are incredibly comfortable. If you need total quiet, ask for a room in the back. There is a lounge on the second floor which serves a wonderful breakfast, coffees/teas/pastries/cookies/fruit throughout the day, and at 5pm, wine and cheeses/crackers. Book a stay here, you will not regret it!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A fantastic little hotel in the centre of Times Square! We absolutely loved our stay here. Staff made us feel so welcome and the wine receptions in the evenings made our stay extra special. We would not hesitate at recommending this hotel to others!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We held our third annual family reunion at the Casablanca during a recent weekend. The staff welcomed us back as if we were family. The rooms are very clean, well appointed, and comfortable. The 24 hour lounge is wonderful for breakfast, pre-theater wine and cheese, or a cup of tea before bed. There is no other hotel we will stay at for our yearly reunion. Thank you, staff of Casablanca!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: So homey and welcoming. We loved staying here. The staff makes you feel very taken care of. The breakfast was well done for a simple breakfast. They have a wonderful evening hors douevre and wine spread that makes it feel more like home. Really good.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Terrific hotel and personnel marred by baby crying for 2 nights from 10 pm to 2 amWe did not call down to the concierge since it might have been quite difficult for the hotel personnel to do anything about the child. Next time we will hopefully make certain there is no baby next door.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Had a fabulous stay walking distance to the theatre district. Jack's Cafe provided complimentary breakfast and early evening snacks and beverages. Casablanca Hotel is a rare treasure and a great winter value.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Always our home away from home when in NYC. The staff makes us feel like family. Rick's Cafe is well staffed and roomy and the staff is very attentive. Our room was very nice and we'd stay there again next time we are visiting NYC.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We spent four nights between Christmas and New Years at the end of 2018 and were beyond happy with our choice given how much the Casablanca lived up to all of the gushing reviews on here. Times Square was unbelievably crowded because of the holidays so coming back to the hotel after each day's adventure was such a delight. It was truly like being in the eye of a hurricane. The staff and their attention to service was something that professors teaching hotel management should have their students study. Already planning to come back to NYC next year and will be planning our trip around room availability at Hotel Casablanca.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We felt so at home, comfortable and loved! Not the largest rooms we've ever had and on the street side with construction not the quietest but we still felt staying at the immaculate Casablanca was the highlight of our all too short time in the city. When I stayed at the Elysee a few years back it was the same and we'll continue to check out all the Library properties. Just a few details - we loved hanging out at Ricks Cafe for breakfast and the extensive "Happy Hour".The 24/7 espresso machine! The young men at the desk helping me operate my phone to order food! And so much more. Walk out the door to Times Square or down the block to see a show. All so convenient. Many rooms have a small step up into the bathroom. This is an old refurbished building and not always as accessible at the highest degree. They have suction grab bars they can install in your room or bathroom. I have some mobility and low vision issues but did fine. Not practical for someone in a large power scooter.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I can't say enough about the Casablanca Hotel. Wonderful staff, Victor couldn't do enough for us, great location in midtown New York. Stayed for the weekend, wish we had more time there. They have a complimentary breakfast everyday and a complimentary social hour. They also have a 24 hour refreshment center, coffee, tea water etc. The room was spotless and very comfortable. Will definitely return!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great location, less than a block to Times Square.The room was not huge, but perfectly adequate, with two double beds. It was reasonably quiet despite its location.There was an inviting lounge which had a lovely fire and was a great place to sit.Staff were all very friendly and courteous with none of the arrogance that some higher end New York hotels sometimes show. A bottle of red wine was left with a card to wish us happy anniversary.A full continental Breakfast was included with fruit, yoghurt, boiled eggs, various breads and bagels as well as coffee and tea. Hot drinks and biscuits were available all day in the lounge as well as wine and cheese in the afternoon.We did have to keep our bathroom door shut, otherwise the room was very cold. Although the hotel was not as up to date or luxurious as some of the other hotels in the library collection, it was clean and excellent value given we had a good deal of Expedia.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca is the only hotel in NYC which we will stay. Our last stay was in 2012 whilst attending the Westminster Dog Show. This trip was for the theatre in NYC and London. All the ole familiar faces were gone, but the friendliness was the same. Breakfast is very good and the evening wine and snacks were equally good. The location is excellent for theatre goers! We will definitely stay here again should we return to New York. Larry & Kelly, Georgetown, Texas.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Just returned from a weekend in NYC and my husband and I stayed 2 nights at the Casablanca. Such a nice hotel! It's a small boutique hotel just off of Times Square and a perfect place to get away from the hustle and bustle. The staff is really friendly and helpful, the rooms are lovely and spotlessly clean, they have a great wine and cheese reception every night that is included with your room rate, as is the continental breakfast. They have complimentary pastries/ tea/ coffee, etc out all the time in their relaxing lounge, which also has books, fireplace, a beautiful backgammon set, chess set, etc. We stayed in an interior corridor room (501) and it was so quiet and comfortable. They have a fun extra too- all of the rooms have DVD players and they have a lending library of DVDs to watch, so of course we watched Casablanca. You'd never know you were just steps away from all the lights and noise of Times Square because once you step in to the hotel it is quiet and peaceful. I'd happily book a room there again!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is our third visit to the Casablanca and each time we feel at home. The staff are very efficient, courteous and friendly and always welcoming. The rooms are terrific, stylish, well appointed, great beds and amenities. The great joy though is level 2 where a continental breakfast is awaiting, wine and chees in the afternoon and 24 hour coffee. And, with the most attentive and helpful staff you could wish for. The Casablanca does it with style!This time we stayed for the New Year's Eve package - it was great! If you are ever at a loose end over the New Year period, this is it.Thank you, we'll be back.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Perfect location for exploring the city; very friendly staff who do everything they can to ensure you enjoy your stay; stylish and homely hotel.I really can't find anything negative to say about this hotel. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a great base for exploring the city.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great hotelWonderful staffPerfect location for theaterTony’s is next door Complimentary Continental breakfastComplimentary Wine and cheese hourBut Do not stay in room 309 There is a BBQ place next door (not Tony’s) and our room was very smoky I think the rooms that face the street are ok We had burning eyes in the morningNext time we stay here we will ask for a room not near that restaurant!We loved the hotel

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: If you want to be right in the heart of NY and be treated like you mean something, then Casablanca is the place to stay! The staff from the porters on the front door to the staff in the dining room made sure that nothing was a problem. Our radiator started making noises around 2am and someone was in our room fixing the problem within 5 minutes!We spent 4 nights here and enjoyed our nightly wine & cheese as well as the breakfast which was more than enough to start our day!Would defineatley stay again!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We absolutely loved staying at Casablanca. From the initial email with Brian (about 8 months prior to our trip) to the end...it was phenomenal. The service was absolutely outstanding - the front desk guys as well as the folks in the dining room made our trip to NYC great. I really cannot rave enough about the service here. Also, the location of Casablanca is perfect! This was right in the center on Times Square and really close to Central Park and 5th avenue. The breakfast and wine/cheese nights helped us make some really cool friends - my wife took advantage of it for tips or excursion ideas.The only somewhat downside was that the rooms were a bit older (for those expecting a super modern hotel) but they were super cozy and had a great feel to them so don't let that deter you. Seriously, this is a fantastic hotel. Stay here - we will next time we are back in NYC!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed for 5 nights. Hotel is very clean. Breakfast is included, it is very good and varied with coffee machine offering different types of coffee. Coffee/ biscuits available all day long foc. Staff always friendly and helpful. Location is excellent, right on Times Square and within walking distance of all the top shows and restaurants. Macys is about 10 min walk. Hotel is small with only 6 floors. we received an upgrade foc as it was our anniversary. There was some noise at night as we had a room on the front of the hotel. This is outside the hotels control so I didn’t mention to the front desk. I would definitely stay here again. Hopefully we will return soon.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: #NYE in #NYCHOTEL CASABLANCA New york City... AMAZINGFound by chance by my travel agent as I was looking for a hotel to see the new year in. What a find by Bon voyage travel in Southampton. If you want to stay in the heart of NEW YORK CITY time square then look no further then hotel Casablanca. Just a 30 second walk to time square from the front door.Highly recommend this hotel amazing atmosphere, and fantastic friendly staff. Complementary wine and cheese & nibbles every day between 5 - 8 and complementary tea coffee and pastries 24 hours a day.And if you want to see in the new year in time square you can not pick a more perfect situated hotel then Hotel Casablanca. With special 4 night packages for new years eve, a gala dinner in there on site restaurant Tony's with Broadway entertainment, then up on the roof of the hotel to watch the famous time square ball drop it was AMAZING.. ! One of the best new years eve evenings the wife and I have ever experienced.So if you just want to discover New York City or see in the new year in style I highly recommend Hotel Casablanca .Perfectly situated in the heart of NEW YORK CITY you may arrive a stranger but your definitely leave as a friend and want to come back, as we want to one day. Many thanks to all the very helpful and friendly staff at Hotel Casablanca NYC for one amazing new years eve experience. We loved it.Hotel Casablanca NYC in a class of it's own.Unique, charming and friendly.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Room was ready upon our arrival and the availability of Rick's Cafe at any time of day or evening makes a stay in New York so much better!The staff at Reception and the Cafe were very helpful and the breakfast offered multiple choices for a healthy start to the day.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Awesome location and great hotel! Everyone was really friendly and accommodating. Room was a nice size. Beds were comfortable. Shower was hot. On the second floor was a lounge with a fireplace where complimentary breakfast, afternoon tea/coffee and evening wine and cheese was served.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Casablanca is a charming hotel right in the heart of the theatre district. Tho the rooms are very small and the bathrooms even smaller, the second floor lounge is a delightful place to spend time. The staff are extremely pleasant and helpful.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We loved this hotel! The staff were friendly, the rooms were clean, and we loved Rick’s cafe! We celebrated our 21st anniversary here and it was perfect! We would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to others!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Our third trip to the Casablanca. We like to see a show, have a great dinner, walk the city, and spend the night in a nice room. Casablanca is perfect. Unusual and charming decor, quiet room, great staff.Parking is right next door and the theaters are in walking distance. Don't let Times Square location scare you off, inside it's a secluded place and central to great parts of the city. I would highly recommend a visit.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We went to NYC for the first time this January, We booked the Casablanca based on other reviews and ratings from different websites. The staff is what makes this place great, myself and my wife had lovely conversations with most of the staff, they were always quick to rush to open the door for you, and the second floor little sitting area and snack bar was great too. The rooms were a great size for us as we wanted to spend most of our trip exploring the city and only coming back when we wanted to nap or sleep, The beds are okay, They cleaned the room everyday for us, and all in all it was a great stay and trip. I would gladly do it again in a heart beat. Much love to the staff (Stanley, Chris, John, JD, Jeffery?) and anyone else i forgot, Thanks

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A must stay when in NYC. First rate hotel all the way. Staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The ease of getting to Times Square cannot be beat and plenty of restaurants right within walking distance.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel was one of the nicest hotels I’ve stayed in. when we pulled up there was a person to help us with our bags and the staff were great. Also for being so close to Times Square you wouldn’t be able to tell from how quiet it was. The food was also amazing and always had something out for you to eat at any hour of the day. Would highly recommend to anyone.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We traveled to NYC for New Year's. Casablanca had a great package deal with food, drinks, entertainment, ball drop experience, etc. What made the experience so wonderful was the incredibly friendly, accommodating and fun staff. They answered every question, gave great recommendations and most of all, participated in the New Year's Eve celebration with the guests. The staff was lively and fun, dancing with guests and treating everyone like friends.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is a very unique and stylish hotel. The rooms are a good size--bathrooms are larger and nicer than most. A unique feature to this hotel is the main floor "living room" area--lots of comfy chairs/couches along with food/drink offered at different times during the day. Staff at the desk/door were friendly and respectful.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The abundant breakfast with many choices and the 5-8 PM wine and hors d'oeuvres served in Rick's Cafe was exceptional. The staff attending the food and wine were very friendly and helpful. Likewise the people at the front desk. Casablanca is near to much of that makes NYC a great tourist destination especially during the Christmas season.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Would have liked more breakfast variety, otherwise I loved everything about this place! Staff was so helpful with directions, suggestions, and advice for our trip. I would recommend this hotel, and the location is perfect!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My family & I have stayed at The Casablanca several times in recent years and we’ve never been disappointed. Friendly and professional staff; clean, comfortable rooms; delightful Rick’s Cafe for breakfast and “Happy Hour”. This hotel is perfect for its proximity to fine dining, theaters, museums and outstanding shopping. I am always excited to stay at The Casablanca whenever I’m in NYC - it’s like going home!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This trip to see Times Square and the ball come down has been on my bucket list. My husband would not consider standing all day. We found out about the Casablanca. It was really a night to remember.The staff at the Casablanca can’t do enough for you. If you have not done this put it on your list.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I wanted a place to stay where I could walk out the front door and be in the center of Times Square, Casablanca Hotel was the place.Staff at the Casablanca are awesome. Opened the front door for us with a friendly greeting, front desk offered a friendly greeting.Bottle of wine greeted us upon entering the room, very nice.We arrived in the afternoon just in time for a snack at Rick's Cafe. Very nice, since there was a 2 hour wait for dinner at Tony's Nappolini.We had the King suite and the decor in the room was very nice.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We loved our stay at Casablanca. It's quite, it's quaint and the service and staff are excellent. Ask for an interior room and you'll swear you aren't staying in the heart of NYC! Your stay includes a great breakfast spread at Rick's Cafe and a complimentary evening wine and cheese offering. We sat near the fireplace in Rick's with our friends for a couple of hours between a matinee and dinner, enjoying the quiet conversation, the wine, cheese and cookies and the Christmas decor. It was truly a magical time, and everyone was commenting on how at home they felt at Casablanca - so very different than the large hotels we had stayed at on previous trips. One of our friends is already planning a trip back to NYC and a stay at Casablanca with her friends next month. The hotel rooms are neither large nor new, but they are clean and equipped with everything you need to make your stay comfortable. You'll quickly decide you don't care if it's not the most modern hotel in town, because you'll appreciate so many things about Casablanca - the respite from the busy life outside the front door; the perfect location; being able to sit at the bar or have a meal at Tony's, a great Italian restaurant that's accessible through the lobby; the friendly, competent staff. For us, Casablanca is perfection. This will always be our home away from home anytime we come to NYC.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Lovely Hotel with great staff. The room was perfect for our needs and the location..well as other reviewers have said if you want to be central this is central! Thanks James, Vincent and all the other staff for making us feel so welcome. The ambiance and greeting we got every time we stepped into the foyer was like visiting with old friends. Plans are already taking place to return hopefully Summer of 2020 to see a different side of New York.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Casablanca Hotel. Lovely staff. Comfortable bed.Times Square a minute's walk away. Couldn't fault it. Nice and comfortable lounge/breakfast area, with free wine and cheese and biscuits in the evening. Breakfast, with eggs, cereal, fruit juice, jams, bread , toast etc. All very nicely presented.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My friend and I take our granddaughters to NYC the day after Thanksgiving for the weekend! The location is perfect, walking distance to theaters, staff is simply warm and welcoming and we all love the privacy of the suite! Wonderful amenities from breakfast to happy hour with delicious selections! Thank you for making our stay so special, we are already booked for next Thanksgiving!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: top top top level service! From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we were greeted, welcomed back, wished a lovely evening and asked if there was anything we needed. The gentleman who checked us in even remembered some of our plans for our visit and asked how it was going. That is impeccable service! Although this is close to time square I never felt like it was loud or bright. I feel it took us just as long to get to the heart of time square as it did to get to Bryant Park (our go to subway stop). We stayed in a petite room and petite it is! We managed during our stay but if you like more room than just space for a bed be sure to chose a different room. It would have been better for us to have a smaller table and chairs in the room. The complimentary water, breakfast and snacks 24/7 not only saved us funds but was great for a couple nights we skipped dinner and just needed a nibble before we went to bed. We would stay here again and makes we want to visit other library company hotels.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great service and for being so close to time square you could hardly hear a thing. Great 24 hour tea and coffee and amazing staff. Would highly recommend. Only downs were the elevators were kinda scary but for such a beautiful building I could deal with it. If I go back to NY at least I know where I'm staying. It is also located at such a great spot to do so much stuff and have so much fun

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The first words they told us upon checking in was “welcome home” and it indeed felt like home for the whole duration of our stay. The staff were some of the warmest, most accomodating, and friendliest staff I’ve encountered. Spending new year’s here was icing on the top of the cake. From the delicious 5 course dinner & fun entertainment, to being able to walk in the restricted access area near the ball drop, to the champagne toast on the rooftop to view the balldrop— it definitely made for an unforgettable NYE celebration. Highly recommended!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Would highly recommend this hotel and we are already planning our next stay! Staff was so helpful and friendly; rooms were comfortable; breakfast and wine/cheese reception was perfect! We were a large group and we felt at home hanging out in the lounge area (Rick's cafe); location is right in Times Square! I've stayed at other hotels in Times Square and could not sleep due to the street noise, we heard nothing from our room at the Casablanca. I accidentally left my work cell phone in the safe and I got a call immediately once the room was cleaned, they mailed my phone back right away. How is that for service! :)

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Amazing hotel , would return absolutely and cannot recommend highly enough . NOt a hotel for those who like the 'big' corporate hotels but those who enjoy a quality comfortable , friendly place to stay. So convenient to Times Square and would recommend highly for NYE- Great view of the ball drop.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Best location in Times Square area. No crowds, noise or chaos, but all of that is just steps away. Staff is friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Rooms are European in character. Rick's cafe offers good continental breakfast and happy hour from 5 - 8 PM.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Where else in NYC can you walk in the door and be greeted like a best friend? We make it a point to always stay at the Casablanca when we are in the City. Every member of the staff treats us like we are the only guests. This last visit January 3rd, we were headed off to see My Fair Lady at Lincoln Center. To make certain we got a taxi, the young man at the front desk walked us down to 6th Ave and stood with us until he was able to hail a taxi. This is just one example of how they go the extra mile for their guests! The free wine and cheese every evening is an added plus along with the piano player in Rick’s Cafe. It truly is a great pleasure to know that every member of their staff seems genuinely focused on providing a friendly atmosphere for their guests!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We loved this hotel. The staff make this hotel great, are always friendly and willing to help in anyway. We stayed the middle of December to experience Christmas in NYC. The hotel is situated perfectly between Macy's, Times Square, 5th Ave, and Rockefeller Center. We were close enough that if needed we could come back to the room and drop off shopping bags, bathroom break, or enjoy the wine and cheese hour. The staff will even get you a cab if you need it for the things you can't walk to. We booked the car service through them to pick us up at the airport and take us back when leaving. We also checked out 2 of their movies they have on file during one night when we came back early due to rain. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are planning a trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We celebrated new yers eve and some days around in the Hotel. The Hotel is located directly next to Times Square, the most vibrant (and one of the loudest) spots in NYC. But to our surprise this central location ist only an advantage while all the hussle stays outside when you enter the house. Great atmosphere, extremely friendly staff, nice style (like in Marokko). Quite spacious room for an city Hotel. We defintely enjoyed the NYE celebration and the ball-drop view from the roof terrace. And we once more enjoyed the extremely caring and friendly staff, who also are great in making party!Breakfast is described as beeing continental but is by far better than anything you might have seen before under the term "continental". Fresh, tasty, nice!All in all: a great experience that will surely not be our last time in this hotelOh, did we already mention the friendly and caring staff?

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The staff at this hotel was fantastic. Breakfast, wine and cheese and snacks are provided in Rick's Cafe free of charge. Our large group gathered there in the evening and the staff was very welcoming. The room was clean and had all the amenities. We will be back.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great staff!! Friendly, accommodating, and always available for help. A reunion of 11 cousins, and this was a great location for us to hang out in the cafe. Plenty of room. Rooms were clean, coffee served 24/7, and the complementary breakfast was good. Would definitely return.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I love staying in hotels. I love to see how they differ in ambience, style and service. I also like to see the little extras they offer their guests. Some hotels only excel in their service, others only in food or in their quality of room features and little toiletries but the Casblanca Hotel excels in all categories and exceeds your expectations.On a first appearance the hotel is pleasant and you dont expect much more than average hotel service. I was very impressed from the moment I stepped inside. I was greeted immediately by all staff members and by the time I had checked in the concierge had already tagged our luggage with our room number. I loved being greeted by my name as I passed front desk on my way in and out by every staff member. I especially loved that I could ask any staff member a question and they either had the answer or always assisted me in finding an answer but never left me to figure it out on my own or just passed me on to someone else. The hotel has little extra's that give it the "WOW" factor. During our stay every morning was a complimentary continental breakfast with a wonderful variety for every guest. The afternoon was filled with a complimentary wine and cheese spread and every evening we had chocolates on our table and the weather report for the next day left in our room. On New Years Eve we had champagne and gifts left for us. It is rare these days to experience good customer service with a smile let alone excellent customer service with the extra mile. So to experience such a high level of service was surprising and very impressive. We stayed here because Casablanca was listed as one of the top hotels with the best view of the ball drop in Times Square. The New Years Eve celebrations did not disappoint either. All guests have an uninterrupted view on the rooftop. The highlight of the evening was watching the hotel staff join in the celebrations with us. They make you feel like family. In fact, as we checked out the hotel manager came to say goodbye and gave us a hug.The Casablanca is efficiently run and very well coordinated. The location is excellent, the food is excellent, the service is excellent, the staff are always happy and work very well together as a team which creates the perfect atmosphere. You really cannot complain about the Casablanca and even if you are a very fussy person they are willing to make you feel as comfortable as they possibly can, all you have to do is ask. I highly, highly recommend the Casablanca Hotel especially for New Years Eve. When I come back to New York I will always stay with the Casablanca. Do yourself a favour and treat yourself to excellent quality. ❤❤❤ ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The free drinks at happy hour (s) was just icing on an exceptional cake.We were happy to walk to many locations, and this hotel was very central.The staff were happy to store baggage until we were ready to leave. The continental breakfast was more than we expected, with fruit and eggs available.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Another great visit to the Casablanca Hotel. Was given a room up front that was great but a little noisy for ourselves. (No fault of hotel as refurbishment of adjacent building is being carried out at night). Requested a move in the Morning with no issues. Left our luggage packed and when we returned that day all in new room. Great service for that issue. Breakfast is great. Juices, bagels, bread, fruit etc. Plenty of coffee. Cereals as well. Happy to toast your bagels or bread if required. Hotel is well placed in New York with a great subway around the corner and loads within walking distance. Staff always helpful and happy. Highly recommended

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: It felt as though we took a step back in time staying at this understated luxury hotel in the middle of Times Square. While the hotel is about 50 yards from Times Square, we were fortunate to have an interior room, providing a very comfortable and quiet room (as well as quite large for a NYC hotel room). Accommodations were excellent, front desk and housekeeping were outstanding and because of the hotel's central location, we were able to come back during the day while sightseeing for a complimentary snack/beverage by the fireplace in Rick's Cafe. Easy access to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Bryant Park. A must stay during the holiday season in NYC.If I had to have one con, the room was rather warm, however it was mid-50's when we were visiting in December.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This was our third stay at The Casablanca Hotel, this time for a trip to see a friend perform in the Rockettes Christmas Show. We always enjoy the friendly welcome and appreciate the hotel's proximity to sites we enjoy visiting. The breakfast and afternoon treats are wonderful!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Super friendly staff. Very professional and responsive. This goes for every department we interacted with. Front desk, door staff, food and beverage, and the nice lady who came by with chocolates and water.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Perfect location - steps from Times Square. Excellent customer service, great amenities, wonder ambiance, and did I mention location! Our 2nd time staying here and won't be our last! From the wonder free breakfast, to the free wine/cheese happy hour, to the all day free coffee/pastries/cookies - everything was great! Don't expect a large room, but we didn't need one as we don't spend much time in it. Overall - Excellent place and HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Second trip & added a generation to share in the fun!! Casablanca plays a huge role in the great memories! They are like family & make their guests feel the same! Highly recommend for the beauty, quaintness, service, value, & location!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca is a hundred steps or so off to Times Square. The hotel is older but comfortable and the location is convenient to many of the top attractions of NYC. What makes the Casablanca special is its extraordinary service and hospitality. The staff goes out of its way to cater to your every need and by the time you depart they feel almost like family. While the rooms are on the small side the 24/7 hospitality room on the second floor is not only a wonderful place to hang out for a bit for snacks, coffee, tea, etc - but the wine and cheese events every early evening are a perfect time to meet and make new friends from around the world. Special thanks to Victor for not only being a great guy - but a wonderful source for tips on getting around the city. NYC can't be beat for the holiday experience and you can add the Casablanca to that list.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My family and I come to NYC for our annual Christmas tradition. What makes this trip special every year is our stay at the Casablanca Hotel! The management and staff are second to none. Please consider this hotel when in NYC!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel is deceptively tranquil considering it is only a few steps off Times Square. Very little noise intrusion. Breakfast and evening drinks/nibbles all included in our rate. Tony's next door was a real find.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My sisters and our daughters spent s wonderful weekend at the Casablanca. We came to do all the "Chistmas in NYC" activities. The staff at the Casablanca couldn't have been more helpful and accomodating! They were so friendly and always called us by our names when we entered. I recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay there anytime I return to the city!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel is beautiful and steps from Time Square. We could easily walk to the Christmas attractions and shows. Everyone who works at Casablanca was extremely friendly and helpful. The Lounge area feels like home and always has drinks and food available.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel provides a great oasis steps from Times Square. Staff is fantastic, rooms are always clean and comfortable with nice boutique style. VERY nice continental breakfast in Rick's Cafe with a great attentive staff. Here's the "but", keeping in mind that this hotel is right on Times Square, street noise in the rooms can be a problem. IMHO Casablanca Hotel really needs an upgrade on their windows in guests rooms. Ear plugs do mitigate the noise.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great location, friendly staff, room very clean, especially enjoyed the complimentary evening wine and cheese and the continental breakfast. Only complaint was that the room was too warm. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We had a fantastic stay at Casablanca. We couldn’t fault anything. We had amazingly friendly service, great rooms, comfortable beds and super location. We loved the complimentary wine and nibbles each night. It was a lovely touch. Would love to go back and would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The location is ideally located near Times Square. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. The daily evening wine and cheese gathering was a great way to meet other people and share experiences.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We loved this place. Staff was very friendly and caring. Right around the corner from all the action of Time Square. We were on the 5th floor and never heard any noises from outside. Loved the free wine and cheese at 5pm and hot chocolate anytime.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We have stayed at the Casablanca four times now and each experience has been wonderful, like returning home. Staff are friendly, helpful and customer service is top notch. We particularly love the breakfast bar and cocktail hour in the comfortable Ric's Cafe. We plan to return again and again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: From checking in to booking out staff could not have been more helpful or friendly. Rooms were clean and well presented. The complimentary breakfast and 24hr snacks were an added bonus. Would not hesitate to go back and stay again

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The hotel staff were great when we needed them, location was the best thing about this hotel and of course the free wine and cheese between 5-8 everyday, we had a great time and would defiantly return to this hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: On a 4 day trip to the city for the holidays we stayed at this boutique hotel 1/2 block from Times square. Most every thing was within a 10-15 min walk. This is a great location for broadway shows (we saw 2). Easy walk to Rockefeller Center to see the tree as well. Complementary happy hour in Ricks Cafe was a real bonus for meal planning around shows & other activities. The staff was exceptionally friendly & helpful. The other big plus was room service from Tony's restaurant. We tried to get a table upon arrival @6pm on a Tuesday ( the boss was starved) but no openings until after 9pm. No problem . We had wine & snacks at Ricks then ordered room service from Tony's which was delivered in less than 30 minutes. Our room appeared to be renovated recently & was very quiet as requested. 5 star service in a small boutique hotel. We will stay again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Booked this hotel due to its location to time square.A fantastic hotel , not your usual time square hotel as it has family atmosphere, staff fantastic ,helpful in every way Rooms small but Enough for a couple, cleaned and tidied every day. Free cheese and biscuits and wine early evening, which was great after a days site seeing Continental breakfast ample to get you going in the mornings too.Perfect location for all site Will deffinatly stay here again

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We revisited this hotel for 2nd time for thanksgiving , from England.the hotel is in a marvellous position and is so close to many major attractions and just of Times Square , very friendly staff great wine and cheese complimentary every day , great continental breakfast. We just have a few moans and groans, the room was very cold and had a real draft from window and we had to block it with bath robe , and we did feel the room was slightly tired. We did enjoy our 2ND visit But we did think the hotel had small issues as I went to bed really cold for my 4 night stay

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We haven't stayed here in more than 4 years, yet we were recognized by the staff who were present then--even our preferences. They are an amazing group of people.The service is impeccable and is the reason why we choose the Casablanca when we can. It almost feels decadent to be treated so well.The European continental breakfast and the evening hors d'oeuvres with wine are quite satisfying. The atmosphere is calming, especially on Friday nights when the pianist performs.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Located steps from Times Square, this property is an island of civility and calm amid the chaos of Times Square. The staff is excellent. There is a comfortable "Rick's Cage" on the second floor for included breakfast and complimentary wine and cheese in the afternoon. The rooms are clean and well appointed but are not glitzy. Fine amenities in the bathroom. This is the place to go for the ambience and to unwind after hectic New York minutes.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed here for a third time and every time we are overwhelmed by the service and quality of the Casablanca. It is in a perfect location just a few hundred yards from Times Square, breakfast is top class and plentiful and the Cheese and Wine in the evening is just the tonic to set you up for an evening in the big city! Look forward to returning soon

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We visited this Hotel where our friends were staying as part of a trip to New York City.As a party of six we were unable to stay in the same hotel but visited Casablanca as guests.The location was ideal and in the heart of NYC. From the outside the hotel was covered in scaffolding then once you entered we received a warm welcome by all staff wherever we went. The staff were excellent and even as guests anything that we enquired about was resolved, overcome and they were ready to satisfy any issue, be it a general question through to booking some of the best places.We will definitely endeavour to stay at this hotel on our next visit as there was nothing negative throughout this Hotel..

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay here which in part was due to the staff, all were friendly and helpful, the people on the front desk were excellent.Our room on the fourth floor was a reasonable size but faced the busy street so was noisy late into the night. The bed and pillows were very comfortable so we slept reasonably well despite the buzz from below.Breakfast was basic but nicely presented with a reasonable selection. The late afternoon free cheese and wine looked great but we did not get chance to enjoy it due to our busy schedule.The location of this hotel is perfect, Times Square is a few paces away, Central Park is walkable and so is theatreland.We thoroughly recommend this hotel, yes our room was noisy but that is to be expected given the location. We will definitely book again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Casablanca was recommended to us by a couple we met while touring in Northern Queensland. They particularly liked the lounge area with 24/7 refreshments and the evening drinks. We checked it out on the web and sounded perfect. I was celebrating my birthday. We were greeted warmly and waiting in our room was a welcome Birthday bottle of wine.
