The staff were always very helpful. We enjoyed the evening drinks and we were able to welcome our daughter to join us. "Your guest is our guest". Breakfast was varied and filling. Highly recommended - we will go back when next in YNC.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Stayed 4 nights in December for sightseeing/shopping trip in NY. No negatives to say about this place, great rooms, great staff, free breakfast and free wine and cheese/fruit 5 till 8 every day, plus free tea/coffee, buiscits and cakes 24 hours a day. A real home from home 5 * definitely recommended! :) Right next to Time Square, everything is walkable, shops, theatres, major sights etc.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I can see why this hotel maintains the #1 rating on here. The location is PERFECT. I've stayed in other Times Square hotels but this one just felt like it was in the middle of everything. The service is outstanding. The staff is friendly, and the wine and cheese reception is a nice touch. Not to mention the complementary breakfast every morning. Rooms are small, as are the bathrooms, but that's really about the only negative. They're clean and comfortable which is the important thing. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay around Times Square.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: What a fantastic place to stay the staff are fantastic and so helpful that’s every one of them. The breakfast is great the ladies in Ricks Cafe are so helpful doing your toast or porridge. The Gentleman on the reception are so helpful on our last day there was no room at the Ricks Cafe for cheesecake and wine Joseph from the front desk went and got us 2 chairs and a table. The cheese and wine evenings are fantastic you meet some lovely people. We would never stay any where else it is central to everything.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Thank you all for making our stay and first visit to the USA so memorable , easy and so comfortable.Everyone so helpful and friendly , nothing to much trouble. And looking after a very travel sick wife when we arrived . Simple things like coming out in the pouring rain when we first arrived and saying "welcome home" .THANK YOU ( a big thank you!) Hope to see you again one day , will & Sarah cleaver

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Had a five night stay last week at the Casablanca and the one thing that makes this place perfect is the location especially for us first timers to New York.All the main sights are within a walk or short metro ride away which is ideal when you have to cram in shopping and sightseeing.The hotel is great and apart from our temperamental heating in our room everything other reviewers had said when I booked this hotel was spot on.Our room was on the top floor near the back so there was no view to speak of but the room was quiet at night which we needed after each hectic day especially as we were next to the elevator .The staff were great and we even had some wine and a fridge in our room when we arrived.If we do return to New York then we will be staying here again hopefully.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We booked this hotel based on the reviews and it was an excellent choice! Lovely rooms that were clean, well decorated and very comfy. The staff was extremely helpful with everything from dining options to directions and it was always nice being able to grab a midnight cup of tea. Just a short walk from Times Square, you are located in the heart of it all. Best hotel we’ve ever stayed it!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I just spent one night at the hotel after many hours of travel from Iceland to US. It has been years since I stayed here. I won’t go back. I reserved a room and asked for a quiet location. Hotel could have acknowledged my request and told me in advance that the “type of room” I reserved faces a very noisy street. This I told the manager. Instead I heard ,over and over, this is NYC but that the room was on fifth floor with a husher. Manager took me to the room. He showed me the layers of windows and, as it happened at check in, all was quiet. But at 4 am, the garbage trucks started their routine and two hours later various trucks were still at it. I gave up on anymore sleep. For the “sleep through anything” person, the room would be fine. For the average person, no way. It is not acceptable to tell the guest that “Hey this is NYC.” I will not tolerate that attitude. I typically stay at The Library where I am guaranteed quiet. And that is the Hotel in this group that I will return to.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Casablanca is in a league of its own. This hotel is perfectly situated for those who want to attend the theatre. If you love the hustle and bustle of Time Square, this is for you, if you don't, please don't let that deter you because the Casablanca and staff makes it all disappear! The management team is exceptional and this high quality service is present in every person who works at the hotel. John, Thank you for helping our family to make amazing memories. Aseem, you were so kind and attentive...thank you! To all the staff (everyone), we appreciate how you go above and beyond! John, you are an example of not only an amazing hotel manager, but just a good person!!! I think your authentic commitment to providing outstanding service to each guest is evident in all the staff. Thank you Casablanca for another amazing NYC stay....we will be back soon!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My teenage daughter and I travelled to New York from Australia in November 2018 as a post High School Graduation trip. Our first time at the Casablanca - but have stayed at other NYC Library Collection Hotels on previous trips. We loved the Casablanca - particularly the daily complimentary breakfast and Wine and Cheese Reception! The Hotel was also very social - with guests genuinely enjoying interacting with each other and sharing holiday experiences and stories from home. The Hotel's location is unbeatable - so close to Times Square - yet exceptionally quiet and private. We will definitely stay again - with so many wonderful Shows to see in New York - all an easy walk from the Casablanca!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We come, with friends, every year the same weekend in November. It is so nice to see the same people - staff and guests. Casablanca is an absolute gem in the city!We always book our next trip when we are checking out.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Very nice hotel, conveniently located. Service was great and employees were friendly. We enjoyed the continental breakfast and the happy hour. The rooms were clean and the maids quite attentive. Very enjoyable stay.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is the only place I stay when visiting NYC. Excellent Times Square location but a boutique hotel so you won’t get lost in the mass of guests. All personnel are courteous and attentive. Excellent wine & cheese offering each night and breakfast each morning included in charge. Room was good size and clean with all amenities you need. Always a great experience staying at the Casablanca.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We absolutely love this hotel, perfect location right by Times Square, Tony’s restaurant that we visited is next door. All staff are so friendly and polite. Breakfast is a lovely set up, also from 5pm cheese, wine and nibbles are served in the lounge for all guests. The lounge is a cosy atmosphere which is nice to relax for an hour or so after a long day of site seeing. Would definitely recommend, when we visit NY again this is where we will be staying. Mr and Mrs Chamberlain

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: What a fabulous hotel. Tbe first rhing tbat strikes you is how friendly the staff are. They will do anything for you and are genuinely friendly ans helpful. Last time we stayed in New York we stayed at the Roosevelt and the staff there were rude. Have also stayed at the Waldorf and Edison where it was so impersonal. We will always stay here in future.The hotel is small with bundles of character. The rooms are very confortable. But what makes it really special is they serve free tea and coffee and pastries all day in the lounge area. At 5-8pm they serve free wine and cheese and prosecco. This makes everyone gather in the lounge area and people chat to other hotel guests which creates such a friendly atmosphere.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Few hotels I have stayed at can compete with the quality of staff at The Casablanca. Everyone, no matter what their job, had a great personality. All were amazingly helpful, friendly and totally professional - and the reception team helped to save my life.When I was taken ill on day one of our five day holiday, their insistence on calling for an ambulance, rather than our intention of getting a cab to the hospital, gained me the valuable few minutes which mattered when my condition suddenly worsened and became life threatening.I was admitted for surgery and a two week stay in hospital. During that time, the hotel management and staff moved heaven and earth to extend our booking so my wife didn’t have the additional worry of where to stay.They were there to support her, lift her spirit and became her friend - doing everything they could to ease the burden, provide the help, and all while showing genuine concern for both her and my welfare. The hotel is a fascinating building and has protected status, so retains many original features from when it was the Hotel Metropole - notorious for its links to ‘The Mob’ and site of an infamous murder! Nothing so dangerous these days as you sit in the Library eating a good choice of breakfast treats - pastries, coffee and biscuits throughout the day - or, in the evening, cheese, biscuits, wine and nibbles perhaps as a pre-theatre treat. All are included in the cost of the stay.Everywhere is clean and the bedrooms are comfortable, with all the facilities expected, including choice of pillows and mattress topper as just two of the extras to make your stay perfect.Located just 1 minute from Times Square, it is surprisingly quiet, yet is the perfect base for all of Manhatten’s tourist sites. There are several restaurants close by - Brooklyn Diner has great burgers, John’s Pizzaria (in a converted church) is interesting and the food good, and the burger and lobster restaurant across from the hotel serves great lobster salads and lobster ‘burgers’.The stars of the show are not on Broadway, however, but are the staff of The Casablanca - each and every one - and I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Words cannot express our gratitude for what they did in the month we were there, and we will always be in their debt.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Our room was spotlessly clean, with daily complimentary water. The bathroom was very nice with toiletries which included bathrobes and slippers. The location was just 20 metres from Times Square! Service was excellent with all staff very welcoming and friendly and always smiling. There was complimentary continental breakfast (staff prepared our oats in the kitchen to suit our needs) and at 5pm every day, complimentary wine and cheese - this was fantastic as after a hard days sightseeing, it was terrific to come back to the hotel and just relax for a couple of hours before heading out again! They also have free wifi. We highly recommend this hotel & would certainly return.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We spent four nights here on a wedding anniversary trip to NYC. We really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were bigger than I expected for a boutique hotel. It's a very old building but has been upgraded to provide modern conveniences. Such a great location. We walked to just about everywhere we went.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: we like firm mattresses, so the pillow top was not our favorite. And we would love to have a firm pillow or two. The staff, the hospitality, and the location cannot be beat. We enjoyed all of it, and the neighboring theatres, restaurants, and sights was really nice.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great central location, in the middle of everything but feels like a hide away when you step inside. Very friendly and helpful staff. Lovely beds. Very nice lounge area where breakfast is served in the morning and wine and cheese in the evening.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Fantastic hotel with excellent staff who were very attentive and helpful. Great 24hr refreshments available. Great location with Times Sq literally around the corner. Great restaurant next door too. Will certainly stay here again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Beautifully decorated boutique hotel where the staff outdid themselves in providing for our every comfort and interest. Great amenities and done to perfection! Highly, highly recommend. Hope to be able to visit again sometime.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: From the moment you step through the door you are greeted by warm and friendly staff who treat you like one of the family no matter what the request they will do there upmost to fulfill it for you! The hotel is in the perfect location for your stay in NYC in the heart of Time square but in a quiet street just off so you dont get the noise! A Underground station nearby dont be afraid to use them! The breakfast is great and a lovely assortment. The Girls working there are chirpy and remember your orders before you ask amazing! The cheese and wine was great in the afternoon although we were usually out and about! There was hot drinks and pastries available throughout the day for your convenience. The Rooms where spacious and cleaned to a high standard with a lovely turn down service with delicious chocolates! Would go back in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: What a gem! From the moment you arrive, it felt like home. We arrived early in the morning and they kindly took care of our luggage so we could explore the city. We had booked two Premium King rooms for our group. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. We loved the personal touches waiting in our room from the management team. In fact, all the staff go out of their way to accommodate you. The cheese & wine evenings are a real treat. It was so nice sitting by the fire drinking wine & playing cards. A good way of escaping from the bitter cold weather outside! Breakfast was delicious! A good variety of options. We never left hungry! I would heartily recommend this hotel to everyone. My only regret is that we didn’t stay longer.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Have stayed at The Library Hotel, Elysee, and Casablanca and liked them all. Only the Giraffe to go.Good bed, immaculate room, great wifi, and excellent breakfast plus wine and cheese hour--plus coffee and snacks all day.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My husband and I recently spent five nights at the Casablanca hotel. I almost cancelled the reservation to book a room at a less expensive hotel with larger rooms, but in the end decided not to. That turned out to be a very good decision. Our King bedroom was perfect - ample space, nicely decorated, nice bathroom, clean, great pillows and best of all, dead quiet. We really couldn't have asked for anything better. I also liked that you were able to open the windows for a little cool air when it got too warm. In addition to our lovely room, Rick's Cafe, where a continental breakfast was available each morning, a wine and cheese reception each evening, and coffee, tea, and snacks were available 24/7, really made the hotel feel more like a home. The front desk staff were always professional, helpful and friendly, housekeeping was also pleasant and did a great job keeping our room clean, and the ladies at breakfast were pleasant and welcoming. My only complaint is one young lady working at the evening reception who seemed annoyed and cold, but she was the one exception to an otherwise very attentive and personable staff, and we didn't let her stop us from enjoying ourselves. I would recommend the Casablanca hotel 100%, and already have to my friends and family. A hotel can make or break a vacation, and the Casablanca definitely added to our wonderful five days in New York City.
user_name:
Lisa A
Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Hotel, staff and midtown location are all plusses. Unfortunately, the all night continuous loud noises from the recycling center across the street, prevented us from getting more than an hours sleep. I am astonished that a hotel of this caliber has not invested in double or triple paned windows to keep the noise out. For $475 a night I expected better.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Having visited NYC many times, I thought I had found my favorite go-to hotel. That was before staying at The Casablanca. I just celebrated turning 65 with my three college roommates by visiting NYC and staying at the Casablanca. We were warmly welcomed and upgraded to a suite. The staff at the desk was glad to make recommendations and provide any help we needed. It was hard to believe that we were only steps from Times Square while enjoying this cozy haven of a hotel. We took full advantage of the second floor lounge area for the delicious breakfast buffet and evening wine and cheese reception each day. I have found my new go-to NYC hotel!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: There are an abundance of superlatives to mention. The rooms are nicely appointed; our shower seemed brand new. The chocolates at turn down with summary of the next day's weather. The wine and cheese tasting at night was generous; the breakfast was wonderful. The rooms where clients dined was spacious and open 24/7 to allow for late night reading or mid-day relaxing. The staff recommendation for airport transportation proved to be a life-saver. Comfort; great location; friendly and accommodating staff. What's not to like?

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel was recommended to us - and we are delighted to recommend it to others. In the midst of the hustle and bustle of NYC...this really was our home from home. The hotel was a real find in terms of location and service. The residents loung with on tap coffee and cakes was ideal...as was the cheese and wine! Great after a day sightseeing!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: this was our 5th time staying there. the location is perfect and it is amazingly quiet...but best is the staff who somehow remember us! the breakfast is very generous, cappachino machine and pastries always available in the beautiful “libraryroom”

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Our first tiime staying here and we’ll definitely return. The staff is wonderful and the rooms are clean and efficient. Loved the 24/7 lounge, Rick’s Cafe where continental breakfast is served daily and wine and cheese from 5-8pm with a pianist on Friday evenings. Next to Tony Di Napoli and Brooklyn Diner and across from Europa Cafe, as well as many theatres. Can’t ask for more! Loved it here!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Just returned from a 5 night stay. There is a reason for this hotel being voted no 1 in New York and no 11 in the whole of the USA - it is totally deserved.The staff are so friendly and nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are lovely and beds very comfortable. The extra touches like bottled water in the room, wine for my husbands birthday, chocolates on the pillow along with a weather forecast are very welcome. The cheese and wine in the evening was always very popular we tried to get a seat 3 evenings but was unable to but it looked lovely.Hotel is in fantastic location with everything on your doorstep.I can't praise this hotel enough would certainly stay again and I would recommend it to anyone that is visiting.Well done Casablanca Hotel you are doing a great job.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My wife and myself once again stayed at the Casablanca Hotel from 21st Oct until 26th Oct 2018. To say this Hotel is a treat is an understatement. The Hotel is perfectly situated just off Times Square. We once again had Room 508, which is at the back of the Hotel, you would never know you were in the Middle of New York as it is so quiet. The Breakfast was again excellent with Fruit, Cereal, Toast and Bagels etc and sets you up for the day ahead. The girls serving couldn't do enough for you and always with a smile. At 5.00pm they have Wine with Biscuits and Cheese etc, again there is plenty for all . I had a problem with my flights on the Friday as my Airline cancelled my return flight and I had to stay for another two nights . Although the Casablanca couldn't take me Jason ( who was brilliant!!) got me booked in to their Sister Hotel the Giraffe in Madison Avenue (which was also superb). I would thoroughly recommend this Hotel to anyone thinking of a break to the Big Apple and when I return I will definitely return to the Casablanca!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Very friendly and helpful staff that made us feel at home. The location was convenient for us to walk many places. It would be helpful to have someplace in the bathroom to put things down. No countertop space.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The only negative is that you can’t control the temperature in your room. Everything else is great (oh yeah, free wine at happy hour could be better quality but then again it is free). Quick walk to plays so great location.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I highly recommend this hotel. The reception staff are friendly and helpful, the breakfasts are great and the 5 til 8 evening buffet is a brilliant bonus and gives a lovely opportunity to rest from the hustle and bustle of New York

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Stayed here before my transatlantic cruise on Queen Mary 2. Didn't quite get a full first night unfortunately as my flight was a very late one in JFK at midnight.As I was needing transport from the airport that late as a solo traveller, I took advice from the hotel before i left the UK, and they organised a driver to collect me. Very nice vehicle, friendly driver. I paid him cash (tip had been factored into the price, so no shocks!).It's a lovely cosy hotel just off Times Square. Usual busy street, but it is New York! I wandered round Times Square, had a takeaway at 3am! What fun watching all the weird + wonderful people go by! The staff are super friendly and my petite queen room was perfect for one. Don't pass this collection over on the booking websites. They hailed a cab for me on my departure to take me to the cruise terminal in Brooklyn. At around 30 dollars, I thought that was very reasonable. Another lovely driver. I would definitely stay here again if the occasion ever arises again in the future!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: If you are a traveler that likes adventure and rooms beyond the ordinary, then the Casablanca Hotel is an absolute must stay. While there are times that a cookie cutter hotel is necessary, if you are going to visit New York City for recreation, then dive right into the adventure and choose the Casablanca. The guest services were absolutely wonderful! The Casablanca is within walking distance to many attractions; right around the corner from Times Square.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great Hotel right in the middle of Times Square. Perfect location for theatre lovers,and very clean and very helpful friendly staff. The only negative was our room was very small. Also is very quiet which was important for sleeping. Rooms and mattress could probably use a refresh, but we enjoyed our three night stay. Small Boutique Hotel Friendly staff.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is a gem of a hotel... quite literally about 30 seconds from Times Square. Despite this it was still quiet at night and we slept well. The hotel is clean, and well appointed. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The addition of breakfast and the cheese and wine are nice little bonuses. I would not think to stay anywhere else if returning to New York.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My husband and I stayed at Casablanca for our anniversary. First we were upgraded to a small suite which was generous of the hotel management and much appreciated. Room was very clean and quiet and we loved it. Location was ideal for theaters and restaurants. Staff were friendly and efficient. We liked the European feel of the hotel and will definitely return. Thanks for a lovely stay!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: absolutely stunning position near times square, great service provided by lovely staff, great breakfast , lovely decor throughout the hotel, wine and cheese and fruit complimentary is a great idea my friends

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great hotel right in Times Square! Very clean small hotel. Nice daily breakfast included. Staff could not have been better...extremely friendly and accomodating! They were always willing to answer questions, help get a taxi, etc. Would definitely stay here again!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This was my 3rd stay at The Casablanca Hotel. Never disappoints. I'm planning on coming back. It really is one of my favorite hotels, if not the favorite one. The staff is great, the attention superb. Can't wait to return!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My first visit to NYC for my 50th birthday. I wanted somewhere central with good subway access and a chance to chill out after a busy day. This hotel ticks all the boxes. The decor won’t be to everyone’s taste - this is no minimalist whitewashed block - but the rooms are clean, perfectly adequate in size and quiet. The extras mentioned in previous reviews really make this hotel special. Breakfast, round the clock coffee and pastries and the evening cheese and wine mean you’ll never go hungry in between meals. The atmosphere is very relaxed considering the neon-lit tourist bedlam going on outside (even my 13 year old daughter appreciated it) and of course the staff are absolutely top-notch and are a credit to their profession. I wouldn’t hesitate in booking this hotel again, thanks to all at Casablanca for helping to make such happy memories for us

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great place, outstanding service, ideal location. Won’t be staying anywhere else in NYC in the future - will definitely only stay here. Thanks again John for helping us with our theatre ticket problem - you’re a star! Hope to see you again soon...

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: When the Casablanca Hotel describes itself as “An oasis of kind hospitality, just steps from Times Square”, they are telling you the absolute truth! My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay there! Times Square is at your doorstep, and getting to the Theater District and Central Park is an easy walk. Beyond the great location, the services and accommodations were superb. Our room was comfortable and quiet. We greatly appreciated the complimentary breakfasts and evening wine & cheese receptions in the comfortable club room, where we got to meet other guests from all over the world, comparing our NYC experiences. Through it all, the staff were friendly and helpful and conveyed a genuine sense of hospitality. The Casablanca was definitely a relaxing “oasis” from the hustle and bustle of NYC! Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I will certainly visit this hotel again. The staff are wonderful. The rooms are small but well appointed. The bed comfortable, the bath lovely. I would feel perfectly safe staying alone. A comfortable retreat from a busy never-sleep city.
user_name:
Susan L
Rochester, New York, United States

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Casablanca on a trip to NYC to see Harry Potter and the Cursed Child. The location is amazing as the Lyric Theater is only two tenths of a mile away and is visible from the front door. We had a king bedroom and found it to be clean, comfortable, quiet and supplied with all the amenities we could wish for. The hotel has a lot of charm and does its "Casablanca" theme well. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. Mingling with the other guests in the second floor's reception area for breakfast and the evening wine and cheese service was a lot of fun. We had a very romantic and relaxing stay, and I will definitely look to book a room there again the next time we return to Broadway.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Casablanca Hotel is a great boutique property located in the heart of the action in N.Y. city. Steps away from the center of Times Square but quite enough to not be distracted by all the activity going on. Great restaurants next door and within walking distance. Stephen Sondheim Theater located right across the street. Easy access to the subway.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Fabulous location in the heart of Times Square yet quiet inside. Clean and comfortable. Great breakfast. Coffee and snacks always available. Uniformly friendly and accommodating staff. Will stay again!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: So, wasn't sure when booking this place what to expect, but overall we were very happy with our stay and found the staff to operate on a team basis all interacting to make our experience a pleasant one.Breakfast on the second floor is a great idea and they made us lovely porridge with fruit and honey.they really couldn't do enough for us, recommending a comedy show in the village which was brilliant also

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Always a great time, the hotel is perfect in every way! Breakfast, wine and cheese, location, staff even the lovely candies at the front desk. Always try to visit once a year and never disappointed. Great time in the Big Apple

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Such a great boutique hotel, ideally located for seeing Broadway shows or shopping and walking 5 mins max back to your room. It is an oasis of calm off Time Square. The lounge serves snacks all day including cheese and wine after 5pm and sometimes piano player is a wonderful perk of staying here. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Highly recommended. We had a great short stay here. The breakfast is excellent, as is the wine and cheese at night. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is sunset, very central and easy to walk to most tourist locations. If we come back to NY we will stay here.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Third trip to NYC and first stay at the Casablanca Hotel. Loved the Casablanca !! Location to Times Square and Central Park and subways excellent! Staff very friendly, responsive and professional! Boutique hotel with very personal service. Happy hour offered every evening with a variety of wines, sodas, and snacks including cheese and crackers, fruits and olives and nuts, not to mention staff who made sure we had everything we needed. My party looked forward to the happy hour each night after a long day of touring to wind down before going out to dinner. Accomadations were comfortable and modern. Although an older hotel it appears they have done updating. Breakfast, like happy hour is complimentary. Offered a variety of cereals, pastries, oatmeal and hard boiled eggs and fruit. Overall an outstanding experience!! Look forward to staying at the Casablanca Hotell on my next trip to New York City!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The location is wonderful, just round the corner from Times Square. The staff are wonderful and so friendly and helpful. The hotel is small but worth every penny. Will stay here every time we visit the city and will recommend it to everyone.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This place is exception for New York. It just seems to go above and beyond our expectation. It’s endearing and it’s in the midst of one of the cities attractions. We had young children and we found it easy to get around inside the hotel (though it was right a few times but remember we are in New York).The elevator is small so keep in mind for those who have a double stroller it won’t fit! Breakfast and wine evenings were relaxing and really helpful for all of us... kids were feed and we didn’t have to go anywhere just to find breakfast... we could have a drink and not worry about kids in a bar... best thing we got to meet people that were happy to share their table (which were hard to come by since everyone wanted to join the party). We would definitely come back again and again!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Stayed a few years ago - hotel still excellent standard - all staff very polite and professional - one suggestion would be for more choice at breakfast. Was disappointed that there were no drawers in our room other than bedside cabinet - this was soon rectified upon asking at reception

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I have just got back from a three night stay at this hotel in NYC and I am pleased to say that it exceeded my expectations! The staff (especially James the receptionist) at this hotel are all so welcoming and friendly which made the stay for myself and my mother wonderful. The complimentary wine and nibbles service in the evening was a real treat alongside the location in the middle of Times Square being ideal. Cleaning service for the rooms was also excellent with nightly chocolates and a forecasted weather for the following day left out. The rooms are comfortable, maybe the bathrooms were a little small and the bedding had a few holes in them but none of which mattered particularly for a short stay with little time spent in the room. With it being a special trip for my birthday, the staff and service at this hotel made an extra effort to ensure my stay was enjoyable and comfortable in every way. I would highly recommend staying here for short trips to New York.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Our king room was comfortable with a large bathroom. Even though it was on the 4th floor we found it to be noisy so we had to turn on the AC fan at night. Breakfast was nice with helpful staff. Evening wine and cheese was also a bonus with many guests attending so be sure to get there before 5 pm. We liked being able to use the stairs instead of the elevator. We found several good restaurants nearby.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Beautiful boutique hotel right off Times Square. Lovely old property with thoughtful renovations. Comfortable rooms, large closet, lovely bath. The breakfast room and offering is well above average and the staff is charming. I was not able to take advantage of the lengthy wine and cheese hour unfortunately. The staff was friendly and welcoming.This would have been a 5 start review except for the really weird last night and how that was handled. I came back from work at 11p to find someone left my room AC at 60. It was FREEZING. And there was something really gross in the shower (see photos). The front desk staff came up to get the radiator working (no luck) and then offered me a couple of blankets. I was told the room temperature was standard. Really? Then why wasn't that done the previous 3 nights? It was so late, I wasn't sure I wanted to trade rooms but it was odd that wasn't even offered. The room was unbearable - I slept or at least tried to, in my coat all night. It was terrible.The next morning I mentioned both the room temp and the shower to the front desk. Again, told the temperature was standard. The reservation manager gave me his card and told me to contact him the next time I was in NYC since there was nothing he could do on a pre-pay. The experience was so wonderful the first 3 nights and completely ruined by the horrible last night and really disappointing response. Nothing was offered but an apology and reiteration of "standard policy to reduce the temperature". I expected so much more of you Casablanca.....

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca Hotel was conveniently located and the staff was warm and friendly from the moment we stepped into the lobby to the moment we left. Located near Times Square our room was quiet and comfortable. The morning "Continental" breakfast was much more than he usual fare and the afternoon cheese and wine was a nice touch. A consistent array of snacks was available throughout the day as was coffee and tea. Free bottled water was great for long days in the city.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: First, the location is right off Times square with a connecting door to Tony's, an extraordinary Italian restaurant. Second, there is a great continental breakfast daily AND a great Afternoon wine and cheese and goodies daily. The service is amazing. The ladies in the library where one eats and reads are wonderful and charming. I wouldn't trade them for anybody else. Third, anything you want or need is just a ring away. We've stayed here for short and long periods.Fourth, housekeeping does an amazing job and will provide all your needs. Can't wait until our next trip.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Just returned from an amazing 5 night stay at The Casablanca Hotel. Great location central to everything with Times Square literally on your doorstep. Once you step inside the front door you literally cannot hear a thing outside particularly any traffic! Very comfortable rooms, hot water and lovely fluffy towels. Nice continental breakfast to start the day off. Great wine and cheese at 5pm is a big bonus. The staff were all friendly and made you feel very welcome with a particular mention to our friend Victor...keep on dancing! Very fortunate to be returning shortly for another wonderful stay.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We just got back from a 3 night stay here, this is our 5th visit to NYC but 1st time to The Casablanca. This is by far the most welcoming hotel we’ve EVER stayed in, the front reception staff were so friendly and welcoming, made us feel like we were friends not just hotel guests. Although we only managed 1/2 hour in the lounge for wine and cheese in 1 night, the staff in there again we’re friendly and very helpful, and also last but certainly not least, the breakfast staff!! Fantastic location, rooms are very comfortable with tranquil feel, although it’s hard to get away from NYC traffic and sirens. Free water and pillow chocolates for turn down service. We’re going back for Thanksgiving and I don’t think we’ll choose anywhere else on future NYC trips......

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca provides a fantastic central located haven to stay & experince New York. The customer service team members are tremendous & so helpful.The guest lounge for the complimentary breakfast & afternoon canapés and wine provides a great place to start & finish the days.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights and had a wonderful time. The most noticeable feature of our stay was the service from all staff which was first rate, professional, very friendly: nothing was too much trouble. For example, on the day we left our ride to JFK could not reach the hotel as the street was temporarily closed. The driver asked us to meet him on the other side of Times Square. The concierge (we cant recall his name-sorry) actually asked a staff member to assist us. Dimitri was so very helpful, he took our bags through the crowds and guided us to the meeting point, all with a smile on his face. All of the staff are a credit to the hotel. Our suite actually lived up to the expectations of the photographs on the website. The bed was great, room was spacious and housekeeping was first class. The free breakfast was excellent. Loved the free “wine and cheese” from 5-8 pm, it included red and white wines and champagne and a good range of cheeses, dips, crackers etc. We were also allowed to bring a guest, which was lovely as our daughter was also in New York celebrating her 30th birthday. Friday night wine and cheese includes a piano player.The 24 hour access to coffee and biscuits and pastries in the beautifully appointed second floor cafe was also a luxurious and sincere touch. Free wifi is also included.Location is close to Time Square and Subway stations. On either side of the Casablanca are Tony’s Italian restaurant and the Brooklyn Diner. Tried both and can highly recommend them. Beware at Tonys, the servings are huge and one dish easily fed both us, an older Australian couple. Try the hot dog at the diner but again beware, one fed both of us.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My parents booked the hotel for my Mum's 60th birthday celebrations. Due to work I wasn't initially able to attend but later managed to secure time off. I contacted the hotel and explained I wanted to arrange a surprise visit which meant upgrading my parents room. The staff were helpful and managed to keep it a secret! They were all keen to help me organise how to surprise my parents. The staff were helpful, kind and chatty. Always stopping to speak to me. The hotel was really a gem. Right in the center of things but once inside you are unaware of the city outside. Loved the wine and cheese night every evening 5-8pm and the 24 hour complementary pastries, tea and coffee. I would stay here again on my next visit.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We absolutly loved this hotel!! From walking in the door to saying goodbye the service was amazing! They were so smiling, helpful and kind. Good beds, good breakfast and had free wine, crackers and cheese from 17-20 so when we were tired after a day of sightseeing we didnt even have to go out! We will definetly stay here again if coming to New York!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Casablanca Hotel for 3 nights as part of my ongoing significant birthday celeberations, with my cousin. From the moment we arrived to check out, which sadly came round far too quickly, we had the most perfect stay at this perfect hotel. Everything about the hotel is perfect. A special mention to each one of its charming staff we came into contact with, who are a credit to the hotel due to the high level of customer service they genuinely provide. We stayed in a suite which was immaculate and very spacious. Housekeeping did a first class job each day of maintaining the room to a high standard throughout our stay. Upon arrival, the hotel had kindly left a bottle of complimentary wine to mark my birthday which was very thoughtful and much appreciated. Buffet breakfast was plentiful and a good choice of fresh produce each morning. Complimentary tea/coffee and cookies are served throughout the day. Cheese and wine which is served each evening between 5-8pm is fab. What’s not to like about sitting down in beautiful surroundings with a nice glass of wine, a plate of cheese and biscuits whilst listening to the resident pianist. Upon leaving the hotel, turn right, take a few steps and you will find yourself in the hustle and bustle of Times Square. When in the hotel you would never think you are so close to Times Square as the Casablanca has a lovely quiet and calm feel to it. I could go on and on about how perfect this hotel is......................I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel in the big apple that goes that extra mile, providing so many wonderful touches that most hotels do not. Thank you to everyone at the Casablanca Hotel for such a perfect stay.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Lovely hotel just by Times Square. Our room was on the 6th floor at the back and very quiet. All the staff were very helpful. Gorgeous porridge with fresh fruit started our day with bagels too then information from the front desk for the best directions. Back later for a glass or two of wine and snacks. Highly recommend hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The perfect hotel to stay in in New York. A dedicated,warm and caring staff who go out of the way to make you comfortable. From the bellmen,housekeepers,servers at the lounge and desk people you are greeted warmly and like an old friend. The rooms are on the small side but in the end that doesn't matter because everything else is perfect.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is what an Aussie couple told us. It was their third visit and our fourth. We met a couple from Toronto. It was their first as a couple....but she always comes with her sister to see Broadway shows. We all agreed the Casablanca is a gem. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The included continental breakfast has a variety of things that should please most people. The evening social hours with the wine and cheese and goodies is always a great time to meet folks and share adventures of the day.The only downside of the hotel being this good is that it is harder to book on short notice. Thus, the Aussie's comment.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Came here mainly due to the location as we had tickets to an event at Town Hall and the many positive reviews. Believe the hype! We had an amazing (brief) stay. Everyone we encountered was genuinely friendly and willing to assist in any way. Room was clean and spacious (we were upgraded to a suite). We were also celebrating my wife’s birthday, and they acknowledged her birthday at check-in and had a bottle of wine waiting in the room. If you are doing the Times Square thing, you really can’t beat the location. Everything is within walking distance. For dining, Tony Di Napoli is right next door with access from the hotel lobby. We had to check out pretty early so we did not experience the breakfast that is included in the rate. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: amazing!We stayed there one night and the attention and the place were perfect. It is completely recommendable. we will be back. It's nice to find places like this around the world. thank you, thank you and thank you

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We were in NYC for our 25th anniversary. After reading reviews about this hotel, I booked it far in advance. It was amazing in every way. We arrived to a bottle of wine in our room to celebrate our anniversary. We especially loved the breakfast every morning which more than met our needs. The wine and cheese in the afternoon was also wonderful and we found it tided us over until we had a later dinner. The room was great and came with everything you would need including the toiletries which were lovely. The A/C is very noisy and we didn't use it at night - I think it would have kept us up but there was a ceiling fan in the room which was great to have as a backup. We really felt that this hotel was an oasis. After very full days of tours and exhibits, we looked forward to coming back to a quiet place - and it really was. This hotel is quiet and very clean. We did the City Pass which was a great way to see the city. We also did some Broadway shows - The Lion King, Come from Away and The Play That Goes Wrong - all excellent! But the best part of our hotel stay, were the staff. When we first got to our hotel, we had to get down to Battery Park to pick up some passes and Christian offered to show us how to use the subway since he was on his way to take one himself. We felt quite overwhelmed with the craziness of NYC (which you get used to!) and he was such welcome help! He walked us through buying a metro card (a must if you plan on using the subway/transit and you should - it's cheaper and easier than a cab), what train to take, etc. He was also a great help in giving advice for various different questions we had. So a shout out to Christian but also to Victor, Dmitri and James as well as the breakfast staff who were also super friendly and always knew what we wanted for breakfast! Victor was so helpful with suggestions as well and even got ice for my feet after walking miles and miles one day. I can't say enough about the staff - they were a real pleasure, made our stay so memorable and it felt like we said goodbye to friends when we left. Thank you for making our trip to NYC such an amazing one! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Location location location - steps from times square. Quiet rooms -surprisingly General ambience - perfect in every way, Very engaging staff, are extremely helpful, kind and always smiling. Room - not large but adequate with everything you need, Spotless - and very nicely decorated. Good size bathroom with strong hot shower. Nice towels. The bed was very very comfortable and the pillows perfect (those who follow me - know I am a pillow and linen fanatic - all were spot on here. The welcome wine, afternoon wine hour and the 24 hour access to coffee and treats were a nice touch. Breakfast was light - but perfect for me. Over all 5 star stay and will stay here again. Not an inexpensive hotel but worth every penny charged,

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Staff was so kind. Great lounge. Champagne/wine/ hors d'oevres each evening. Every amenity of the larger hotels without the price. Loved it. Only downside was an occasional meat smell from BBQ restaurant behind hotel that could be over powerful if we turned off air conditioner

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We have been staying here for well over ten years. The Casablanca is clearly distinguished by its staff. Every morning and evening on the second floor, Rick’s Cafe, is where you must go. A continual style breakfast is provided and in the evening there is wine and cheese. You can get coffee, tea and pastries all day. The rooms are nice and have recently been refurbished. The hotel is right at Times Square which is perfect.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great lounge and breakfast. TV service could be upgraded but otherwise a delightful stay. Perfect location for Broadway. Staff at front desk were very helpful and went the extra mile for taxis etc. Great hotel for couples.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: If you are traveling to Times Square, you must stay in this quaint hotel. It's just steps away from Times Square center, Starbucks, a main Subway station and Police station, plus restaurants galore. The staff at the Casablanca is tremendously kind and helpful. Their free breakfast and evening wine and cheese are very good. The decor of the hotel is beautiful, homey, and comfy. The small size, only 60 rooms, makes you feel like you are at home. Enjoy!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I booked this hotel back in February based on the reviews, and would look frequently at it to make sure it remained with good reviews ... I am so glad we stayed last week.Not sure how its possible to step out this peaceful hotel, turn right, take 50 steps and be in bustling Times Square.The location is absolutely fantastic, the staff are amongst the friendliest of people ever (nothing is too much trouble) the cheese & wine evening reception is wonderful and the fact that tea and coffee is available throughout the day is again a nice touch.We stayed in 309 which is a suite, spotlessly clean, comfy beds and lots of room. Yes the fans are noisy but you can get earplugs or a white noise machine from reception if noise bothers you a lot. We were celebrating a 50th birthday and they left a bottle of wine in the suite for us with a lovely note. Our main reason to visit New York was to go and see the Broadway Show 'Pretty Woman' and the theatre is literally round the corner from the hotel. We bought the DVD with us to watch as the hotel didn't have it in their library (we had asked in advance) and we have now left it with them, so if you are like us and off to see the show, order room service and enjoy a late night watch of the movie before seeing the show!I could go on and on, but quite simply I just want to say book it. Thank you to you all, we had an amazing 3 nights.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel exceeded our expectations in every way, decor, comfort and service, The wine and cheese evenings were very enjoyable and a great way for guests to meet and get to know each other, not to be missed. We would definitely stay there again when visiting New York. Well done to all concerned.Ian and Sue Daniels
user_name:
Ian29Sue14
City of Greater Geelong, Australia

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We came to NYC to see the Harry Potter play for our 37th anniversary. We assessed hotels in the Times Square area and chose Casablanca because of the location and amenities. We made the right choice. While close to the intensity of Times Square, the hotel was an “oasis” of comfort and relative quiet (this is New York!). The staff was engaging, helpful and friendly. The room was comfortable. The complementary continental breakfast and wine and cheese were top notch and offered in a comfortable lounge, We loved our stay and recommend the hotel to anyone who wants a conveniently located Midtown hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Historic, but modernized, hotel. Outstanding customer service. Spotless. The evening wine, cheese, and fruit offerings were more extensive than I imagined. Breakfast was better than the usual Continental, and coffee and pastries were offered throughout the day.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Excellent boutique hotel. Service was impeccable. Hotel is literally right around the corner from Times Square. Great Italian restaurant right next door. Rooms were clean. As the name indicates the hotel has the Casablanca theme which was a nice feature. Another feature we really enjoyed was the evening wine and cheese service on the second floor. Great feature from 5 p.m. to 8 p.m. where you can go sit and enjoy yourself. As the second floor is open 24/7 you can also go up and relax after a Broadway Show or just seeing the sites of New York. Would definitely recommend,!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We’ve stayed at a Library Collection hotel several times; but on this most recent visit, we wanted to be closer to the theatre district. The Casablanca was perfect in every way. The staff made us feel like family. We thoroughly enjoyed the complimentary daily breakfast, evening wine and cheese, and all day pastries, cookies, tea and coffee. The location was perfect for exploring the city. Once you walk through the hotel doors, you’d never know that you’re mere steps away from Times Square. The Casablanca and staff were indeed a highlight of our visit to New York! We will be back!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed at the Casablanca for 6 days and had a fabulous time. So conveniently located near Times Square we virtually walked everywhere. The staff were friendly, professional and accommodating at all times.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca is right in Times Square yet offers quiet and comfort. It is prefect in every way. The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. The breakfast and afternoon teas were superb. We loved everything about this hotel

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My husband and I loved this place and I almost forgot to review it but something I saw on TripAdvisor just reminded me about it. This place was in a good location close to good food and was a great comfortable place for us to stay a few nights in the city

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Our one week stay in Casablanca was amazing. The hotel is in such a convenient location such steps, and I mean steps away from the main strip in Times Square. Super close to the subway and close enough to walk to places like Rockerfella plaza, Central Park and the Jarvits Centre. The room and hotel was perfectly decorated in a classic old school Casablanca movie theme but never seemed outdated it actually made you feel like your staying in a classic New York Hotel from the movies.The hotel staff are some of the best we have ever encountered with an amazing housekeeping crew who left chocolates and temperature guides for the following day on our bed. The breakfast crew who gave us great service and well stocked supply of yummy food and the stars of the hotel the Concierge department.The concierge/front desk staff staff are true ambassadors of the hotel and we want to give a big thank you to Christian, Dimitri and team who helped us out with every question and gave us fantastic options for travel and food. Hope to see you guys at New York Comic-con again soon :)Thank you for an amazing stay and yes we will be back!!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel is perfectly maintained in an art deco style, complete with live pianist with wine and cheese hour. This hotel is incredibly romantic and perfectly located right off Time Square. Keep in mind this building is older so the rooms are smaller and has some of the issues that older buildings have (We had some issues with the drainage in the bathroom but the maintenance team were on it immediately). If you are into modern and all new fixtures this is not the place for you. Any downfall of the older building is completely out weighed by the amazing staff and charm of the place.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: What makes it the #1 hotel in New York?*LOCATION. <100 yards to the New Year’s Eve ball drop and the GMA studios on Times Square. Everything is close by. **CLEAN. Spotless. Don’t have to worry about tiny crawly things here. ***FRIENDLINESS. You are family when you come here. It’s genuine. There is no suck up displayed. Greetings at the door when you come and go. ****SERVICE!!! Nothing is a problem for them. Done with efficiency and willingness. I wanted to start naming individuals, but feared I would miss someone. ALL of them are outstanding. It’s obvious it starts with the manager and flows down. Once you get past the sticker prices of staying midtown, it also has VALUE (Can’t believe I said that). Breakfast, afternoon treats, Wine and Cheese hours...something anytime you need to relax at RIck’s Cafe and chill for a while. Don’t hesitate—if you are coming to NYC, stay here. No disappointment....you won’t want to check out.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Stayed here for four nights. Great location just steps away from the mayhem of Times Square. Our room was very clean. Bathroom was a nice size. Linen and towels were spotless. We stayed in the sixth floor which I think was the highest level. We were situated at the rear of the building. The view from our window was of brick buildings /extractor fans...All that said, it was quieter than our friends room on the front. The staff were second to none. Very very friendly and helpful. Special mention to Jefrey....What a wonderful young man.Breakfast was simple but always presented well. Eating area was small. At busy times it would be difficult to find a private table.Cheese and wine session in the evening was a perfect touch.Decor a little dated but this did not pose a problem.If I return to New York....Would I go to The Casablanca Hotel again? MOST CERTAINLY I WOULD.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: awesome, nice, wonderful people, best place to go to the theater, next to the metro, we would never change!All the personal is very nice, there is a pianist on Friday, cheese and wine every afternoon, a delicious breakfast

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: From check in to check out everything is perfectly top notch! The desk staff and doorman are great! Perfect location in midtown Manhattan...you can walk to almost everything...or an easy taxi ride. Great complimantary breakfast. Donna

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great room and bath. Nice restaurant and bar next door. 200’ from Times Square . Great service. Nice continental breakfast. Bathroom was spacious and had a nice shower and tub. Service in lobby was very good with prompt service and very helpful.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I would recommend this lovely hotel to anyone who wanted to stay in a central location in NYC but did not want a big chain hotel. The staff is excellent, very helpful and accommodating. Parking is right next door and Times Square is steps away. Champagne and wine and cheese for happy hour can never be beat.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: If you've read any of my other reviews, you'd know that I'm not a pushover! I'm not a nit picker and overly harsh, but for me to give a top rating, I need top service! And that's what I got from the Casablanca during my recent business trip to New York. I only wish I could have been longer, but the overnight was just enough to get a taste for how they care for their guests. I had a hiccup with my reservation through no fault of the hotel and when I called directly to get it worked out, Cristian at the front desk went above and beyond the call of duty to assist me. Asim, the manager called me back directly to be sure everyone was set. I wine and cheese was just what I needed at the end of the day-- with great service, wonderful nibbles and comfortable surroundings. The continental breakfast was filling and more than just a cold pastry and coffee. My cappuccino, fruit, egg and bagel would have cost me a pretty penny outside of the hotel and I was able to share my table with a lovely couple visiting the city. I can't say enough about how I felt attended to at every moment. Jeffrey at the front desk took the time to search for a left behind item and I couldn't believe that Stanley actually went to the pharmacy to get me toothpaste as they were out of it in house! That's the kind of service one doesn't see everyday! They are steps from the life of Times Square, so if you want to grab a show or shop, you're close to everything!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Staff outstanding in service,room a bit small to what we get for the price in the UK,bath room has a sunken tub that needs grab handles fitted to get out , very good location for times square and good information from staff for good eating places

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Would highly recommend this hotel for its wonderful staff who were always there to help and welcome you on your return. Comfy rooms with safe provided, excellent complimentary breakfast in a fabulous location. After a hard day walking it was wonderful to return to this oasis for cheese and wine in a relaxing environment before going out for the evening.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We had booked this hotel based on the reviews here at tripadvisor. First of all, the staff and service is excellent! BUT the hotel it self need some upgrading and are not a 4 star hotel according to scandinavian standard. We had booked a standard room and the bed was very good and the bathroom is nice with a big shower! The aircondition on the otherhand was terrible, it was so loud and we could almost not sleep. Because of the air in the city opening the window was not an option. The breakfast was ok, but very simple, nothing more than you have at home unfortunatly and there is not enough tables for all the guests, so you have to share if you don’t want to wait. The hotel is 20 meters from times square and in the middle of mid town and Manhatten. It takes 6-7 min to walk to Bryan Park, 10-12 to Central station, and 12-15 to Rockefeller so the location of the hotel is very good!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Hotel Casablanca is just in the heart of Manhattan round the corner from Time sq. perfect spot for those who would like to have all place within walking distance. No matter you would like to go to theatre for famaous musical or just for movie, many good dining places as well as bars are just near by.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Queen room was not large, but comfortable with everything you could need. Complimentary wine and cheese each evening was very enjoyable. All staff very helpful and courteous. This is not the place if you want a room with a view but the excellent location right next to Times Square means you only use your room to sleep. Our room wasn't noisy. We had a problem with the air con which was dealt with immediately.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I've been thinking about the best way to write this review for almost a month. I have so much praise for the management and staff at the Casablanca I'm hard pressed to put it into such a limited space. For starters, during our 4 day stay, every time we entered the lobby after a full day of the sights and sounds of NYC my wife and I did feel like we'd just come home to the Casablanca's quiet tranquility. My wife and I met two wonderful couples, one from Australia and the other from Bethpage Long Island on an Alaska cruise 2 years ago.The folks from down under took a cruise that ended in NYC so my wife and I went for a mini-reunion with them and our friends from Long Island.From my first contacts with the Casablanca's General Manager, JohnTaboada and the Reservation Manager Brian Castro, our reservation was handled with ease and no request went unfulfilled. From the minute we entered the lobby to check-in, the staff treated us like old friends and I never saw them without a smile or an offer to help make our stay memorable.The complementary breakfast and the evening wine and cheese served in Rick's Cafe were mouth watering and a perfect way to start and end a full NYC day. The staff at Risk's Cafe, Paola, Jafia, Houda, Maria, Arabel, Jernely and Margareth were pleasant and helped to make our entire experience enjoyable. The front desk staff always offered their help with any question or request we presented them. The professionalism and sincere desire to assist us definitely puts the customer first and foremost in the sometimes forgotten concept of customer service, Jeffery, James, Christian and Dimitri, to name a few are all worthy of our admiration and praise for their exemplary service. My wife and I made a lot of new friends at the Casablanca who we hope to see again the next time we visit NYC. If I could give the Casablanca a ten star rating I would. You can't go wrong at this hotel for many reasons. In addition to its location a few steps from Times Square and the closeness to the theater district , the Casablanca management and staff deliver on the promise of making you feel right at home. Well done and Bravo to our new friends in the Big Apple.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is a nice sized, friendly hotel right in the centre of town, with Times Square literally around the corner. Our room was out the back, which meant it was quiet, although we had no view. The bed was very comfy and the bathroom excellent too. We enjoyed breakfast, which was self service - cereals, fruit salad, yogurt, pastries, toast etc and it was always well stocked by the staff. Cheese and wine was available 5-8pm every night and you could always help yourself to tea and coffee and pastries at other times. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting New York!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Friendly and professional staff and very comfortable rooms made for a very nice stay. Had some surprise items for my wife brought in before we arrived and they were set up in room with roses, cupcakes and wine (complimentary). Loved the room, the lounge on the second floor is very relaxing and the breakfast options were perfect for a light to medium breakfast. The complimentary wine and cheese in the afternoon is perfect. What a great place - we will be back!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We cannot speak more highly of the staff at the hotel. Their professionalism and helpfulness is the best we have encountered in the United States. Our King Bed Suite was everything we needed, the rooms were very spacious and comfortable. My only suggestion would be to replace the venetian blinds with 100% blockout curtains as the light from Times Square flowed into the room all night. The continental breakfast was very good. Coffee throughout the day if you're in the hotel and then wine and cheese of an evening. Excellent! Excellent!We used the subway once and it is within walking distance, as was Times Square and Broadway. Everything was so close, very convenient indeed.I strongly recommend this hotel if you are planing to stay in Times Square.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great morrocan style hotel with extremely comfortable beds. All toiletries supplied including robe and slippers. Very clean room with friendly staff. Breakfast was lovely with again, helpful staff who couldn’t doenough fir you

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: this is a wonderful place to stay . It is a great place to return to after a busy day. It is always calm and quiet and welcoming. This is our second stay from New Zealand and we will be backThe staff make you feel very welcome and are so helpful.happy Hour is a special part of our day.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great location in the middle of Times Square. Top quality folks working there - helpful and friendly. Room was big enough and clean. Bed was very comfortable. Looking forward to our next stay at the Casablanca.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We totally enjoyed the Casablanca Hotel. We are active walkers and museum visitors and, with 8 days in NYC, we put on the miles. Being virtually on Times Square put us in the center of it all. We often came back hot and exhausted, but there was our Oasis waiting: a cold room, cappuccinos or lattes at the push of a button, smiling staff, evening wine & cheese with lots of veggies.The Casablanca decor was nice; the option of a large "living room" or interior courtyard was great. Rooms were tight but nicely done. This was, by far, the most expensive hotel bill we have ever paid in our travels through 52 countries, but it was a very pleasurable experience, with a small-hotel feel just 100 feet off Times Square.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A special trip to NYC was made perfect by our stay at the Casablanca. The staff were all wonderful and toi k such care of us. Our room was lovely and we really appreciated the generous and continuous availability of food!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: hotel within walking distance of train or bus arrival into nyc. near most of broadway theaters. easy access to subway for other areas of town.very nice lounge on 2nd floor with continental breakfast and eve wine and cheese service -great for connecting with other travelers.great staff. overall a very warm and welcoming stay..

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Can’t wait to come back. I will stay here every single time!!!! The staff was so welcoming and made you feel at home. The room was very nice and comfortable and had GREAT air conditioning!!!! Happy hour was on point. The location is perfect! I’ll be back!!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Casa Blanca has never failed to exceed our expectations. Great location assuming you want to be near the action and fabulous staff doing all they can to please your every need. We have returned several times and will be back again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Super clean. A very warm and welcoming atmosphere . Great staff. An unexpected 3 hour evening wine & cheese reception, along with a breakfast serving in the am. The rooms are on the small side, even for NYC. My solution was to upgrade to a mini suite, which worked well. Highly recommend for the more mature traveler.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The hotel is no nice and warm. Every detail is done in a perfect way. The room was very comfortable and the bed was simply perfect.The staff was friendly and very respectful and they helped me in any need I had. I loved the cafe and the chocolates in the room in the evening.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We had the best time at this hotel! We found it online and based on the reviews, we booked a 4 day stay. Everything was amazing---24/7 complimentary refreshments, wine and cheese (and tons more) from 5-8pm each evening, and delicious continental breakfast every morning. The food is continually replenished and there is a wait staff there making sure you have everything you need! It honestly looks like a hole in the wall as you drive up, but it is anything but. There are always numerous staff waiting to hold the door or assist you in any way. It is literally 20 steps from Times Square where the ball drops, and everything is right there outside the hotel door. The rooms were comfortable and immaculate; the house keeping does a turn down service in the evening with chocolates and a personalized weather forecast for the next day. When we checked out after our 4 day stay, we left to go on a Cruise...so, when we got back, we had some time before we had to head to the airport, so we called the hotel and explained that we had checked out 4 days prior and would they be willing to hold our luggage for us---they did not even hesitate to say yes immediately---and we were so appreciative. As soon as we arrived back to drop off our luggage they also invited us to complimentary refreshments again (delicious chocolate croissants!). We will stay here again the next time we are in NYC and this time, we will bring our 3 kids with us! One of the best hotel experiences we have ever had! Thanks again to all the staff at Casablanca! Jill and Krishna Rangarajan

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The staff at this hotel are exceptional nothing is too much trouble for them no matter what time of day. The cheese and wine provided each evening is a nice bonus. Rooms are clean and comfortable and there are lots of amenities available if required such as mini fridge etc.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: As a solo traveller in New York, it was a wonderful experience to be welcomed by the friendly staff. I was given a complimentary upgrade to a king size room, and appreciated the luxuries within, such as the personalised welcome letter, including a weather forecast.Casablanca is in a great location in Times Square (no noise complaints) and I would happily stay here again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My daughter and I were in NYC to see Bruce Springsteen on Broadway and wanted a hotel near the theater. The Casablanca got excellent reviews so we made our reservations with great expectations. The hotel, however, surpassed our expectations. It reminded us of hotels that we have stayed at in Europe. The entire staff was charming but Tarik and Paola stood out with their personalities and service.The second floor is devoted to comfortable rooms for breakfast and complimentary snacks and wine in the evening. Coffee, tea and cookies were available throughout the day. What a pleasant surprise it was to have Casablanca on the television when we went down for our evening wine. Even though we were close to Times Square, the hotel was quiet. The rooms and bathroom were immaculate and the housekeeping staff was very efficient. The bedding was comfortable and after 3 hectic days we had no difficulty sleeping.Thank you staff at the Casablanca for a wonderful stay.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We had a wonderful experience staying at this hotel and would definitely stay here again. Location was great and the complimentary breakfast and happy hour was a bonus. We ate at Tony's next door and Padraig our waiter was excellent.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We loved absolutely everything about this hotel but the staff are the jewel in the crown! Always a smile whoever greeted you from front door staff to chambermaids. Superb service from everyone and a credit to the hotel. We loved the cheese and wine moments, lovely after a busy day sightseeing to be greeted so warmly with a lovely free glass of wine and a selection of cheese and crackers, once again served by the most lovely staff. At any time of day you can help yourself to tea, coffee and cakes/pastries in Rick's bar, again, extremely thoughtful and welcomed.
