The location is superb and we would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone. If we ever visit New York again, this is where we'll stay.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: After staying two weeks at Casablanca I can only say: what an amazing hotel! The service is top-notch, staff is fully prepared to help you on whatever you may need. Breakfast and 24h refreshments are just great, you don't need to bother going outside for a quick meal. Hotel is super clean and daily room cleaning is really well done. I stood in the Deluxe Queen room and the bed was really great, room space was definitely enough too and bathroom really good. It is definitely a must stay in NYC!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Just arrived home from simply wonderful trip to NYC and absolutely incredible stay at Casablanca Hotel. From the moment of arrival to departure, all hotel personnel could not have been more helpful, courteous, and professional. The small touches and amenities were wonderful, did not go unnoticed, and were certainly appreciated...not to mention the phenomenal location! Without question, one of the finest hotel experiences I have ever had in world travel. Cannot recommend highly enough!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We checked in early, they were happy to hold our luggage and allowed us to have refreshments on the second floor. Our room was not quite ready at check in. They were doing a last minute check. They sent a complimentary bottle of wine to our room! It wasn’t necessary but appreciated and showed the professionalism of the staff. I highly recommend Casablanca.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We go to NYC a lot for the US Open over Labor Day weekend. We have thoroughly enjoyed several of the Library Hotel Collection hotels, but the proximity of the Casablanca to Times Square, Bryant Park and the subway made us return there again this year. The service is outstanding and we especially love the complimentary breakfast and wine & cheese in the evening. Breakfast includes coffees, pastries, boiled eggs, bagels, toasts, juice, fresh fruit and more. The wine and cheese in the evening includes red, white and sparkling wines, cheese, crackers, olives, etc. Throughout our stay the service was exceptional. Note*** On our previous stay our room was on the street and it was a bit noisy. This time I asked for a quieter room which they happily accommodated and we heard no street noise at all.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: From the moment we arrived with a very friendly greeting to arriving in our room for 2 - WOW! This hotel is beautiful and every member of staff we came across couldn't do more for us. They were attentive and chatty without being in your face. We have stayed in many 5* hotels and I don't think they come close in terms of staff, everything interior and location.The decor was absolutely beautiful and fitted brilliantly into the Moroccan charm. Although the room was described as bijou we thought the size generous. The bathroom was very luxurious. The location amazing. There was plenty of choice for breakfast and the cheese and wine in the early evening was super. A great way to say hi to other guests and we were also lucky that one of the guests played a tune on the piano which we all sang along to! Do not hesitate to book this as I really cannot see how you can be disappointed. OK, so the only negative I can think of is the cups they used for tea/coffee - a nicer china one would have been lovely - yes I am being very picky!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I cannot say enough about the Casablanca Hotel! We wanted a nice place close to the action (we were seeing a show nearby) and everything about our stay was perfect! Everyone at the concierge desk was friendly and helpful, from recommending nearby restaurants in the middle of the night, to advising us on subway times, to promptly providing us with additional accommodations in our room such as a fleece blanket and mini fridge free of charge. On our last day, they held our luggage for us while we spent a few more hours exploring the city after checkout. New York City hotel rooms are notoriously tiny so with that in mind I thought our queen suite was cozy and comfortable in its arrangement. The bathroom was beautiful and there was even a little table and chairs that we utilized beside the bed. The breakfast/wine and cheese area was similarly well appointed, with a tiny courtyard and several options for a quick snack to start or refresh your day. While the hotel is just off of Times Square in the theater district, you leave the hustle and bustle outside as you enter your quiet and private room. The Casablanca Hotel is small, yet inviting and grand. After a long day, I had the thought that the pillows were a little soft for my liking but before I could decide if I wanted to request the memory foam pillows they offer free of charge, I slept peacefully and forgot all about it. The perfect hotel if you plan to see a show, and a quick subway ride or walk away from almost anything else! We had a wonderful stay and will definitely return.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Can’t say enough positive things about our stay. By far one of the cleanest hotels we have ever stayed in. All the staff from the front desk to housekeeping and the ladies in the cafe were friendly, helpful and welcoming. We can’t wait to return!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The service was excellent. The location is great! The servers are friendly and efficient. I felt very safe being alone in this hotel. The breakfast was very good. I would recommend this hotel to any one.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel made us feel home from home. Great location, lovely clean rooms. Staff very helpful and friendly. From the desk clerks to the cleaners all were polite and always had time for us. Would highly recommend this hotel.
user_name:
David F
Ipswich, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Positives - great location right next to Times Square, friendly and attentive staff, decent wi-fi, Ricky’s Lounge amenities and service were excellent, overall a reasonable value for moneyNegatives - noisy and annoying A/C, TV not hi-def, outdated room, area (especially the bathroom) a little small

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I stayed at the Casablanca for 5 nights with my son. The whole experience was wonderful from beginning to end. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff who made sure we had a fantastic time. The location is amazing; just off Times Square. It is spotlessly clean with lots of lovely extra touches that made our stay so special. There are complimentary hot drinks all day together with biscuits, pastries and fruit. There is also complimentary wine, cheese and crackers (and popcorn) early evening. Lovely to be able to sit and relax and enjoy this in the guest cafe. It’s a welcome calm oasis after the excitement and chaos of Times Square. There was no problem with us still using the cafe after we had checked out while waiting for transport to airport which was really appreciated. There is even a computer available so boarding passes etc can be printed. All in all a fantastic experience. Thank you Casablanca for a wonderful holiday!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Just arrived home after 4 night at Casablanca hotel. We where 5 girls on a City trip to NY, we loved our stay at Casablanca. The complimentary breakfast and the complimentary Wine and cheese was so lovely and a oasis after long hot days of sightseeing and shopping. There is not a single imployer who wasn’t helpfull, and did all to help us with reservations, questions, directions and so on. All where charming and smiling and made a feel at home atmosphere... we had a late flight back to Copenhagen and left our bagage at the hotel, could go back after sightseeing, relax at Ricks Cafe with the Wine, cheese and coffee AND take a shower in a private restroom in the basement because as they told os at the frontdesk; your still at home... you have just checked out off the rooms. Where do you get that kind off service??? So thank you a thousind times Cristian, Victor, all sweet guys at front desk and beautifull girls at breakfast service, you all made our trip to NY memorable, cosy and easy.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: For our first vacation to NYC we reserved the Casablanca for our 5 night stay and could not have been more pleased. The hotel more than exceeded our expectations. The location is right in the heart of Times Square, the staff is friendly, welcoming and very helpful and the amenities/extras are top notch. The breakfast, wine and cheese and 24 hour refreshments that are included in the room rate were great as well as the free bottles of water that are in your room on a daily basis. The hotel is older but clean and well maintained and we enjoyed the coziness in the heart of all the action associated with Times Square. When we returned from our adventures each day the staff always greeted us and inquired about our day and we truly felt like we had made new friends by the time we left. I've already told family and friends that when I return to NYC in the future I will be booking the Casablanca. LOVED IT!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The location is absolutely perfect for Times Square, Most Broasway Theatres, Restaurants/Diners and Shops , also with easy subway and local bus access. What more could you ask for.As the name suggests, decor and furnishings are themed on the film Casablanca. Complimentary continental breakfast is offered each morning (In Rick's Cafe). This is a good quality breakfast, but if you are a carnivor, this is may not be suitable if you stay more than a day or two. Seating is limited and sometimes it is necessary to share tables at breakfast. The same Rick's Cafe is also the venue for the complimentary evening Chesese and Wine between 5 - 8pm. With the price of alchohol in New York this is a welcome benefit.The staff in all areas of the hotel were very friendly, polite and very efficient. Often forgotten, are the house keeping staff, but they did a brilliant job and we were very happy with the cleanliness of our room.The hotel has no bar or restaurant, but Tony's Di Napoli restaurant is attached to the hotel where drinks and dinner can be taken. They even provide room service for the hotel. We didn't actually use this facility because there were so many alternatives so close at hand. However we did hear that it was a very good restaurant.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed 4 nights in late August. The hotel is just off Broadway and Time Square right in the heart of the Theatre District with the Stephen Sondheim Theatre right across the street. The place has a theme from the famous movie with Humphrey Bogart Casablanca and is tastefully appointed and comfortable. It has added amenities namely complimentary breakfast and cheese and wine in the evening. You have access to the internet on two computers situated on the first floor in the lounge you can print from these which is useful for tickets etc. The room was air conditioned and cosy. The staff were excellent. I informed them that it was my wife's birthday and we received a bottle of red wine in the room on our arrival. Really helpful staff. No bar in the hotel but an door in the lobby leads to Tony Di Napoli's restaurant which has a bar just the other side of the door. Superb hotel right in the heart of midtown.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Times Square is pretty easily my least favorite area of NYC. Unfortunately, my graduation (from grad school) took place at Lincoln Center, and I knew I needed to be close, particularly as family was staying in the area as well. I found a great single room (Ladyfriend couldn't join, unfortunately) at the Casablanca, and was really pleased with every aspect of my stay. The room was small, but not by European or even NYC standards, given the price (it was notably larger than my first "dorm" room in NYC, some 20 years ago...). The breakfast wasn't lavish -- there was no hot food option -- but it hit all the marks otherwise, including having great coffee. I didn't get to spend much time here, except for to sleep, and for breakfast after my morning runs in Central Park. But what really made the stay memorable was the staff; everyone was friendly to a fault, and seemed interested -- in a way that I have very much come to associate with New York -- in actually chatting. The doorman one night was an undergraduate student at the school where I did my Ph.D. One of the desk clerks was from the Philippines, and as I live in Hong Kong, we had a lot to talk about on that score. I bring it up only because I feel that there is a very human element that Casablanca gets right that not many places do, and for that reason alone I recommend it unreservedly.Because I had family staying at another hotel in the area, I was never able to avail myself of the wine and cheese, but I can attest to the fact that the rooms are comfortable and quiet, and the location is great, if you want to be in Times Square. I would happily stay here again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My wife and I stayed for three nights in late-July before our cruise and could not have been more pleased with this hotel. It is in a great location for all of the highlights of Times Square, Central Park and is only 5 minutes walk from the nearest Metro station if you wish to travel further afield. All of the staff members were exceptional both on the front desk and in the lounge/dining area. The offer of bottles of cold water was most definitely not only on our arrival at the hotel but on each day when we returned tired and hot after venturing around Manhattan in high humidity. The room did not have much of a view, but was very clean and comfortable for the small amount of time we actually spent in there. Overall, this is a small well run and extremely friendly hotel and one I would recommend to all visitors to New York.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Lovely hotel with excellent staff that make you feel welcome and maintain a personal touch. The location is awesome and we will definitely be staying here again. Our suite was ideal for a family. The staff and management also went out of their way to help us when our arrival was delayed by a day due to an airline cancelling our flight. We are very grateful for this.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I love this hotel because you are in the middle of the action (times square) you can walk to all your broadway theater events but at the same time is not loud and you can have a good rest. People are very nice and the service is great!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: You cant get any better for the price for a NYC hotel. You are in the middle of Time Square and as soon as you enter the building you don't hear a thing. A peaceful oasis in the middle of the crazy. We were there with family and friends and found the lounge/dining area a fabulous place to chill each day and refresh with the amazing assortment of food and drinks on offer - all included. The staff were brilliant at customer service, always ready with a hello and a helpful assistance when needed. The beds and pillows comfortable and the A/C quiet. Robes and take away slippers are in each room ready to make your stay extra special. Perfect place to stay if attending Broadway shows as you are only minutes walk to many shows. Casablanca theming just added fun to our stay.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Everything is great about this hotel! The location makes it easy to walk or take the subway everywhere. The staff is very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. They will give you great restaurant recommendations and even make your reservations.The price is not super cheap, but their breakfast, all-day snacks and drinks, and happy hour really add a lot of value. The service and location cannot be beat! I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to everyone!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We had a wonderful stay. We’ve stayed here several times and they never disappoint. When you return to the hotel after a day or evening out, there is always someone to welcome you home and that's exactly how they make you feel-like you’re home.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We had a wonderful stay at the Casablanca Hotel. We were a family group including grandparents and young children and everyone enjoyed themselves. The staff were welcoming and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. We would definitely recommend to anyone looking for somewhere to stay well located to the main sights in New York. Thankyou.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Casablanca is ideally situated for those visiting NYC for the first time. Staff are friendly and generally very attentive. And the daily cheese and wine evenings are a nice touch. Only gripes during the stay were the lack of toiletries in the bathroom (we had to ask for toilet paper and shampoo) and the fact that my credit card has been charged with a small amount since I left the hotel - I have yet to enquire what these charges are for but I didn’t have any incidental expenses.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The hotel is situated just a few metres from Time Square, in a very quiet and secure surrounding.The whole hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful. You feel like at home, in a very special athmosphere.Many thanks to all of them! We (my wife, our two children and a friend of us) stayed in this hotel for 6 nights and it was our second stay at the Casablanca Hotel. I’m sure, that it woun‘ t be our last stay here. My family and I are looking forward on being here again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We’ve stayed here twice and are heading back in a few months. Location is perfect - close to Times Square, but far enough off the Square to keep the rooms quiet. The staff are attentive, especially the lovely ladies who serve breakfast and afternoon wine & cheese. The rooms are small, but who spends time in their room in NYC? Great place!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great location near Broadway. Perfect place to escape the chaos of NYC in a comfortable environment. Nice breakfast in the morning and wine and cheese in an attractive room every evening. Rooms are small as typical of an older big city hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Very nice hotel, run by very nice people in a great location. Pricey, but aren't all the nice hotels in NYC? Everything needed is close by. Only downside was outside noise, but again, that's going to happen in the city.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I've stayed at the Casablanca a few times. For NYC, the price isn't bad, and there are deals now and then. The last time I visited I was given a Metrocard, a bottle of wine, and a free pizza. My only negative is that the bathroom is tiny, and there's no space to put things on the sink. The airconditioner was very noisy, but otherwise; it was okay. The desk staff has always been very friendly.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed her a over a week and found the hotel to be excellent, clean, and just around the corner from Time Square. The breakfast was very good with the ladies serving very helpful. The best bit is the wine and cheese every night from 5 - 8 pm served in Ricks cafe.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Service is impeccable. Rooms are extremely clean and comfortable. The light breakfast, availability of water/snacks during the day, as well as the evening reception (wine, cheese, vegetables, etc.) are an added value. As many others have mentioned, Casablanca offers a quiet and peaceful respite from the hustle and bustle of the city, even though Times Square is practically next door. Love it!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Very nice hotel with extremely helpful staff. Excellent location for central Manhattan. Pleasant to be offered cheese and wine in the lounge. Only downside was the noisy air conditioning unit in the bedroom but perhaps that drowned out the city noise.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Stayed at this wonderful hotel for 5 nights in August. We reserved direct with hotel a king mini suite. The two kids slept in a double sofa bed in the living area which had sliding wooden doors separating the bedroom. We were allocated room 502 which faced the street. It was a little noisy but didn’t bother us too much as we are early risers. I’d noticed a little speaker that could produce white noise or comforting sounds to distract us from the street noise. The air conditioning was very efficient since outdoor temperatures were over 30oC. There was also a ceiling fan in both areas which we used too. The king bed was so comfortable. As I have back problems I requested a memory foam mattress topper which was amazing. Pillows were delightful. The other requests were already fulfilled on check in. Check in was fast and efficient and we were shown right up to our suite. I had alerted the hotel my youngest daughter has a nut allergy. We found a basket with some Oreos and fig rolls left for her. How thoughtful! Breakfast was from 7am and was a plentiful continental selection. The ladies would toast bagels / bread and make porridge oats for us if requested. They were all so pleasant and efficient!During day, Rick’s cafe on level 2 ( where breakfast is served ) you can also help yourselves to biscuits and hot drinks. At 5pm until 8pm there’s a complimentary cheese and wine there too. We enjoyed a glass of prosecco or two! Kids loved the Apple cider and popcorn and pretzel fish! In the corner of the cafe is a computer and printer which I used to check in and print the boarding passes. Everyday the rooms were cleaned to a high standard. In the evening a small card telling us the next days weather was left along with some lovely chocolates. Location steps away from heart of the action and just round the corner from sun way station. Perfect!On check out day a slightly later check out of 1pm was granted which was much appreciated as our flight was in the evening. We asked on check out if they could help us get a taxi to jfk airport. The lovely young man ( chris? ) was hunting high and low for at least 15 minutes on the street to hail a yellow cab! So helpful and a credit to Casablanca. Next time we visit New York this will always be our first choice! Thank you for a lovely vacation! We will be back!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca is a Boutique hotel right on top of Times Square.The major plus about this hotel, apart from its location, is the staff who are extremely friendly, helpful and polite. Nothing was too much trouble for them. 5* for the staffPros• Croissants, cookies, fruit and beverages are available 24 hours• Breakfast great and included• Right on top of Times Square/42nd Street subway stations• Very quiet rooms• The staff were always friendly and extremely helpful! • Comfortable lounge area• Toiletries suppliedCons• Dated/shabby décor• Rooms very small (based on 3 sharing)• Heating ineffective (Room became very cold at night)Despite the few above cons, the pros would lead me to recommend The Casablanca if you are looking for somewhere to rest your head when in New York.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I have stayed at the Casablanca now twice. I am making it a yearly trip just because of this hotel. I travel often and to many places around the world, as I work overseas. I have never enjoyed a hotel as much as this one. Yes, there are places where I have returned. And of course, places where I would not go back even if you paid me! Casablanca is the FIRST place that I have mentioned over and over to others. Even to people I am just meeting on an airplane. The entire experience is pleasurable. The staff is courteous and solicitous to their patrons. I sleep extremely well as the rooms and beds are comfortable and clean. Amazing hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Stayed for my 50th birthday, lovely hotel, comfortable, clean, central for everything, staff couldn’t do enough for you.The only reason I didn’t give it 5 was because of the noise when trying to sleep, as it’s so close to Times Square you hear everything.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Casablanca is the BEST hotel experience my wife and I have ever had. We can’t say enough good things about it. It has character, the staff is friendly, the staff is helpful, it’s clean, and Rick’s Cafe is the perfect place to relax, unwind, and dine. We can’t wait to come back to NYC and would not consider staying anywhere else.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I celebrated my retirement here, having stayed here last year to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. From the moment you step through the door it is like you are part of the Casablanca Family. The rooms are spacious, clean and tidy, the staff are friendly and helpful, Rick's Café is the best thing ever for relaxing between outings and the location is perfect. Just around the corner from Times Square. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: First of all let me say that this is the best New York Hotel value I've ever had. The staff was incredibly accommodating. One day I came after breakfast was served but they went back in and brought out a special breakfast for me and my daughter. The room was larger than most hotel New York rooms and the location was perfect for going to broadway shows. I will definitely look to stay here again next time I'm in New York city,

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stay at The Casablanca Hotel everytime we visit New York. It's perfectly located, very close to Times Square and the theatre district. All the staff, from senior management to cleaners are very, very friendly and helpful. Nothing is too much trouble!! The Casablanca is a small hotel with lovely rooms and tasteful public areas. Continental style breakfast is plentiful with a wide variety of foods to suit all tastes - breads, cereals, boiled eggs, preserves, juices, coffee, tea and much more. In addition the complimentary wine and nibbles served late afternoon through to early evening are a lovely idea. If you're planning to visit New York and would prefer personal service in a

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Fantastic hotel in a great location just thirty seconds from Times Square. The staff were very friendly & helpful & the inclusive contential breakfast & evening cheese & wine was a wonderful added bonus.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: By far, this has been my best hotel experience ever in NYC. Every single staff member I interacted with was incredibly pleasant and helpful. My room was super-clean and bigger than I thought it would be -- especially for Midtown. Plus, it was QUIET (interior room), which was remarkable, given that it's literally about 50 feet off Times Square. Add free breakfast goodies (pastries, bagels, cereals, coffee and juices, etc.) in the morning and complimentary wine and cheese at night, and you have a hotel that's setting a new bar for hospitality. My wife and I even found a complimentary bottle of wine in our room when we arrived. I loved everything about my stay at the Casablanca and look forward to returning soon.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We were in NYC for a six day theatre trip and absolutely loved The Casablanca! Incredible service, impeccably clean rooms, great location. We loved the continental breakfast and the wine and munchies happy hour. We will always stay here! This is a small property and they knew us by our first names! Loved it! Top quality accommodations at affordable prices. The decor is charming and quaint.... and the bed was incredibly comfortable.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our NYC adventure. Even before arriving the staff was very helpful and responsive to inquiries. Everyone seemed to know and recognize us which added to the sense of being at home. I highly recommend this and look forward to going back.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Perfect in every way, afternoon tea and snacks. Location and price can't be beat. Customer service was exceptional greeted every time we came through the door of the lobby. Complimentary water offered . Room was spotless couldn't ask for anymore. Will not stay anywhere else in NYC.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I highly recommend this boutique Times Square hotel. The location can't be beat for convenience, and yet the room I was in was very quiet. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great, as was the wine and cheese reception form 5:00-8:00. And having a piece of fruit and cookies available all day was just great. The room I had was not large but it worked very well for me and was very comfortable.Th

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We have stayed at this hotel several times. The staff is always top of the line. Everyone has always gone above and beyond to ensure we had the best stay possible. The staff is incredibly helpful arranging car service, recommending restaurants or transportation option to fit your needs. The rooms have always been spotless as are all the other areas of the hotel. We cannot day enough about the friendliness and professionalism of the hotel staff. We look forward to many stays in the future.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I initially chose this hotel because I could not find a single bad review of it, unlike all of the larger "name" chain hotels in the Times Square area. I will absolutely, positively stay here, or at one of the hotels in the group, on every future trip to NYC - I loved it that much!The front desk and housekeeping staff are wonderfully friendly and helpful! They have a DVD library - each night we checked out a movie for the room. Also, evening turn-down service and chocolates on your pillow. :)The rooms vary a bit in size depending on location, as do the en suite tiled bathrooms with tubs. 2 of our queen bed rooms were a very nice size for NYC and 1 queen bed room (next to the elevator) was a little smallish for a couple, but fine for single traveler. The bath products were lovely.The no-charge extras a traveler can ask for (according to the menu next to the bed) range from razors and toothpaste to a mini-fridge, fan, and white-noise machine. There's a little coffee maker in each room, which we never used, because coffee, tea, water, cookies, etc. were available to us 24/7 in "Rick's Cafe" - basically our "extended living room" on the 2nd floor.Rick's Cafe: A mostly self-serve continental breakfast of bagels, toast, danish, croissants and spreads, yogurt, fruit, cereal, milk, soy milk, juices, hard-boiled eggs, coffee, tea, espresso, and hot chocolate is served until 10 each morning. Wine, cheese, crackers, veggies, and cookies are served from 5-8 each evening. Friday evenings there's a piano player!We loved our stay and can't wait to return!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My friend and I stayed three nights as a stop-over from CA to Europe. The staff made it their mission to accommodate our every need. They helped with directions, arranged transportation for us and provided a quiet, restful reprieve in a very busy city. The location was perfect. We walked to Rockefeller Center. What a marvelous stay we had! Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great hotel.Great staff.Loved it.Nothing was too much bother, the cheese and wine early evening was a nice touch.Time Square is Leighton on the door step.We never tried Toni’s next door but it was packed every night.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: What a fabulous stay we had! I had high expectations, based on the reviews, and The Casablanca Hotel definitely lived up to its reputation!The service was impeccable, from the doormen and front desk staff who always greeted us with big smiles and questions about our days, to the wonderful Rick's Cafe staff, to the Housekeeping staff who kept our wine bucket constantly filled with ice and the room immaculate.Our room faced 43rd street, and we definitely heard street noise, especially the garbage trucks early every morning. Next time we would request a room overlooking the courtyard, but it absolutely did not tip my overall review below 5 stars.Such a feeling of peace overtook us every time we turned off of Broadway in Times Square, and saw our little oasis just ahead. We were lucky enough to see 4 plays during our stay, and were easily able to walk to all of them. It was an easy subway ride to visit Ground Zero, as well as Battery Park for our Statue of Liberty tour. We even walked to and from Central Park. You could not ask for a better location when visiting Manhattan.I absolutely love this hotel and can't wait to return!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The is a boutique hotel less than a block from Times Square with a great diner a door down (The Original Brooklyn Diner) Tony's di Napoli attatched to the hotel and several other good restaurants on the same block. In the Times Square area the chain now seems supreme but here is this fine property with nice size rooms and bathrooms, friendly, attentive staff, and reasonable rates. I like quirky hotels with character, and this hotel oozes character. Library with free snacks and drinks add to its value. Videos and books are available if "The City That Never Sleeps" doesn't have enough action. One thing I would like to know, since this hotel previously was known by other names, do pictures exist of it during other phases of its existence?

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca Hotel is in a great location, just a few yards from the hustle and bustle of Times Square, and yet inside is a calm, quiet and comfortable oasis. Excellent staff who will go out of their way to help you, and the wine and cheese each evening is a real treat.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This was our 7th visit to the hotel but this time with our daughter, son in law and three young grandsons. Great with kids, fantastic value for money, close to all amenities, great clean rooms and staff who genuinely care and make you feel that you have actually came home. We would never stay anywhere else when we visit NYC and would strongly recommend that you don't either. All the staff are absolutely wonderful and our daughter and son law have not stopped talking about their first visit to the Casablanca and how wonderful all staff were with the boys. I know that they will go back one day and recommend the hotel to their friends. We have stayed in all types of rooms and everyone of them have been superior in value an ambience. As for us we WILL be back for an 8th visit and not just because we love NYC but also because we know we will always receive the best experience possible at this wonderful hotel and I think the number of times we have stayed speaks volumes. I promise you will not be disappointed in how all the staff make you feel as they do as I said previously care about all their visitors and their General Manager John is clearly a huge influence on why the staff are professional and love their jobs. John the is also so approachable - now where else would you get a GM being like that and even there to open the door for you. Trust me stay at the Casablanca Hotel and you'll want to go back over and over again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: What a lovely place we had very good time there it wasn’t long enough but we be back for sure looking to comeback soon but would be at least 2 week so we can enjoy the rest of the place food was amazing really love it

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Oasis just off Times Square. 2nd floor lounge makes it! (Cappuccino, fancy water, light snacks available 24 hours in addition to breakfast and wind/cheese reception in the evening). fJust understand it's an old building: window a/c, well done but blower.wind noise; small rooms; very small bathroom. Clean. Staff knowledgeable, friendly, courteous.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Thank you, Thank you,Thank you! From the moment we booked we were so very pleased. Everyone was so helpful and kind making us feel like we were the most important people there. That's a nice feeling in such a big city with so many people. My family and I would highly recommend this hotel and we would stay again!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: great location. great service. wonderful boutique hotel in the heart of Times Square. Loved the breakfast and the cocktail hour. The hotel staff sent an email prior to arrival asking if they could be of assistance with anything. We booked our car service to and from the airport through the hotel which was prompt and courteous.Would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The one bedroom suite was perfect for three, the service impeccable and the wine time so relaxing. Also a great location next to Times Square with good restaurants next door. We would highly recommend it to all NYC tourists.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Fantastic position literally a few steps from Times Square and so centrally located too for visiting so much of the city-we walked everywhere. So many of the theatres were just a short distance away returning at night was easy. All of the staff were friendly and so helpful. Breakfast was adequate and dining lounge large enough to accommodate guests. Room had no outlook but we only slept there. Air conditioner was quite noisy but there was a heat wave while we were there and it was working flat out. Room was large enough to accommodate us and lots of luggage. We would highly recommend this hotel and would love to return.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: we wanted a boutique hotel in the heart of NYC activity, and this is perfect! We were able to walk to everything we wanted to do, rooms were spacious, staff was suberb. An added bonus is happy hour from 5-7 each night and a great breakfast from 7-10 every morning. Would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is now the third time we have stayed at the Casablanca Hotel, Times Square. Quite honestly, it is simply the most exquisite small boutique hotel we have ever stayed.It is located literally 50 steps away from the chaos, brilliance and madness of Times Square, but don’t let that put you off, it’s location is absolutely perfect and the moment you step through its doors you are transformed and transported to an oasis of utter calmness, serenity and good old fashioned friendliness by the brilliant staff whether that is the staff at the front desk wishing you a warm welcome back, the staff serving you cheese and wine in the afternoons which is more than welcome after walking the mean streets of New York and even the cleaners who are absolutely top notch.We don’t visit New York very often, but honestly this place cannot be beaten.Ok, you may get a hotel with larger boring corporate bedrooms or even a swanky rooftop bar giving you stunning views over the Big Apple, but I guarantee they will not be able to touch the Casablanca for their simple personal touch.Ok that’s enough now. However, please don’t visit it, we want to keep it for ourselves but it will be your loss if you don’t try it. We simply love the place and can not wait to receive that warm welcome back once again.
user_name:
mitchy935
Bury St. Edmunds, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The hotel had great service and the location was fantastic. My husband and I walked everywhere. We used the wine and cheese hour every night which cut down on costs for going out later that night. The staff was very accommodating and extremely attentive!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Textbook boutique hotel. What an incredible oasis smack on Times Square. Staff is amazing. Room was amazing. Amenities are amazing. We’ll be back! I can’t say enough good things about this place. Worth every penny.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great hotel and staff; like I previously said: HOME AWAY FROM HOME! I was really satisfied being able to enjoy the hospitality of the Casablanca Hotel; overall, I was thrilled with the service founded...

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My sister and I have been to all the NYC Library Hotels, and the Casablanca was the last one for us to visit. The happy hour and complimentary breakfast are always a favorite. The room was nice, this was the first time we got two beds- Wonderful! I am not a big Times Square fan, so the driving to the hotel was a little scary, but the parking was right next door, and it was only $30- A bargain for parking in NYC, A great experience all around,
user_name:
Kathy F
Sugar Loaf, New York

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We go to NYC few times a year. This was our first time staying at the Casablanca - located steps from Times Square. We had stayed at their sister hotel from the Library Collection in Prague which was amazing. The personal service from all the staff we received, the cleanliness of the property, the breakfast/lounge area was wonderful. I'm not a great fan of NYC. Sorry. I love the entertainment and options. When we return I will always choose this hotel to make our stay easy and pleasant.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This small and stylish hotel is very conveniently located a few meters from Times Square in the centre of Manhattan. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are nice, not modern, but this gives the place its special touch. The hotel’s theme is (as the name suggests) Mediterranean/ North African and there are references to the famous movie everywhere.Free WiFi and a tasty breakfast are included in the room rate as is a ‘wine and cheese’ event every afternoon. Certain amenities (like a fridge) have to asked for but are the provided immediately. Altogether, this was a very pleasant stay at a great location. Do book the airport transfer via the hotel desk as this was very cheap and reliable!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Spent two weeks this July in NYC predominantly as guide for my sis & husband on first time trip there. This trip marked my 8th visit to Big Apple. Casablanca far and away best place I have encountered. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Brilliant hotel and location. So close toTimes Square where all the action happens. Shopping is amazing and everybody is so friendly. Try the tours on the open top buses. Very informative if you haven’t been to New York before.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The front desk staff is always very helpful, kind and generous to my daughter. At breakfast, they always accommodate my food allergies. We had a pleasant surprise on Friday evening, when we found a pianist playing in the dining area. My daughter and I enjoyed a semi-private dinner with music. We were upgraded rooms after I expressed an interest in staying an extra day. Housekeeping staff was kind and courteous.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel is a hidden gem. By far one of the best hotel stays I have had in a long time. Excellent staff and service; nice amenities, convenient location, and just an all around very positive New York experience. We will surely be back.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Casablanca offer exceptional service at an unbeatable location! A true gem just steps from Times Square, the superb staff members are accommodating to all your needs from complimentary umbrellas to restaurant recommendations to extra toiletries. Rick’s Cafe has complimentary continental breakfast with plenty of variety, fruit and snacks all day, and a wonderful assortment of cheeses and wine every evening. It feels like an extended living room! The rooms are small but clean, well maintained and very comfortable. I will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My wife and I visited the Casablanca eight years ago and decided if we were returning to NY then we would return to the Casablanca. Our return visit fully lived up to our expectations. The standard of both the service and facilities have been maintained over the years and ensured that we had yet another excellent experience.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We have been visiting NYC for ages and this is by far our favorite place to stay. The staff is very friendly, the happy hour is terrific and breakfast is a treat. The ability to get food or drink delivered to your room from a choice of restaurants was a real plus. We can’t wait to return!!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I wish that I had found the Casablanca Hotel years ago! The rooms are well furnished, clean and immaculately maintained, the decor unique, the staff are amazing, the breakfast is terrific, the location is close to Times Square and you can't beat the free wine and cheese! The best thing of all was how quiet and peaceful the hotel is given its proximity to Times Square. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights and I can’t say enough positive things about this place. The staff is so incredible and very willing to help with any requests. The rooms are super clean and the beds are really comfortable. Don’t let the wall AC deter you from staying here - it was actually good because it helped with the noise from outside. The air worked great and the room was very cool during my stay. The bathrooms are beautiful and immaculate. Good water pressure and hot temperature in the shower. Rick’s Cafe on the 2nd floor was such a nice place to sit and have complimentary tea and coffee and it’s open 24x7. Very spacious with a small courtyard off to one side. Rick’s also has light breakfast available as well as fruit and water for guests to grab anytime. My stay here was phenomenal. I travel for work constantly and a Platinum and Diamond member of two different hotel chains. I’m SO glad I ventured outside of those chains to enjoy the Casablanca. What a lovely hotel - I will definitely return. Truly a great time and you can’t beat the Times Square location.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Wonderful hotel in the heart of Times Square. Easy access to everything! This hotel does a great job of removing you from the hustle and bustle. Attentive staff, clean accommodations, large bathroom, fantastic 24/7 snacks, wine reception, and breakfast. Very affordable as well. We will stay here again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We recently spent four nights at the Casablanca Hotel for a family celebration. From my first communication online prior to arrival (asking about car service pick up, show tickets, etc.) to our parting moments, the service staff was stellar. This is far and away the friendliest and most accommodating staff I have ever encountered at a hotel of this size. From front desk to housekeeping- all were congenial and happy to satisfy any requests and answer questions. The cleanliness of the hotel was topnotch, and the amenities are generous! : Wine and water waiting for us in our rooms, a 3-hour wine and cheese evening break, great breakfast offerings including a legit commercial espresso machine and coffee which was accessible 24/7. The rooms we stayed in were small, but we spent so little time in them it was of no consequence (hey-if you are spending a lot of time in your room, you are not seeing NYC!) and the lounge area, "Rick's," is open all the time so you can choose to read or relax with a glass of wine or coffee there whenever you like. Casablanca is located a block off the madness of Broadway Times Square, but a half hour walk will get you to Central Park for a breather from the crowds! And you are a ten-minute walk, give or take, from the theaters and many restaurants. I highly recommend this hotel, which offers a wonderful experience at a most affordable price. From here on out, I will only be staying at properties owned and managed by the Library Hotel company when in NYC-we are already planning our return trip for next year. Casablanca is excellent in every aspect! Stay here!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: After reading hundreds of reviews, we booked two rooms at the Casablanca for our family vacation! It truly lived up to its reputation! The customer service was outstanding! The continental breakfast and afternoon wine/cheese set-up was wonderful. As mentioned in many other reviews, the location is unbelievable. Perfect location for anyone attending a show or anyone hoping to be close to Times Square. We all appreciated the supply of water bottles daily. The front desk was very helpful with all of our questions and patient with us as we tried to learn the area and the locations we wanted to visit. Many thanks to the team at Casablanca. We look forward to staying in your hotel again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Our sister-in-law stayed for a night on a previous visit to NYC and recommended Casablanca to us for our first holiday to New York. Although the cost is on the high side, it was money well spent and worth every penny. It is perfectly positioned, right next to Times Square but, once inside the hotel, you are completely cocooned from the noise and drama. Staff are of the highest standard, helpful and friendly, and just can't do enough for you. We won't stay anywhere else when we return.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Very nice place. Frank at the front desk was great. The second floor café is a good spot to relax. The AC was a little tricky to figure out but that may say more about me than the AC. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great place to stay if your looking for a wonderful Mid-town location in NYC. Literally steps away from Time Square. Hotel was clean and offered nice amenities. John the GM was very nice and attentive as were all his employees. Bed was super comfortable. I look forward to a return visit.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Such an oasis and haven of calm in a busy city. So civilised to be able to call in to Ricks Place for iced water, other refreshments and a quiet sit down. Thank you for making me feel so welcome, your hotel, staff and service are beyond compare, I shall definitely recommend you and when I return to NYC I will book your hotel again. Thank you so very much for making my stay such a pleasant one.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We loved every second of our stay at the Casablanca. The stafff were so warm and inviting. The room was very comfortable. The lounge facilities were amazing and we also got to meet some lovely people during breakfast and afternoon tea. The location is superb, close to all the action in New York and yet once you step inside the hotel it is quiet and calm, a haven from all the hustle and bustle.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca was beautiful when we first stayed there 16 years ago and is still beautiful so many years later. It is lovely and private and located just steps away from Times Square. We love it and hope to return soon!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Super hotel right next to Times square but the hotel was very quiet nice to relax away from the hustle and bustle. the staff are extremely friendly and helpful, and the nightly wine and nibbles a nice treat. Really enjoyed staying at the Casablanca and wouldn't have a problem recommending it.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Stayed at the Casablanca during a visit to NYC. Location is right in the theater district and close to many tourist spots. Subway is just around the corner to get you anywhere else in the city. Rooms are Manhattan size (meaning a little small) but very comfortable. Hotel staff were fantastic. They offer a great breakfast and tea/coffee/wine and light snacks in the evening. I highly recommend the Casablanca.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Perfect location. Easily walked to all the major sites. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Great value for the money. Hotel offered daily breakfast and wine reception. Nice touch. Not a large hotel but that's how they make you feel special.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The hotel is a gem, stayed for 3 nights and then the hotel looked after our luggage after returning from our cruise for the day. The hotel staff were amazing ( sorry about Spain losing Victor). From the moment you walked in they couldn’t do enough for you. Breakfast was fab and had everything to set you up for the day. Coffee and water available all day and cheese and wine in the afternoon was an amazing touch. The bedroom and bathroom were immaculate and we’ve stayed in the Waldorf Astoria a couple of times and this by far exceeds that. Free toiletries, ear plugs (we are used to birds waking us up) replenished constantly. Few steps from Time Square and a lovely restaurant next door Tony’s was lovely too. It’s that good we’ve booked already to come in December 18. Thank you Hotel Casablanca.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Stayed at the Casablanca for five nights in June , we were a party of four so had two bedrooms which were both very nice and kept clean by the wonderful housekeeping team.The hotel is just a stones throw from the hustle and bustle of Times Square but once you step over the door way you enter a peaceful and tranquil hotel. The staff are both helpful and attentive and very pleasant. The free continental breakfast and the evening cheese and wine are a great bonus.I would highly recommend the Casablanca to anyone who is visiting New York.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Thank you for making our trip to New York City very enjoyable. We had a great time with our friends. Being so close to Times Square was very nice. The staff were amazing. They were always helpful, fun and courtesy. Highly recommend The Cassablanca!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A cozy little hotel steps away from Times Square. Friendly staff and a very nice decor. Next to restaurants and shops but quiet and peaceful. The breakfast is so good I never even thought of going anywhere else and from 5-8 they serve cheese and wine. Awesome!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This was my second stay at the Casablanca Hotel and it was as charming as the first. This location is perfect for walking to nearby restaurants and theaters. Happily, they still have a discounted rate for parking at the garage next door ( Meyers Parking) - don't forget to get your parking ticket validated at the front desk when checking out. The rooms are just a little bit pricey, but the amenities like the wine and cheese, complimentary breakfast ,and 24 hour beverages and snacks make it worthwhile. We'll be back!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Book early,best of the best, great value,heart of Manhatten. Maps. train , fun food right next door is fabulous.you can count on your room being very clean. They also have a little cafe on the 2nd floor with great snacks,breakfast, happy hour.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A little gem of a hotel right off Times Square. It is a perfect location to take in Broadway plays, especially for a solo traveler. The wine and cheese and morning espresso are nice touches. The staff is always friendly. This was my third stay!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: What a fabulous hotel yes it appears to be a little dated but it has charm it is spotless the staff are wonderful so helpful friendly and cheerful nothing is too much trouble the room is went equipped and fabulous to have air conditioning. Would highly recommend anyone to try it

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca is the best place to stay in Times Square. 15 steps to Times Square, but just far away enough for peace and quiet. The staff is absolutely the best I have ever seen in a hotel. Friendly, helpful, and courteous. They made our stay great. Because of the heatwave, staff provided us with plenty of water. Breakfast was simple and good. Coffee and snacks available all day. The wine and cheese hour fun. I will never stay any place else in NYC. Rooms were extremely clean and well maintained. Plenty of in room DVDs for a break from the heat.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great hotel-check. Clean-check. Awesome, friendly, outstanding staff-double check.Great location, you go it. This is our second stay with Casablanca,and we wouldn’t hesitate to stay again. Free wifi, breakfast and wine in the evening.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Was searching for nice, reasonably priced hotel near Times Square and Casablanca more than met our needs! Once inside, you don't know you are right off the mayhem of Broadway. Beautiful interiors, pleasant staff, and the lounge/breaksfast area was a huge bonus! But then again, I should have known, as it is a Library Hotel property.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We enjoyed a great visit to New York. All of our prior requests were met. Staff extremely friendly, great location, lovely rooms and facilities. We found the lounge with breakfast and early evening wine was great and when returning to the hotel later at night it was lovely to be able to get refreshments then. This was our second visit and we WILL be back!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: There are a few hotels close by that might cost a little less, but you get so much value for the money at Casablanca. There is a continental breakfast, snacks and refreshments available during the day, and wine and cheese at night. Plus a pass to a nearby gym and bottled water. And the location is so convenient if you are seeing shows near Times Square. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great staff who always make me feel like I’m home. I stay so often, it pretty much is. Great service. Comfortable rooms. Small so that there is never a delay for anything. Every attention to detail is made and done professionally.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Firstly the people: it would be invidious to single out one person as each and everyone we came in contact with was welcoming and the personification of Customer Service. Then the atmosphere: small, personal and oozing charm (it’s a building of a certain age but that just adds to it’s individuality). Next Rick’s Cafe’, open 24/7 with refreshments on tap. Breakfast and 5pm wine and cheese are gratis and I sampled some of the best Californian Chardonnay I’ve ever had. Finally the location: on the corner of W43rd St and Broadway so everywhere is walkable.The phrase you hear most here is “ this is your home from home” and these are not empty words at The Casablanca - everything they do demonstrates this.Thank you to everyone - I wish we’d had more than two nights with you.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Staff top notch. Close to Broadway shows. But other than that, don’t bother. Bed and pillows not good. Still uses window air conditioner so tough to control room temperature. Too few electrical outlets.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I dont think I have ever posted on TripAdvisor despite using it for several years but I couldn't be silent and not give this hotel a 5 star review. From being welcomed with my wife and two kids after a very hot and tiring day with bottles of water and stuffed animals for my boys to the cupcakes and apple cider they arranged in the room for my son's birthday to the great happy hour and breakfast this hotel was top notch. It is right in the heart of Times Square but it was extremely quiet, spacious for New York, clean, and comfortable. Based on how quiet the room was I couldnt believe that I could walk 10 feet outside and be in the middle of Times Square. WOW. Highly recommended for a family or just a couple looking for a NYC getaway. We stayed in the room that had an attached living room with a couch that converted to a bed. Fantastic Property!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We always stay at the Casablanca for our annual Broadway shows trip. It is convenient, consistent, clean, attentive and charming. Breakfast and happy hour make the stay uniquely special. The rate is also very good for the area.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My mum and I loved our stay here. The location was convenient, the staff were so friendly and helpful and our room was very clean. The breakfast had a lot of options and the wine and cheese evening was refreshing after a day of sightseeing

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Our favorite hotel near Times Square. Easy access to public transportation and to all the shows/venues. Lovely rooms, great room with tables, newspapers TV and a la carte food is a definite plus. Staff is extremely helpful.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Simply outstanding. Part of me wants to give a terrible review, just to fend off what will only continue to be a growing backlog of reservations, but that wouldn't be right... I've stayed in a lot of midtown hotels and this is my new go-to. We brought our girls (12 & 9) for their first time in NY and we weren't disappointed. This is the hotel you wish every other hotel could be. Service is outstanding and the vibe is so relaxed, despite being 100ft from the chaos of Times Square. From the front desk to housekeeping to the girls in Rick's cafe, the level of service is beyond reproach. Can't wait to come back.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for 5 days. Every member of staff was helpful and friendly. It was like being welcomed to somebody's home. Every moment was made comfortable, relaxed and enjoyable. Coming back after long day in the City was like entering an oasis of peace and calm. The cheese and wine afternoons set you up for the evening to go out into the affray of the Big Apple. There is nothing about this hotel that isn't excellent. From the service to the amenities, the peaceful ambience and the sheer friendliness of the place. We are definitely going back !!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Dmitri, Jeffery, Christian, Juan Carlos, Frank, John, the ladies in Rick's Cafe, and every other single person we encountered on staff. I'm sorry I forgot some names, especially because they always remembered mine. They sought out opportunities to go above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable. Eager to engage and share what they love about their city. The hotel and amenities were great - can't say enough about Rick's Cafe, but what really blew us away were the people.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Booked as part of trip to Virginia on return to NYC. Excellent location in Times Square. Close to theatres. Near Hop on Hop off Bus Center. Picked up NY Pass there also. 15 min walk to Empire State & 15 min to Central Park.  They offer a good breakfast with juices, cereals, fresh cut fruit, pastries, bagels, an espresso machine, regular coffee and on. Afternoon/evening wines and cheese etc. Very friendly reception and doormen. 99 degrees when we were there. We got ice cold water bottles when we walked through the door. Associated with Tony De Napoli next door. Got us in early so we could get to our show. Lion King was less than 10 min away. Be aware, room rates can vary by day. If you book through a service, you may get an averaged rate. It on the Times Sq area so it’s noisy outside. Rooms ac is not central air. So it’s a little noisy and cycled off/on. But really the only small complaint. No exhaust in the bathroom but wasn’t a real issue. On the whole a good stay. Not pushy on anything. Very attentive. Elevator small but functional. WIFI worked well. Beds were comfortableWill have to find our way back

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: If you are going to NYC for Broadway shows this is the perfect place to stay. Small (45 rooms) but convenient to the theatre district, MOMA, Grand Central Terminal and Rockefeller Center. The rooms are clean and spacious. The staff though is OUTSTANDING. Everyone goes out of their way to make your stay the best ever.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is a little gem right in the thick of it. We chose a queen bedded room which faced the back courtyard so it was comfortable and surprisingly quiet. The wine and cheese offerings were great before we headed off for a broadway show, and on our return quite late in the evening we were able to help ourselves to coffee, tea and a snack in the same lounge. The staff were pleasant and friendly and overall this was a great location to spend some time in New York City.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Really nice hotel with an amazing location. The room was comfortable and the Lounge with complimentary tea, coffee and snacks was comfortable and very welcome. Staff were friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: As always, the women and men that work the Casablanca are the best. All of them! They all exude humanity and warmth. What a great team! The moment you get inside the Casablanca is like entering a peaceful oasis from the excitement that is NYC. You feel safe. There is an entrance where the welcoming faces of managers and porters greet you. No big lobby. If you are there is because you are staying there. In the second floor is a cafe and sitting room with newspapers and computer. Mornings you'll find breads, cheeses, fresh fruits, juices and coffees and teas; evenings: wine, cheese, crudités, etc. Always tended by friendly and attentive faces.... all is included in what you pay. Even the bottled water. As I always say if you are looking for great views of the city and the ultimate in architecture, this is not the place for you. If you are looking for a clean and safe atmosphere close to all the Broadway shows and with one of the best team working in a hotel, this boutique hotel is for you.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: It was a joy to be a guest in this hotel. Location is fantastic--walk to every theater and shopping you want! The rooms are immaculate, comfortable with charming furnishings and exceptionally comfortable beds.The breakfast room and lounge on 2nd floor is a wonderful, friendly, well appointed oasis for your morning complimentary breakfast or relaxation and conversation over wine and cheese.This is great, but the staff are unmatched. European charm with American efficiency. All this leads to fellow guests who are discerning travellers who appreciate the surroundings. I will never stay at any other NYC hotel !!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: such a gem in the big Apple. staff are amazing. the cheese and wine is great and Tony's serves up a great selection of Italian foods. great central location just off of times square. will always be our first choice in new York

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Great Small Hotel for visiting central New York just off Times Square The staff were extremely attentive they could not do enough for you We liked the old fashion decor and overall appearance of the Hotel. The hotel room 603 was small and rather noisy unfortunately due to the busy location with rather a lot going on all night also if you needed the Air con on you had to open the window which did not help The afternoon Tea was excellent in a very relaxing lounge area that doubled up as breakfast room in the morning.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We had a great experience at Casablanca Hotel. We booked our room months prior to our stay and got personalized messages from that time until our stay to arrange our accommodations. Brian was very helpful prior to our stay checking in with us, getting our flight information, arranging our car service, and dinner reservations before we arrived. Our flight times were changed and we ended up arriving at 11 am on our first day. Our flight did not leave until 5 pm on our date of departure. The hotel was extremely accommodating and allowed us to check in early and check out late. The room was great and was really comfortable and welcoming. The whole hotel was charming. I saw some posts before I arrived about noise, but that was not our experience at all. We had a court-side room and it was so quiet and perfectly dark in the mornings that we had to set an alarm to wake up....which is a GOOD thing. It was worth the price. The service, staff, and accommodations were exceptional. It was so close to everything...just a few steps from Times Square but also close to everything else. We walked everywhere in midtown.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Excellent little hotel. Chosen because it was little, asked for low floor and got it.Clean rooms.Lots of towels.Excellent continental breakfast.Hot drinks, fruit biscuits/available all day.Wine and cheese reception was amazing , Loved it , nice chilled start to an evening.Would return if in NYC again.Restaurants a few steps away. In the theatre area. Shopping around the corner.Close to Big Bus tour stops.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The service from the staff was exceptional from moment we checked in till the moment we checked out. Every member of staff went above and beyond and made our stay in New York special and memorable. The complimentary breakfast/snack/cheese & wine is an absolute treat.Thank you so much.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Next door neighbor to the theatre district and every restaurant on your list. The hidden gem is Rick's Cafe. 20 plus year customer and have loved every visit. Next door to Tony's makes a late night snack so easy to have. When they open the door for you and welcome you home, it really feels that way.
user_name:
martym992018
New Hyde Park, New York

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: you won't find a better value in the area. the staff is top notch - knowledgeable, accomodating, and cordial. the rooms are large for nyc, love the decor, continental breakfast & happy hour included, tons of ameneties... stellar!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: 100 metres from busy Times Square is this oasis of calm. This was our second stay and our expectations were exceeded again. From the breakfast through to “happy hour” the staff were very attentive. Thank you team Casablanca!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We visited the Casablanca Hotel for the second time to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. We were greeted at the front desk with an anniversary congratulations and when we arrived in our room there was a complimentary bottle of wine and a lovely note of congratulations on our anniversary. The concierge and front desk staff were extremely helpful in securing restaurant reservations, hailing cabs and providing directions - all with a smile. The Casablanca serves breakfast every morning in Rick's Cafe. Once again the staff here were always cheerful and helpful. In the morning my spouse would come down to Rick's for a breakfast tray of hot coffee and pastries to bring back to our room. During the day there are light refreshments available and in the evening there is a wine and cheese reception. The Casablanca Hotel s an oasis from the busy New York streets. I would look forward to returning here for a little solitude! The Casablanca is a few steps from busy Times Square but the atmosphere is quiet and restful.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Have stayed here before I knew what to expect. It was another great visit. The only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is that is was much more expensive than the last time we stayed there. The bed was very comfortable and I love having access to tea or coffee all day.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This was our second time to stay at Casablanca Hotel. Just as pleased with second visit as our first visit. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. The location is convenient to go uptown or downtown. We walked to the theater twice and to many sites. They offer a nice breakfast and afternoon snacks and drinks that are helpful when traveling with children.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: my husband and i stayed here for our honeymoon and they went above and beyond to make sure it was a wonderful experience! we rented casablanca and ordered the romantic rondeveux package and it was so lovely! the next morning we had coffee and cookies in Rick's Cafe and played tick tac toe (they have a few games) and looked at the picture books, it was such a peaceful oasis from the crazy new york city pace of life.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Staying at the Casablanca Hotel was such a pleasant experience! I believe it may have been the friendliest and most welcoming staff I've ever encountered. The hotel decor was warm and inviting. The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. Did I mention we were just steps away from Time Square! Tony DiNapoli's Italian restaurant was right next door which made it convenient for a visit to the bar at the end of a long day walking around the city. We would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Once you have stayed at the Casablanca you will never want to stay anywhere else. We go back every year. We have probably stayed here at least nine times and plan on continuing to come back. We have encouraged all our friends to stay here when travelling to New York.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We love this little gem. One in our party is an anxious traveler and Casa Blanca takes all that anxiety away. Quiet and convenient. Charmed by the decor and the friendliness of the staff. We have stayed twice and we will be back!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: No matter how busy we were ; no matter how tired we were at the end of the day, we always felt welcomed and refreshed at Casablanca! The staff was very friendly, attentive and helpful AT ALL times! We'll go there again without a doubt!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I have stayed here twice now and I have no regrets are returning. We love the theme of the hotel, great location just round the corner from Times Square and in the centre of theatreland. The staff are very nice and helpful. The breakfast and evening drinks and canapes are a great addition.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Absolutely will always stay at the Casablanca when in New York. The location to plays is great. It allows you to walk to your destinations without worrying about a taxi. The restaurants in the area are excellent.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Excellent in every way! The second floor living and eating space for guests is a brilliant idea! (Complimentary wine and cheese, breakfast! )Snacks, coffee and tea available there 24 hours. Neat way to meet people! I can't say enough about this gem! I will definitely stay again!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The location is fantastic, the staff are polite and helpful, the room with coffee and pastries is nice, (though the pastries are pretty stale late at night - not really a surprise, but at this level, one might expect they'd do better), good Continental breakfast (I tired of lack of eggs, other than hard-boiled, though), nice and spacious bathroom. As the #1 rated hotel in NYC, my expectations were probably unrealistic, but I have stayed in less expensive hotels and had a better overall experience. In particular, the room was on the small side, and there was construction outside that was so loud one night that I could not sleep. Also, small window with no real view.
