It is a nice hotel, and it's great to have good service and a doorman who knows you - much more personal than other hotels I've stayed in, but for the lower price, I'd probably go to Citizen M or Grand Hyatt instead next time. I may give another try, because of personal service and perfect location, if I can get a good price and be guaranteed a quiet room.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Everything was great. Employees fabulous and helpful. From breakfast to cocktails nothing could be improved on. Room was very comfortable for two women. Restaurant recommendations were right onAlways getting our cabs for us and watching out for us

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I booked.this boutique hotel based on the 5* rating & online reviews for excellent service & it did not disappoint! It offered the signature New York experience in every way for our family as 3 generations celebrated my mother’s 90th birthday!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Stayed overnight to see Springsteen on Broadway. Service was excellent, could not be happier, My wife loved the theme decoration and ambiance. I'll defer to her, though I though it a bit overdone and tacky.Great room overall, but a few issues.1. Could never get the AC to regulate at a consistent temperature,Window units were either blowing like a cyclone ar the room was stifling.2. No exhaust fan in bathrooms.3. The elevator was scary - almost a thrill ride. Gears grinding, abrupt stops and starts.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Firstly the team here are the friendliest people in NYC. Everything is always clean , nothing is ever a problem. This is my first choice every trip ( if you can get a room) You can’t believe how quiet it is when you walk in the door beyond the mayhem of Times Square. It is lovely to have a sitting area indoors with snacks available. Truly peaceful when you need some down time even at 2am if you are wide awake .

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed here in early May for my daughters sweet 16 celebration. It was a great hotel, especially for the first time to NYC for my mom, daughter and me. It caught my eye because of the smaller atmosphere that we wanted. (We're from the mid-west...we like to be close to the ground, I guess-haha!) The breakfast they offer is more than continental. There were many choices and always fresh cut fruit that looked good! The coffee machine was a great perk and it is just as represented in the pics. We loved being able to have snacks and wine in the evenings. We ate late lunches while there, so it worked perfect for us to just have that later on. Actually snacks/coffee/water were available all day long. Our room was perfect for 3 with the living room area and pull out bed. We asked for handles to be added to the bathroom for my mom for stability and they came right away to add one more, and make adjustments for her. It worked well. We wore our slippers, they gave us, in the room all the time! Very fun! Very nice place, with plenty of extras to make it a perfect home-base for visiting NYC. If we ever go back, we'd stay there again. Worth the extra.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Casablanca hotel is in a great location. Just steps away from Times Square. The rooms look a little dated, but still very nice and clean. The noise from the street at night was loud at times. So make sure and use the white noise machine they provide. It worked great to blockout the street noise. The service and staff were very helpful.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Loved staying at this hotel! Asked for and got a quiet room. Sacrifice some ambient light but a good night sleep near time square worth it. A special convenience of continental breakfast (fresh cut fruit, pastrys, toasted breads and bagels, juice, coffee) and complimentary wine and cheese daily (crackers, cheeses, veg and dip, olives, pretzels). Pleasant Rick's Cafe to sit, nosh, watch tv, use computers. Hotel very clean with wonderful staff. Rooms are smallish but were adequate for this visit. Near to subway stops restaurants and theatre. Would definitely stay again. Even received a couple of free bottles of wine for my birthday. And the bottled water is free as well. Where does that happen these days?

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A nice place to stay - not too big and close-by to all the action of Times Square. Our room was small but there was a nice reception area on the second floor where a pianist played in the afternoons and snacks and cocktails were served. The second floor area is also where a basic continental breakfast was served. Overall, a nice experience - the staff was nice too.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Enjoyed the location and stay 200 letters - what to say Hotel convenient and close to action Friendly staff that made us feel welcome They laughed at my jokes which was comfortingMore characters? what to say? We've been to New York before so caught up on other interests such as Madame Tussauds and Metropolitan Museum.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Beautiful hotel with the perfect location for all NYC activities. Even though it’s practically in time square you aren’t bothered by the noise. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Updated rooms. Great afternoon snack time also.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I like bed, i like tiger, i like spfood and the stay was cool, i like th4 f00otd i7 wa5 v3r7 n1ced to be there for ma3k3 a wishd. itd will help you fo0r tJe Make a wishd. I will tell you my experienced life in the hotel...

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My friend, Patricia K, and I went to NYC to see 3 Broadway plays and the Hotel is just around the corner to all of them! When you walk to the front of the building and the doorman opens the door with a big smile & says hello and welcome! You know you have stepped back in time at that moment and continues as you enter the beautifully done nostalgic hotel entrance, and the rooms and common areas are just as wonderful! John is an amazing manager and his staff are just as 5 star as he is! We stayed for 5 nights and everyone went out of their way to make us happy & comfortable no matter what time of day or evening! Christian was very helpful when he was working along with his co workers No one was a disappointment! We were going to Burger & Lobster for lunch, before going to see Iceman Cometh, and they asked if we wanted them to make us a reservation and they did so when we got to the restaurant ( across street) they gave us a complimentary glass of Prosecco! It's a promo they had just started and we were told we were the first to enjoy this benefit! :) I have nothing but great things to say about this hotel and they believe that you are family when you come stay with them and after! I look forward to returning to NY and staying at the Casablanca Hotel! Here's Lookin' at you Kid! Becca H

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Just around the corner from Times Square, yet quiet inside. Ricks Bar on the second floor was a bonus. It served breakfast and you could help yourself to hot drinks and snacks throughout the day. Perfect if you need a breather! Happy Hour from 5-8pm was also a great start to the evening. Wine and nibbles freely available. Beds were comfy and amenities pretty standard for a decent hotel. Would stay there again. Tony’s Italian restaurant next door was fantastic. Tip - if you don’t book a table or can’t get one, it is frantically busy. Eat at the bar, the best entertainment is the bar man, juggling all orders for drinks from the Restaurant and serving food at the bar. Totally impressive! Back to the hotel, we noticed quite a few Americans greeted with familiarity by the staff, and if that is not an endorsement, I don’t know what is. We found it perfect for our first trip to NYC The hotel limo to and from the airport is worth it.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I've travelled to NYC 3 times now from the UK and have never experienced a hotel like Casablanca. I travelled with family celebrating a big birthday for my mum and upon arrival the staff ensured we had a bottle of Prosecco in our room. We had a suite which was lovely, the rooms smell like incense and have a really warm homey feel to them. On the 2nd floor the hotel offers complementary wine and nibbles. After a long day walking round the city it is much appreciated!! I have to admit I expected the wine to taste like pee but it was gorgeous! Thank you Arabell for your excellent service! The staff at the hotel were so friendly and welcoming and nothing was too much trouble for them! We can't thank the staff at the front dest enough for getting us to the airport on time for our flight, they really went above and beyond to help us after our original driver had a crash! Tony's next door is a must!!! Never had italian food quite like it! Wish I could go back tomorrow. Anytime I visit NYC in the future I wouldn't stay anywhere other than this hotel!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: All of the staff were very helpful and couldn't do enough for us to make our stay great. The continental breakfast was very good and the breakfast staff provided us with a pot of coffee to take back to the room. Bed was very comfortable.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I was this hotel lest few mount ago it was amazing good service staff very nice helpful I really recommend this hotel I well recommend my friend this hotel definitely I well be back with my family and with friends

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I was extremely lucky to survive the Ticketmaster Verified Fan screening in October 2017 and I bought four tickets for Harry Potter and the Cursed Child show on Broadway in May 2018. This being our fourth visit to NYC, my wife insisted that we book someplace close to the Lyric Theatre on 43rd Street. A little web exploring found Casablanca Hotel a short walk away from the theatre. The price was a bit higher than what I paid for other hotels in previous visits to the city, but then those trips were not during the peak summer season, so I went ahead and booked four nights. Nevertheless, I was pleased that the hotel provided free breakfast, 24-hour coffee and snacks, and location location location.The Casablanca's helpful website provided a preview of our room, so we knew to expect it would be small, with a single three-drawer dresser, a closet, and a simple bathroom.When SuperShuttle delivered us at 10 a.m., a friendly hotel doorman greeted us and took command of our two carry-on luggage. Check-in was quick and efficient. Unfortunately, no room was available at that time of the morning, but they put our luggage in storage and said they would call when our room was ready. We were invited to go to the second floor for breakfast.My wife and I are not big breakfast eaters, so it was adequate for us. We ate yogurt, fresh fruit and pastries. She drank decaf coffee and I had hot chocolate. Other choices included cereal, hard boiled eggs, and assorted breads and bagels, which the staff offered to toast for us.Our daughter and her boyfriend live in Manhattan, so we met up for brunch. My wife and I then attended two shows that first day: a matinee performance of Frozen and an evening performance of Jersey Boys.After seeing Frozen, we returned to the hotel and learned our room (No. 408) was ready. The room was as expected, but the closet was much larger than anticipated. And it had a good number of hangers! The dresser drawers were large enough for all our clothes! And the in-room safe was large enough to hold the souvenirs we bought later! The window a/c unit was on and set at a comfortable setting. The ceiling fan kept the room from feeling stuffy.The maid service was excellent. Each day the maid left two bottles of water, two pieces of 72% cocoa chocolate, and the weather forecast for the next day. Very helpful and much appreciated. The hotel does provide free wi-fi, but it was slow so after our first attempt, we turned it off and used our cellular data. There are two small elevators, but as the hotel itself is small, the elevators were never crowded. It was also easy for us to use the stairway to get from our fourth-floor room to the second-floor dining room.The bed and pillows were very comfortable, so no complaints there. The towels and free toiletries were very good. The shower had excellent water pressure and hot water. The wash basin was small and the drainage was somewhat slow, but acceptable.On our second morning, our daughter arrived to take us to Brooklyn to meet her friends for lunch. Just as we left our room, my daughter texted for us to come quick because the staff was giving her a hard time. When we got to the lobby, she was seated in the lobby but said nothing further about it. I took the incident as an example of the hotel's security in action, so I appreciated that they challenged my daughter before allowing her to enter.Speaking of security, Times Square is a short walk away. Police security there is amazing. It seemed on every corner we saw tactical officers wearing bulletproof vests and carrying automatic rifles. Better safe than sorry.During our short stay, we attended performances of Camelot and The Boys in the Band, in addition to the two parts of Harry Potter, and went to the Museum of Modern Art. My iPhone showed I walked an average of 5 miles each day, so my wife and I looked forward to getting back to our hotel each evening. We always went to the second floor to relax with decaf coffee (her) and hot chocolate (me) before going to our room for a good night's sleep.On the morning of check-out, we got up at 4 a.m. for final packing. We took the elevator to the second floor and spent about 30 minutes relaxing with decaf coffee and hot chocolate. I also read a free copy of the NY Times and used the hotel's computer and printer to check in for our flight and print boarding passes. We finally went to the lobby at 6 a.m. to check out prior to our SuperShuttle pick up.Looking back, the Casablanca was the perfect place for our short stay. It offered everything we needed in a home away from home. No problems, no worries, so we could enjoy our time in the Big Apple.We would definitely return.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We have now stayed twice at the Casablanca Hotel and love it. The location is just 1/2 block off of Times Square and in the heart of the theater district. There are several good restaurants nearby. The service is wonderful from check-in to check-out. Excellent directions from the desk and making of dinner reservations. Our room was small but very well appointed and the furnishings were great. We loved the breakfast and availability of snacks, wine and tea. This is definitely a great place to stay in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Very nice room, great staff and location. My wife and I went to NYC for a few days to relax. Close to the theaters, the Rock and many other must see attractions. I’m about to give up as I can’t seems to get to 200 characters.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Highly recommend the CasaBblanca if you like to be close to the NY city action and a peaceful night rest. Literally steps to Time Square. Staff are golden and so kind. Ask them any questions as they are so willing to help. Breakfast choices awesome and it is complimentary. Beds and pillows were soo comfortable! Quant rooms and sound proof as I never heard anyone next door or doors opening/closing. Close to Subway, restaurants, shows. If you want to be treated like royalty, come here.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: we've stayed here several times over the years. the staff are unfailingly nice and the location can't be beat for convenience to the subway. it's always a treat to come back to this hotel. thanks again Casablanca!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I picked this hotel as my girlfriend and I were attending several shows. From the moment we walked in the staff was warm and welcoming. We had a Queen suite on the 3rd floor. We could not hear any noise from the street or other rooms. The complimentary breakfast and happy hour were a delight and we met some fellow travelers. We both enjoyed the bagels which the staff toasted to perfection. The staff made a reservation for us at Burger and Lobster which is almost across the street from the hotel. A million thanks to the manager John who checked on me and kept on checking on me after I tripped going out the restaurant next door the night before I left.Also thanks to the staff and John for finding me a taxi to JFK on a busy Friday. I will only stay at this hotel in the future when I visit NYC!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Before we ever arrived, Frank was so very helpful in recommending restaurants, then making reservations for us. Upon arrival, you leave the bedlam of Times Square behind, as you enter the calm interior. We are repeat visitors. Our rooms were charming as ever. After checking in, we returned to the lounge for complimentary wine, cheese, olives, etc. The same lounge serves a very nice complimentary breakfast ... fruit, yogurt, pastries, bagels, cereals, hard boiled eggs. Since I'm not a lover of hardboiled eggs, the only other thing I could ask for would be some cheese or cold cuts --- some other form of protein than the eggs. The rest of the time, the same lounge offers coffee, espresso, cookies 24/7. Yes, the 4 of us have loved every visit we've made to the Casablanca --- our home away from home in NYC.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Good hotel, location superb, complimentary lounge very comfortable, comp. breakfast (no eggs/bacon etc.) comp. glass of wine etc. 5pm/7pm Room dark but very comfortable Staff superb Great to meet and talk to other guests from all over the world at wine time

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We enjoyed our week's stay at the Casablanca. Very helpful and friendly staff in reception and the 2nd floor breakfast and wine area. Our room was small, quiet, and comfortable- on the 6th floor. Welcomed with a bottle of prosecco in our room. Loved the bathrobes, toiletries, daily complimentary bottles of water and chocolate squares on our bed. Great breakfast from 7-10:30am weekdays to 11am weekends- delicious fresh fruit salad, fresh squeezed orange juice, pastries, hard boiled eggs, bagels, yogurt etc- plus coffee machine with latte, expresso and other options. At 5pm there complimentary wine, cheese, vegetables, bread and crackers. Plus coffee, fruit, pastries, and cookies available 24 hours! The hotel is a 1/2 block from Times Square- but quiet!! Great location for all subway lines. We'll be back!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I came into midtown Manhattan for a birthday celebration and was looking for a central location, which can be somewhat complicated by the fact that I'm a light sleeper. My first reaction after reading all the great reviews was "nah, too good to be true". But it was true!! I had a very restful and delightful stay. As is common with NYC hotel rooms, they're not large; but very clean, quiet, comfortable, and functional. Nice complementary buffet breakfast and "wine & cheese" happy hour. Excellent staff that was genuinely friendly and helpful. Exceeded my expectations and then some. Delighted with my stay and looking forward to returning. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Came here for a 5 nights stay with my girlfriend. Ended up coming home with a fiancee! Had the most special holiday together and the hotel was just everything we hoped for! The staff were so friendly and attentive they really do make your experience so much better! The room was perfect lovely comfy bed good air con/heating and the hotel was in the perfect location. Next to everything you would need to explore new York and not miss out on anything. The wine and cheese selection along with the tea/coffee and biscuits all free of charge just added to the value for money. Breakfast choice was good better than any other hotels weve stayed in. Couldnt of asked for anything else! Thankyou so much for such a special holiday!!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Fantastic hotel and staff make it a home from home. Great breakfast and lounge facilities during the day. Wine and cheese in the evening a real bonus. Perfect location in midtown near to everything but quit once you walk through the door. Great rooms perfectly equipped. Can't imagine a better hotel in New York!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Casablanca is in an excellent location, if you are attending Broadway theater. And it is just steps away from the Times Square subway stop, so it's a pretty good location for anything you might want to do in NYC. The rooms are small and the décor is dated, and the bathrooms have almost no counter space, but given the price of the rooms, those are minor defects. The lounge on the second floor is a very comfortable amenity -- fresh fruit and coffee available all day long; complimentary breakfast; complimentary happy hour with snacks and wine. You don't come her for luxury, but it's comfortable and convenient.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Generally I avoid staying in Times Square. As a displaced New Yorker the only redeeming factor about Times Square is its proximity to the theaters. But...this past weekend we had tickets to a Sunday matinee and due to logistics, Times Square really made the most sense for us. I did my research and we decided to give the Casablanca a try.Let me say - what a treat!!! So much of a treat that I have put this hotel on my list as places to stay the next time I come down to NY for a weekend.The hotel is small and wonderfully warm and welcoming. The staff were all lovely and called us by name each and every time we walked in the door.The hotel is quiet...and I do mean quiet!!! The happy hour and breakfast both in Rick's Cafe were delicious and relaxing and the staff working there were all so lovely.But the true highlight for us - was that when we returned after our matinee to pick up our bags (this time with our kids in tow) and asked to use their restrooms before we got on the road, the staff was not only gracious but invited us to enjoy the happy hour once again and told us that "The Casablanca is still your home, please join us". Well...that was just perfection!!! We were able to get a little coffee (and delicious coffee) before our drive home and a snack so that we could make it all the way home without a stop along the way.Thank you to everyone at the Casablanca - you have a long term guest in us!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Exceptionally courteous staff, at all times..very willing to assist. Best customer service I have ever encountered. Beautiful decor throughout the hotel, accented will the "Casablanca"/movie paraphernalia. A luxurious room which catered to every need including a DVD collection. A warm heartfelt thank you to the staff (sorry the exact names can't be recalled), your exceptional service was more than noteworthy. Thank you for the best hotel experience

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Absolutely loved the Casablanca hotel. Firstly the staff were all amazing, so friendly and helpful. Walking through the door was like coming home - only better because everything had been cleaned and tidied and there was free wine. :) The beds were sooo comfortable, the rooms were nicely decorated and you had everything you needed to hand. Breakfast was fresh and plentiful and to top it all, it was situated in a great location. The perfect base for our trip to NYC. Many thanks.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The service is first class. The room/suite we had was on the top floor at the back of the building so no view, but so so quiet, no traffic noise and no noise from other guests. After the hustle and bustle of the city, perfect!! The cheese and wine in the evening just capped of a great experience at the hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Friendly, staff, great service, comfortable room and great breakfast and happy hour. Loved the toiletries and the nightly chocolates. Next time, we will get a mini fridge to keep drinks cold. Rick’s Cafe is a relaxing place to meet family members, chill out or meet new people.
user_name:
Coty D
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Everything about the Experience was great. The staff was so friendly and professional. They greet you every time you walk in and are so helpful with anything you may need. The rooms were clean the beds were comfortable. Love the wine and cheese and Moraccan music they put on the radio in the rooms In he evening.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Every single person on the staff was extremely helpful. Whatever questions we had, they answered. They had helpful suggestions on places to eat, places to visit. The breakfast was fresh and the afternoon wine and cheese was good. After a couple of nights there, every time I walked into the hotel, I felt like I had arrived home.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I love this hotel. A quiet oasis just steps away from Times Square. The perfect location for enjoying a Broadway show. We were there to celebrate my daughter's 35th birthday and there had been a glitch in our reservation. Asim Burondker, the front office manager, went above and beyond to resolve the issue and had a birthday cake and champagne waiting for us in our room. A delightful hotel and we had an excellent stay. I highly recommend the Casablanca Hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I have enjoyed a stay at the Casablanca Hotel NYC Times Square on many occasions. I have come with friends and family and we always have a fabulous stay. The staff is extremely helpful and the amenities are top notch. When you walk in you feel like you are at home.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Good location, the wine and cheese was a great addition to the hotel amenities. Having the lounge area help with the space of the single room. All the staff were very professional and helpful when needed!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Hotel is located close to Times Square, theatres and walking distance to most things. Staff are always willing to answer questions and are very helpful. The room on the second floor which is available for the breakfast, wine and cheese and just relaxing is a very nice touch. The rooms had ever thing that you needed and were well laid out.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Staying at the Casablanca Hotel is a very pleasant experience. The staff is consistently helpful; the rooms are clean, quiet and comfortable. The location of the hotel is great for all the on-going activities in the area.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We've had a wonderful experience staying at the Casablanca in Times Square.Staff was friendly and competent, the room was excellent and we've had the best breakfasts that we could imagine!Spot on the wine and cheese reception from 5pm to 8pm. A real surprise and most welcomed.Outside? New York. Could you ask for more?

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The entire hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and made us feel very welcome, and we received great service even after check out !. The room was very nice and tidy with all the things you need. 24 hour coffee, fruit and tea, a good continental breakfast and on top of this a 3 hour complimentary wine, cheese and fruit buffet every day ! It is not a cheap hotel but absolutely worth the money !

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Just returned from my second visit to New York - stayed at the Casablanca both times and will do so in the future. Staff is amazing, incredibly helpful and friendly. Hotel has generous policies with no hidden costs. Location is perfect for theatres. It was wonderful to walk from the neon chaos of Time Square into the old world charm of the Casablanca.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Once again, a great stay at the Casablanca. This is the 6th time we have stayed here. As always, the staff is outstanding, as is the location. All of our requests were handled well, with a smile. The Breakfast and happy hour are both wonderful. As returning guests, the hotel placed a bottle of wine in our room, which was nice. We will be back.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We stayed at Casablanca Hotel the last two times we visited NYC. All of the staff was wonderful in making sure our needs were met. The staff in the lounge was particularly attentive and welcoming and went out of their way to help and make you feel at home, both for breakfast and for the “cocktail” hour. The hotel’s location was very convenient, and the rooms were clean and charming. We love this hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I come to NYC every year and have for over 20 years. I have stayed at the other Library Hotel Collection hotels but this one is the best! I have stayed at the Elysee and the GIraffe. Both are excellent and offer different experiences. The location of the Casa Blanca is in the middle of everything and has easy access to Grand Central Station. You are easy walking distance of the theatre district which is a big plus, if you have experienced the madness after the shows get out.The staff makes you feel at home and make a real effort to accommodate your needs.The restaurant next door is one of the best Italian in NYC, They will deliver to your room or to the second floor "Ricky's Café". We came for business and with some friends. We will stay here again next Spring for sure!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We had a 4 night stay in April 2018 - this is a very well located hotel with a small reception area, first impressions could be misleading as there is not a vast expanse of marble / brass as in some of the larger hotels. We arrived early around 1.30pm, check in is from 3.00pm, while our room was not ready, we did the check in formalities which includes a credit card hold for incidentals (we have no issue with this as it is common in most hotels). The hotel held our luggage and invited us to wait in the 2nd floor "Ricks Cafe" where coffee, tea and pastries are available 24/7.When our room was ready, we had a Premium King room (#501) - good size room to the inner courtyard with a small window over the AC unit and one in the bathroom.The bed was comfortable, room well laid out and bathroom a good size with an over bath shower. Not great was the lack of ventilation in the bathroom which filled with steam pretty quickly when showering, an extract fan would be an advantage although we opened the window and the fresh air seemed to vent the bathroom pretty quickly - may be more of an issue with extreme weather, i.e. cold or hot.In room safe in cupboard and plenty of hanging space. Complimentary in room water bottle each day and chocolate each night were nice touches.Ricks cafe as mentioned has coffee and pastries 24/7 and there is a continental breakfast provided with cereals, pastries, breads and bagels, fruit and preserves all included and wine, cheese and fruit every night from 5 - 8.00pm which again was a great touch. All staff without exception were excellent.Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would stay here again when in NYC. A nice parting touch while we were waiting for our airport transfer was a brief chat with John Taboada (Hotel GM) who also put our bags into the transfer shuttle, thanks for a great stay with you.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Well, we actually didn’t book this hotel because of the under 21 policy in the new year’s eve, but I have to say that these guys are really professional and assertive.Just earlier today I sent a request mail which they prompt response and they were so kind to indicate other hotel in the square that allow children in nye.As we are very keen to see the ball drop from a comfortable private and with a lot of champagne place we will book another place, but will definitely book with this hotel in another trip do NY.Again many thanks for the useful insights.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My first visit to New York and it couldn't have been any better. Times Square, only a half a block away, is left behind when you enter the lobby of the Casablanca.The customer service is superb. Arriving early, we accepted their offer to stow our bags and relax in the breakfast room where a generous continental breakfast was still being served. At the end of our stay we did the same. Our room overlooked the tiny courtyard, which contained a small patio. We heard virtually nothing from outside or from other rooms. A super comfortable bed with a thick memory foam pad made for pleasant dreams. Continental breakfast, multiple coffee choices, a pleasant evening reception, gym privileges nearby, car service for hire if you desire, five minutes to the theaters, everything you want right outside the door. Choose this hotel.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My husband and I just returned from a first time visit to New York and we stayed at the Casablanca Hotel. This hotel was amazing from the moment we stepped into the lobby we were greeted with a smile and welcome from the hotel staff. Every employee we came in contact with made us feel welcome and did everything they could to make our stay comfortable. We enjoyed the amenities such as continental breakfast in the morning and wine and cheese in the evening. The rooms were clean and beds and pillows were comfortable. One evening it started raining and they gave us an umbrella to avoid getting wet. I will recommend the Casablanca Hotel to all our friends and family traveling to NY.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel is just great! The value is worth ever single cent, as an asian here in New York this hotel is just a stone throw away from time square, the staff was courteous, the interior design was lovely, the breakfast had a large selection, i will surely stay here again if i ever had the chance to visit New York for the second time.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The Staff here was AMAZING!! The location is perfect and very clean. We loved the décor and the 2nd floor room for gathering and snacks. We will definitely stay here again the next time we visit the Big Apple.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I love this hotel. I am a native New Yorker who needs a NY dose once every year or 2. This place feels like home. The staff are so kind and courteous and Rick lounge is great for breakfast or anytime you want to rekax. It's like being on the concierge floor of a much more expensive hotel. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Overall 1st class hotel. Very good standard of service from all the staff. Ideally situated near Times Square although very noisy outside but very peaceful in the hotel. Breakfast had a good selection available. Recommend and will be back. Cafe was open 24/7 and every night between 5–8pm free wine and cheese.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: What I love about this hotel is the service and location. They offer free breakfast and free happy hour with wine and cheese. I love to be able to walk in Manhattan and come back to the happy hour to relax, eat and recharge. It does not have the cookie cutter hotel lobby feeling.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We just got back from a two night stay with our son, daughter-in-law and their two children. My wife and I had a king size bed in one of their standard rooms and our son’s family had a two room mini-suite. Our room was not large in size, but it did have a good size bathroom with one sink, storage shelving and a great adjustable rain head shower and bathtub. Our son’s mini suite was spacious by New York standards and had two queen size beds in the bedroom and a sitting room with a separate TV in the entry area. Rooms were well appointed and extremely quiet. We were actually glad that their rooms were interior facing, as a blocked out the ever present street noise.The hotel was extremely well located, just adjacent to Times Square and all of the Broadway attractions. The parking lot was just adjacent to the hotel and with the hotel’s ticket validation, it provides a 50% discount rates. Nice parking lot with good access and accessibility.Hotel is small by any standards, but on Thursday personalized level of attention. Small lobby area that is tight and had 2 somewhat dated elevators that according to our granddaughter felt like a trampoline. The rooms, hallways and all areas were immaculate.The highlight of the hotel was the second floor café area that serves a very nice continental breakfast and wine and cheese from 5 to 8 PM every day. It was quiet, a nice size, and always provided enough space for six people in our group to spread out at a table and enjoy some quiet relaxing time with the family. The area was also well staffed. The very personal staff assisted in dealing with any food related issues, cleaned up areas, toasted bagels, made oatmeal, and handled any and all questions. The area was a serene oasis from the hustle bustle of the city.The hotel was close by to the Saint James Theater where we saw “Frozen” We took advantage of the close proximity to a number of Times Square attractions. We collectively thought this was a wonderful location and venue, especially to enjoy some quiet times in the second floor of the hotel as a family in a serene environment we had never experienced in the hotels in and around the Theater District. Good value for the money and a relaxing stay in a city where relaxation is not the norm.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights last week. We had a lovely time!! The hotel is so convenient, being just 100 feet from Times Square, but you honestly wouldn't know, given the quiet once you're inside. With just 48 rooms, it's an intimate hotel, very cosy and feels homely.Our room, 508, was spacious and welcoming. All staff were friendly, helpful and courteous.The complimentary breakfast is very welcome, and offers a lot of choice, and the complimentary cheese and wine for three hours each night is fantastic, and makes a nice start to our evening activities. Rick's Cafe is available 24/7, offering pastries, tea, coffee and juice. We loved it here, and will return once our feet have recovered from all the walking we did!!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: I booked the room because of the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor and I was not disappointed! This boutique hotel was nestled between two restaurants and only a mere hundred feet from Times Square ! You would’ve never known it was there. The staff went above and beyond customer service and very accommodating. The rooms were very clean and quiet and not a bad size for a New York hotel. If you do you stay there, visit Tony’s restaurant next-door. You will not be disappointed!Thank you Casablanca for making our New York stay better than ever!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This small hotel provides excellent service with a personal feel. The room was lovely, the bathroom surprisingly spacious and spotlessly clean. The well-appointed common area is a cozy spot to enjoy a cup of coffee or tea any time of day or night.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This hotel has some old time charm. It really is like stepping back in time. They have free breakfast in the morning, huge perk! I have never stayed in a hotel in the city that offered free breakfast. It is an ok selection, mostly cold items. Nothing amazing but a plus nonetheless. They also have a cocktail hour every evening. This is also an awesome perk you don't usually get in the city. They have wine, cheese and crackers, other small snack items. This was really welcomed after being in the city working for the day. This is my go to hotel when I come to NYC for business. The location is great for Times Square. You are right there. I would frequently have to visit the Bryant Park area for work and it is a short walk. It is just an all around good location for restaurants, shopping, and sight seeing. The staff are awesome. One thing to note, this hotel does bring in an older crowd. Most everyone staying here the few times I have stayed are what I would equate to retirees. I don't know if I would bring my family to this hotel because of that. I saw a lady and her child for breakfast and you could clearly see most the guests getting annoyed while the child was speaking loudly and just being a kid in my opinion. Some of the guests even complained. That being said, I think this hotel is great for business people, singles, and couples who just want a quiet, relaxing hotel. Stay here, you will love it!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: We have just returned from a ten day family reunion at Casablanca. As always, staff is wonderful, hospitality is tops, breakfast crew with best smiles and food and front desk is ready to help in anyway! All this at a boutique hotel oasis right off Times Square! Heart of hotel is Ricks Cafe where breakfast, coffee/sweets through day and happy hour at night takes place! It feels like home. John Taboada, General Manager, heads this wonderful hotel! Thanks John for taking care of reservations, recommendations, having a great staff and all you did to make out trip to our favorite hotel wonderful! If possible, every visit just gets better for all your quests! A place where everyone knows your name!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Spotless rooms and a wonderful staff make your stay unforgettable. The whole staff goes out of their way to make you feel at home and take care of anything you need. Tucked away in Times Square it is like stepping in another world of tranquility and relaxation with the craziness just outside your door. Everything is just a stones throws away. I would not consider staying anywhere but here next time I come to the city. Use them to get your restaurant reservations if you want to be sure to get a table.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: This is a great hotel smack in the middle of the theaters -- but quiet with the best service I've ever had. They really go out of their way to make visit perfect. Continental breakfast and cocktails are included. Bed was so comfortable! It was luxurious!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: The below is a shortened email I sent to Asim, Front Office Manager of the Casablanca Hotel. Thank him and his staff regarding our stay. Excellent stay and staff:- Dear Asim,Front Office ManagerCasablanca HotelJust thought I would write to thank you again regarding our stay in your Casablanca Hotel in NYC.We have stayed a few times in New York in other Hotels, so we know what to expect with this great, but mad city!I would like to personally thank you and your staff for a lovely stay. We had a great stay. We went to some shows. Done some repeat trips as well as new trips around the city.As I told you while at the Hotel, I understand the concept, the boutique style of the Hotel and really liked the Hotel. As you know we had a minor maintenance issue, over a day or so but it was quickly rectified by Carlos the maintenance guy. Who was very professional For your information. This did not affect our stay in any aspect. But that’s the character of your Hotel. It's an old building, in a Location that cant be beat. The room was always clean.You lead professionally. You are approachable, professional, understanding a really friendly guy, you offered us a new room regarding the issue, but we confirmed we were fine and happy with our room. Your staff are a credit to you and John, the General Manager.Even the guy (cant remember his name but originally from Ecuador) who came to fix the coffee machine, prior to the cheese and wine evenings, we had a joke with him. I loved your Hotel, and I would consider the Library Collection again when back in NYC, fully understand the concept, the decor, loved it.But the best part of your Hotel are your staff, they are a credit to you and you have selected/recruited wisely. All the staff we came into contact with, are a credit to you and the Casablanca HotelThey were all professional, always trying to help, to assist and ask if there was anything they could do. Ie staff at reception, breakfast, evening staff, some staff I cant recall their names.But the staff I do recall their names, I would like you to thank for both of us - to Margareth (birthday girl). Margareth was lovely, funny, we also got some of her birthday cake via yourself. But then realised and said to Margareth, she may have wanted to take some pictures of it or take it home instead of sharing a piece With and me and my other half. Ha HaHer quick reply, we are "special friends" and we can share her cake!! Lovely lady.Arabella, Kimberley who served cheese and evening drinks ( with Margareth). They were also excellent, friendly, professional and all had a good sense of humour. We had a joke and laugh with them all.Breakfast staff - Maria and two other female staff (one I think was called Miriam, the other lady I don't know her name). Again, all friendly, professional and they got used to what we wanted for breakfast. Maria was very personable.We met Frank in the lift, and we chatted, it was only the next day I realised he was a staff member on the Front Reception! (I thought he was a guest, he was coming on duty that day in the lift). Again, Frank was very pleasant, professional. As well as Dimitri who we came across, but he failed to help me beat the wife on a computer crossword puzzle game! When he was doing his rounds.Carlos, who fixed our maintenance problem. He is a great guy, friendly, professional and due to the leak I had to use the towels to clean up. He stated he would ensure with the cleaners we got fresh new towels and he sorted the leak out/blockage. We bumped into Carlos a few times and had friendly chats.To be honest all the staff we came across were excellent, professional, customer focussed. They showed you and the owners in a good light.I loved our stay, it went too fast. The location, the staff, character of the hotel were excellent. Faultless.But the staff made it for us. Including yourself in that aspect.We are well travelled, like to relax, wear comfy clothes instead of uniforms, suits for work. It's our down time and wear comfy relaxed clothes. Don’t dress to impress Ha Ha.Your Hotel is professional, small boutique hotel, but not full of airs and graces. It is, like a home from home. That appealed to us. Not pompous, stuffy. We liked that and the staff interaction.I would just point out, that the staff would only interact with guests, if guests wanted them to. We wanted them to! I am very observant. They were professional, customer focussed to other guests in the breakfast room/piano bar or around the Hotel. Some guests were a bit "sharp" sometimes, a bit rude ie " No Please or Thank You" from the guests, but your staff dealt with them admirably as I watched on.It was lovely to meet you.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: Excellent hotel and service Will visit again and hope to tell othersGreat breakfast room, help with dinner reservations and general help and support. Thanks to all staff for everything and making our stay perfect

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: best hotel ever! Friendly and attentive to our needs. Full breakfast and wine and cheese was awesome. Subway only a block away and short trip to train station. They let us hold luggage after checkout until our late train.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: this was our first, but not our last time staying at the Casablanca. place is in a great location--less than 1/2 block from times square yet well protected from the noise. rooms nicely laid out and furnished, as well as the bathroom. staff were gracious and helpful, especially in the breakfast room. breakfast and happy hour were perfect.

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: A truly gem in Times Square. From the very moment you step into their lobby you are pampered as an old friend coming back, even if it's your first visit. Sebastian greeted us with genuine smiles and took care of our luggage, while explaining the hotel perks ; he always smiled , calling us by name, every time we passed by.Every staff member showed real interest in making our stay a memorable one. Excellent customer service. Be sure to book a room matching your expectations for space (IMHO the less expensive rooms are really small), we had a PREMIUM ROOM KING with plenty of space, bath robes, slippers, good quality toiletries. The bathroom seemed just renovated and everything was sparkling clean. Rooms and common spaces are well themed and you feel like being in a luxury hotel in “old” Morocco. Rick cafè (named from the famous movie Casablanca) is very convenient, you can find there (for free) snacks and refreshments all day long and a special cheese and wine reception between 5.00PM and 7.00PM. At breakfast time a lovely young lady (Cannot remember her name, she is so sweet and gentle) will offer you freshly baked pastries, while merrily chatting with guests. Worth to note the location : just behind Times Square, yet quiet and noiseless. A relaxing oasis just in the middle of bustling NYC !!Highly recommended, we have already booked another stay!

hotel_name: Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
review_body: My mom and I were in NYC for a long weekend. It was my first time visiting NYC and couldn't be happier for my selection of hotel and location. The Casablanca offered excellent service, great rates and daily (complimentary) breakfast and happy hour of wine and cheese in a cozy eating area which was great and appreciated. The hotel has charm and rooms were well appointed, clean and larger than expected. What makes this hotel stand apart from others is their top notch service and staff. The front desk/ concierge staff were phenomenal and made us feel at home immediately. They provided excellent recommendations and assisted me in arrangements for the private transportation to/from the airport which aligned perfectly with our schedule. It was so nice to not worrying as I knew they would have me covered. It is rare to find folks smiling and attentive no matter the time of day. They made our trip and will definitely chose Casablanca hotel the next time I come to NYC.
